module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ParameterConstraints

-- | The constraints that the administrator has put on the parameter.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newParameterConstraints</a> smart constructor.
data ParameterConstraints
ParameterConstraints' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> ParameterConstraints

-- | A numeric value that determines the largest numeric value you want to
--   allow for <tt>Number</tt> types.
[$sel:maxValue:ParameterConstraints'] :: ParameterConstraints -> Maybe Text

-- | An integer value that determines the largest number of characters you
--   want to allow for <tt>String</tt> types.
[$sel:maxLength:ParameterConstraints'] :: ParameterConstraints -> Maybe Text

-- | A string that explains a constraint when the constraint is violated.
--   For example, without a constraint description, a parameter that has an
--   allowed pattern of <tt>[A-Za-z0-9]+</tt> displays the following error
--   message when the user specifies an invalid value:
--   
--   <pre>
--   Malformed input-Parameter MyParameter must match pattern [A-Za-z0-9]+
--   </pre>
--   
--   By adding a constraint description, such as must only contain letters
--   (uppercase and lowercase) and numbers, you can display the following
--   customized error message:
--   
--   <pre>
--   Malformed input-Parameter MyParameter must only contain uppercase and lowercase letters and numbers.
--   </pre>
[$sel:constraintDescription:ParameterConstraints'] :: ParameterConstraints -> Maybe Text

-- | An integer value that determines the smallest number of characters you
--   want to allow for <tt>String</tt> types.
[$sel:minLength:ParameterConstraints'] :: ParameterConstraints -> Maybe Text

-- | A regular expression that represents the patterns that allow for
--   <tt>String</tt> types. The pattern must match the entire parameter
--   value provided.
[$sel:allowedPattern:ParameterConstraints'] :: ParameterConstraints -> Maybe Text

-- | The values that the administrator has allowed for the parameter.
[$sel:allowedValues:ParameterConstraints'] :: ParameterConstraints -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A numeric value that determines the smallest numeric value you want to
--   allow for <tt>Number</tt> types.
[$sel:minValue:ParameterConstraints'] :: ParameterConstraints -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ParameterConstraints</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxValue:ParameterConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>parameterConstraints_maxValue</a> - A numeric value that determines
--   the largest numeric value you want to allow for <tt>Number</tt> types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxLength:ParameterConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>parameterConstraints_maxLength</a> - An integer value that
--   determines the largest number of characters you want to allow for
--   <tt>String</tt> types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:constraintDescription:ParameterConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>parameterConstraints_constraintDescription</a> - A string that
--   explains a constraint when the constraint is violated. For example,
--   without a constraint description, a parameter that has an allowed
--   pattern of <tt>[A-Za-z0-9]+</tt> displays the following error message
--   when the user specifies an invalid value:
--   
--   <pre>
--   Malformed input-Parameter MyParameter must match pattern [A-Za-z0-9]+
--   </pre>
--   
--   By adding a constraint description, such as must only contain letters
--   (uppercase and lowercase) and numbers, you can display the following
--   customized error message:
--   
--   <pre>
--   Malformed input-Parameter MyParameter must only contain uppercase and lowercase letters and numbers.
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:minLength:ParameterConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>parameterConstraints_minLength</a> - An integer value that
--   determines the smallest number of characters you want to allow for
--   <tt>String</tt> types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedPattern:ParameterConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>parameterConstraints_allowedPattern</a> - A regular expression that
--   represents the patterns that allow for <tt>String</tt> types. The
--   pattern must match the entire parameter value provided.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedValues:ParameterConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>parameterConstraints_allowedValues</a> - The values that the
--   administrator has allowed for the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minValue:ParameterConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>parameterConstraints_minValue</a> - A numeric value that determines
--   the smallest numeric value you want to allow for <tt>Number</tt>
--   types.
newParameterConstraints :: ParameterConstraints

-- | A numeric value that determines the largest numeric value you want to
--   allow for <tt>Number</tt> types.
parameterConstraints_maxValue :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)

-- | An integer value that determines the largest number of characters you
--   want to allow for <tt>String</tt> types.
parameterConstraints_maxLength :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)

-- | A string that explains a constraint when the constraint is violated.
--   For example, without a constraint description, a parameter that has an
--   allowed pattern of <tt>[A-Za-z0-9]+</tt> displays the following error
--   message when the user specifies an invalid value:
--   
--   <pre>
--   Malformed input-Parameter MyParameter must match pattern [A-Za-z0-9]+
--   </pre>
--   
--   By adding a constraint description, such as must only contain letters
--   (uppercase and lowercase) and numbers, you can display the following
--   customized error message:
--   
--   <pre>
--   Malformed input-Parameter MyParameter must only contain uppercase and lowercase letters and numbers.
--   </pre>
parameterConstraints_constraintDescription :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)

-- | An integer value that determines the smallest number of characters you
--   want to allow for <tt>String</tt> types.
parameterConstraints_minLength :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)

-- | A regular expression that represents the patterns that allow for
--   <tt>String</tt> types. The pattern must match the entire parameter
--   value provided.
parameterConstraints_allowedPattern :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)

-- | The values that the administrator has allowed for the parameter.
parameterConstraints_allowedValues :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe [Text])

-- | A numeric value that determines the smallest numeric value you want to
--   allow for <tt>Number</tt> types.
parameterConstraints_minValue :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ParameterConstraints.ParameterConstraints
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ParameterConstraints.ParameterConstraints
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ParameterConstraints.ParameterConstraints
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ParameterConstraints.ParameterConstraints
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ParameterConstraints.ParameterConstraints
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ParameterConstraints.ParameterConstraints
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ParameterConstraints.ParameterConstraints

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.PortfolioShareDetail

-- | Information about the portfolio share.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPortfolioShareDetail</a> smart constructor.
data PortfolioShareDetail
PortfolioShareDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe DescribePortfolioShareType -> Maybe Bool -> PortfolioShareDetail

-- | The identifier of the recipient entity that received the portfolio
--   share. The recipient entities can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>An external account.</li>
--   <li>An organziation member account.</li>
--   <li>An organzational unit (OU).</li>
--   <li>The organization itself. (This shares with every account in the
--   organization).</li>
--   </ol>
[$sel:principalId:PortfolioShareDetail'] :: PortfolioShareDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether TagOptions sharing is enabled or disabled for the
--   portfolio share.
[$sel:shareTagOptions:PortfolioShareDetail'] :: PortfolioShareDetail -> Maybe Bool

-- | The type of the portfolio share.
[$sel:type':PortfolioShareDetail'] :: PortfolioShareDetail -> Maybe DescribePortfolioShareType

-- | Indicates whether the shared portfolio is imported by the recipient
--   account. If the recipient is in an organization node, the share is
--   automatically imported, and the field is always set to true.
[$sel:accepted:PortfolioShareDetail'] :: PortfolioShareDetail -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>PortfolioShareDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:principalId:PortfolioShareDetail'</a>,
--   <a>portfolioShareDetail_principalId</a> - The identifier of the
--   recipient entity that received the portfolio share. The recipient
--   entities can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>An external account.</li>
--   <li>An organziation member account.</li>
--   <li>An organzational unit (OU).</li>
--   <li>The organization itself. (This shares with every account in the
--   organization).</li>
--   </ol>
--   
--   <a>$sel:shareTagOptions:PortfolioShareDetail'</a>,
--   <a>portfolioShareDetail_shareTagOptions</a> - Indicates whether
--   TagOptions sharing is enabled or disabled for the portfolio share.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':PortfolioShareDetail'</a>,
--   <a>portfolioShareDetail_type</a> - The type of the portfolio share.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accepted:PortfolioShareDetail'</a>,
--   <a>portfolioShareDetail_accepted</a> - Indicates whether the shared
--   portfolio is imported by the recipient account. If the recipient is in
--   an organization node, the share is automatically imported, and the
--   field is always set to true.
newPortfolioShareDetail :: PortfolioShareDetail

-- | The identifier of the recipient entity that received the portfolio
--   share. The recipient entities can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>An external account.</li>
--   <li>An organziation member account.</li>
--   <li>An organzational unit (OU).</li>
--   <li>The organization itself. (This shares with every account in the
--   organization).</li>
--   </ol>
portfolioShareDetail_principalId :: Lens' PortfolioShareDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether TagOptions sharing is enabled or disabled for the
--   portfolio share.
portfolioShareDetail_shareTagOptions :: Lens' PortfolioShareDetail (Maybe Bool)

-- | The type of the portfolio share.
portfolioShareDetail_type :: Lens' PortfolioShareDetail (Maybe DescribePortfolioShareType)

-- | Indicates whether the shared portfolio is imported by the recipient
--   account. If the recipient is in an organization node, the share is
--   automatically imported, and the field is always set to true.
portfolioShareDetail_accepted :: Lens' PortfolioShareDetail (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.PortfolioShareDetail.PortfolioShareDetail
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.PortfolioShareDetail.PortfolioShareDetail
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.PortfolioShareDetail.PortfolioShareDetail
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.PortfolioShareDetail.PortfolioShareDetail
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.PortfolioShareDetail.PortfolioShareDetail
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.PortfolioShareDetail.PortfolioShareDetail
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.PortfolioShareDetail.PortfolioShareDetail

[$sel:principalARN:Principal'] :: Principal -> Maybe Text

--   fields.

--

--   The ARN of the principal (IAM user, role, or group).
newPrincipal :: Principal

principal_principalARN :: Lens' Principal (Maybe Text)

--   count of the products that match the value.

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProductViewSummary

-- | Summary information about a product view.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProductViewSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ProductViewSummary
ProductViewSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ProductType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ProductViewSummary

-- | The owner of the product. Contact the product administrator for the
--   significance of this value.
[$sel:owner:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL information to obtain support for this Product.
[$sel:supportUrl:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Short description of the product.
[$sel:shortDescription:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether the product has a default path. If the product does
--   not have a default path, call ListLaunchPaths to disambiguate between
--   paths. Otherwise, ListLaunchPaths is not required, and the output of
--   ProductViewSummary can be used directly with
--   DescribeProvisioningParameters.
[$sel:hasDefaultPath:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Bool

-- | The distributor of the product. Contact the product administrator for
--   the significance of this value.
[$sel:distributor:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the product.
[$sel:name:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The product view identifier.
[$sel:id:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The product type. Contact the product administrator for the
--   significance of this value. If this value is <tt>MARKETPLACE</tt>, the
--   product was created by AWS Marketplace.
[$sel:type':ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe ProductType

-- | The email contact information to obtain support for this Product.
[$sel:supportEmail:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The product identifier.
[$sel:productId:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the support for this Product.
[$sel:supportDescription:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ProductViewSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:owner:ProductViewSummary'</a>, <a>productViewSummary_owner</a>
--   - The owner of the product. Contact the product administrator for the
--   significance of this value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportUrl:ProductViewSummary'</a>,
--   <a>productViewSummary_supportUrl</a> - The URL information to obtain
--   support for this Product.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shortDescription:ProductViewSummary'</a>,
--   <a>productViewSummary_shortDescription</a> - Short description of the
--   product.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasDefaultPath:ProductViewSummary'</a>,
--   <a>productViewSummary_hasDefaultPath</a> - Indicates whether the
--   product has a default path. If the product does not have a default
--   path, call ListLaunchPaths to disambiguate between paths. Otherwise,
--   ListLaunchPaths is not required, and the output of ProductViewSummary
--   can be used directly with DescribeProvisioningParameters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:distributor:ProductViewSummary'</a>,
--   <a>productViewSummary_distributor</a> - The distributor of the
--   product. Contact the product administrator for the significance of
--   this value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ProductViewSummary'</a>, <a>productViewSummary_name</a> -
--   The name of the product.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ProductViewSummary'</a>, <a>productViewSummary_id</a> - The
--   product view identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ProductViewSummary'</a>, <a>productViewSummary_type</a>
--   - The product type. Contact the product administrator for the
--   significance of this value. If this value is <tt>MARKETPLACE</tt>, the
--   product was created by AWS Marketplace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportEmail:ProductViewSummary'</a>,
--   <a>productViewSummary_supportEmail</a> - The email contact information
--   to obtain support for this Product.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productId:ProductViewSummary'</a>,
--   <a>productViewSummary_productId</a> - The product identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportDescription:ProductViewSummary'</a>,
--   <a>productViewSummary_supportDescription</a> - The description of the
--   support for this Product.
newProductViewSummary :: ProductViewSummary

-- | The owner of the product. Contact the product administrator for the
--   significance of this value.
productViewSummary_owner :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL information to obtain support for this Product.
productViewSummary_supportUrl :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Short description of the product.
productViewSummary_shortDescription :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether the product has a default path. If the product does
--   not have a default path, call ListLaunchPaths to disambiguate between
--   paths. Otherwise, ListLaunchPaths is not required, and the output of
--   ProductViewSummary can be used directly with
--   DescribeProvisioningParameters.
productViewSummary_hasDefaultPath :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Bool)

-- | The distributor of the product. Contact the product administrator for
--   the significance of this value.
productViewSummary_distributor :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the product.
productViewSummary_name :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The product view identifier.
productViewSummary_id :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The product type. Contact the product administrator for the
--   significance of this value. If this value is <tt>MARKETPLACE</tt>, the
--   product was created by AWS Marketplace.
productViewSummary_type :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe ProductType)

-- | The email contact information to obtain support for this Product.
productViewSummary_supportEmail :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The product identifier.
productViewSummary_productId :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the support for this Product.
productViewSummary_supportDescription :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProductViewSummary.ProductViewSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProductViewSummary.ProductViewSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProductViewSummary.ProductViewSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProductViewSummary.ProductViewSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProductViewSummary.ProductViewSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProductViewSummary.ProductViewSummary

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisionedProductDetail

-- | Information about a provisioned product.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProvisionedProductDetail</a> smart constructor.
data ProvisionedProductDetail
ProvisionedProductDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ProvisionedProductStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ProvisionedProductDetail

-- | The ARN of the launch role associated with the provisioned product.
[$sel:launchRoleArn:ProvisionedProductDetail'] :: ProvisionedProductDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If
--   multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same
--   response is returned for each repeated request.
[$sel:idempotencyToken:ProvisionedProductDetail'] :: ProvisionedProductDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The current status of the provisioned product.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AVAILABLE</tt> - Stable state, ready to perform any operation.
--   The most recent operation succeeded and completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNDER_CHANGE</tt> - Transitive state. Operations performed
--   might not have valid results. Wait for an <tt>AVAILABLE</tt> status
--   before performing operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>TAINTED</tt> - Stable state, ready to perform any operation.
--   The stack has completed the requested operation but is not exactly
--   what was requested. For example, a request to update to a new version
--   failed and the stack rolled back to the current version.</li>
--   <li><tt>ERROR</tt> - An unexpected error occurred. The provisioned
--   product exists but the stack is not running. For example,
--   CloudFormation received a parameter value that was not valid and could
--   not launch the stack.</li>
--   <li><tt>PLAN_IN_PROGRESS</tt> - Transitive state. The plan operations
--   were performed to provision a new product, but resources have not yet
--   been created. After reviewing the list of resources to be created,
--   execute the plan. Wait for an <tt>AVAILABLE</tt> status before
--   performing operations.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:ProvisionedProductDetail'] :: ProvisionedProductDetail -> Maybe ProvisionedProductStatus

-- | The record identifier of the last successful request performed on this
--   provisioned product of the following types:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ProvisionedProduct</li>
--   <li>UpdateProvisionedProduct</li>
--   <li>ExecuteProvisionedProductPlan</li>
--   <li>TerminateProvisionedProduct</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:lastSuccessfulProvisioningRecordId:ProvisionedProductDetail'] :: ProvisionedProductDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact. For example,
--   <tt>pa-4abcdjnxjj6ne</tt>.
[$sel:provisioningArtifactId:ProvisionedProductDetail'] :: ProvisionedProductDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the provisioned product.
[$sel:arn:ProvisionedProductDetail'] :: ProvisionedProductDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
[$sel:createdTime:ProvisionedProductDetail'] :: ProvisionedProductDetail -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The current status message of the provisioned product.
[$sel:statusMessage:ProvisionedProductDetail'] :: ProvisionedProductDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The user-friendly name of the provisioned product.
[$sel:name:ProvisionedProductDetail'] :: ProvisionedProductDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The record identifier of the last request performed on this
--   provisioned product.
[$sel:lastRecordId:ProvisionedProductDetail'] :: ProvisionedProductDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the provisioned product.
[$sel:id:ProvisionedProductDetail'] :: ProvisionedProductDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of provisioned product. The supported values are
--   <tt>CFN_STACK</tt> and <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt>.
[$sel:type':ProvisionedProductDetail'] :: ProvisionedProductDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The record identifier of the last request performed on this
--   provisioned product of the following types:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ProvisionedProduct</li>
--   <li>UpdateProvisionedProduct</li>
--   <li>ExecuteProvisionedProductPlan</li>
--   <li>TerminateProvisionedProduct</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:lastProvisioningRecordId:ProvisionedProductDetail'] :: ProvisionedProductDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The product identifier. For example, <tt>prod-abcdzk7xy33qa</tt>.
[$sel:productId:ProvisionedProductDetail'] :: ProvisionedProductDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ProvisionedProductDetail</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:launchRoleArn:ProvisionedProductDetail'</a>,

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifact

-- | Information about a provisioning artifact. A provisioning artifact is
--   also known as a product version.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProvisioningArtifact</a> smart constructor.
data ProvisioningArtifact
ProvisioningArtifact' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ProvisioningArtifactGuidance -> Maybe Text -> ProvisioningArtifact

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
[$sel:createdTime:ProvisioningArtifact'] :: ProvisioningArtifact -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the provisioning artifact.
[$sel:name:ProvisioningArtifact'] :: ProvisioningArtifact -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact.
[$sel:id:ProvisioningArtifact'] :: ProvisioningArtifact -> Maybe Text

-- | Information set by the administrator to provide guidance to end users
--   about which provisioning artifacts to use.
[$sel:guidance:ProvisioningArtifact'] :: ProvisioningArtifact -> Maybe ProvisioningArtifactGuidance

-- | The description of the provisioning artifact.
[$sel:description:ProvisioningArtifact'] :: ProvisioningArtifact -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ProvisioningArtifact</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdTime:ProvisioningArtifact'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifact_createdTime</a> - The UTC time stamp of the
--   creation time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ProvisioningArtifact'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifact_name</a> - The name of the provisioning
--   artifact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ProvisioningArtifact'</a>, <a>provisioningArtifact_id</a> -
--   The identifier of the provisioning artifact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:guidance:ProvisioningArtifact'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifact_guidance</a> - Information set by the
--   administrator to provide guidance to end users about which
--   provisioning artifacts to use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ProvisioningArtifact'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifact_description</a> - The description of the
--   provisioning artifact.
newProvisioningArtifact :: ProvisioningArtifact

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
provisioningArtifact_createdTime :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifact (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the provisioning artifact.
provisioningArtifact_name :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifact (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact.
provisioningArtifact_id :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifact (Maybe Text)

-- | Information set by the administrator to provide guidance to end users
--   about which provisioning artifacts to use.
provisioningArtifact_guidance :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifact (Maybe ProvisioningArtifactGuidance)

-- | The description of the provisioning artifact.
provisioningArtifact_description :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifact (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifact.ProvisioningArtifact
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifact.ProvisioningArtifact
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifact.ProvisioningArtifact
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifact.ProvisioningArtifact
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifact.ProvisioningArtifact
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifact.ProvisioningArtifact

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifactParameter

-- | Information about a parameter used to provision a product.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProvisioningArtifactParameter</a> smart constructor.
data ProvisioningArtifactParameter
ProvisioningArtifactParameter' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ParameterConstraints -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ProvisioningArtifactParameter

-- | If this value is true, the value for this parameter is obfuscated from
--   view when the parameter is retrieved. This parameter is used to hide
--   sensitive information.
[$sel:isNoEcho:ProvisioningArtifactParameter'] :: ProvisioningArtifactParameter -> Maybe Bool

-- | The parameter key.
[$sel:parameterKey:ProvisioningArtifactParameter'] :: ProvisioningArtifactParameter -> Maybe Text

-- | The parameter type.
[$sel:parameterType:ProvisioningArtifactParameter'] :: ProvisioningArtifactParameter -> Maybe Text

-- | Constraints that the administrator has put on a parameter.
[$sel:parameterConstraints:ProvisioningArtifactParameter'] :: ProvisioningArtifactParameter -> Maybe ParameterConstraints

-- | The default value.
[$sel:defaultValue:ProvisioningArtifactParameter'] :: ProvisioningArtifactParameter -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the parameter.
[$sel:description:ProvisioningArtifactParameter'] :: ProvisioningArtifactParameter -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ProvisioningArtifactParameter</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isNoEcho:ProvisioningArtifactParameter'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactParameter_isNoEcho</a> - If this value is true,
--   the value for this parameter is obfuscated from view when the
--   parameter is retrieved. This parameter is used to hide sensitive
--   information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterKey:ProvisioningArtifactParameter'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactParameter_parameterKey</a> - The parameter key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterType:ProvisioningArtifactParameter'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactParameter_parameterType</a> - The parameter
--   type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterConstraints:ProvisioningArtifactParameter'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactParameter_parameterConstraints</a> -
--   Constraints that the administrator has put on a parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultValue:ProvisioningArtifactParameter'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactParameter_defaultValue</a> - The default value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ProvisioningArtifactParameter'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactParameter_description</a> - The description of
--   the parameter.
newProvisioningArtifactParameter :: ProvisioningArtifactParameter

-- | If this value is true, the value for this parameter is obfuscated from
--   view when the parameter is retrieved. This parameter is used to hide
--   sensitive information.
provisioningArtifactParameter_isNoEcho :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactParameter (Maybe Bool)

-- | The parameter key.
provisioningArtifactParameter_parameterKey :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | The parameter type.
provisioningArtifactParameter_parameterType :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | Constraints that the administrator has put on a parameter.
provisioningArtifactParameter_parameterConstraints :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactParameter (Maybe ParameterConstraints)

-- | The default value.
provisioningArtifactParameter_defaultValue :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the parameter.
provisioningArtifactParameter_description :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactParameter (Maybe Text)

instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifactParameter.ProvisioningArtifactParameter

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifactPreferences

-- | The user-defined preferences that will be applied during product
--   provisioning, unless overridden by <tt>ProvisioningPreferences</tt> or
--   <tt>UpdateProvisioningPreferences</tt>.
--   
--   For more information on maximum concurrent accounts and failure
--   tolerance, see <a>Stack set operation options</a> in the <i>AWS
--   CloudFormation User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProvisioningArtifactPreferences</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ProvisioningArtifactPreferences
ProvisioningArtifactPreferences' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> ProvisioningArtifactPreferences

-- | One or more AWS Regions where stack instances are deployed from the
--   stack set. These regions can be scoped in
--   <tt>ProvisioningPreferences$StackSetRegions</tt> and
--   <tt>UpdateProvisioningPreferences$StackSetRegions</tt>.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
[$sel:stackSetRegions:ProvisioningArtifactPreferences'] :: ProvisioningArtifactPreferences -> Maybe [Text]

-- | One or more AWS accounts where stack instances are deployed from the
--   stack set. These accounts can be scoped in
--   <tt>ProvisioningPreferences$StackSetAccounts</tt> and
--   <tt>UpdateProvisioningPreferences$StackSetAccounts</tt>.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
[$sel:stackSetAccounts:ProvisioningArtifactPreferences'] :: ProvisioningArtifactPreferences -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>ProvisioningArtifactPreferences</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetRegions:ProvisioningArtifactPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactPreferences_stackSetRegions</a> - One or more
--   AWS Regions where stack instances are deployed from the stack set.
--   These regions can be scoped in
--   <tt>ProvisioningPreferences$StackSetRegions</tt> and
--   <tt>UpdateProvisioningPreferences$StackSetRegions</tt>.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetAccounts:ProvisioningArtifactPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactPreferences_stackSetAccounts</a> - One or more
--   AWS accounts where stack instances are deployed from the stack set.
--   These accounts can be scoped in
--   <tt>ProvisioningPreferences$StackSetAccounts</tt> and
--   <tt>UpdateProvisioningPreferences$StackSetAccounts</tt>.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
newProvisioningArtifactPreferences :: ProvisioningArtifactPreferences

-- | One or more AWS Regions where stack instances are deployed from the
--   stack set. These regions can be scoped in
--   <tt>ProvisioningPreferences$StackSetRegions</tt> and
--   <tt>UpdateProvisioningPreferences$StackSetRegions</tt>.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
provisioningArtifactPreferences_stackSetRegions :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactPreferences (Maybe [Text])

-- | One or more AWS accounts where stack instances are deployed from the
--   stack set. These accounts can be scoped in
--   <tt>ProvisioningPreferences$StackSetAccounts</tt> and
--   <tt>UpdateProvisioningPreferences$StackSetAccounts</tt>.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
provisioningArtifactPreferences_stackSetAccounts :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactPreferences (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifactPreferences.ProvisioningArtifactPreferences
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifactPreferences.ProvisioningArtifactPreferences
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifactPreferences.ProvisioningArtifactPreferences
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifactPreferences.ProvisioningArtifactPreferences
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifactPreferences.ProvisioningArtifactPreferences

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifactSummary

-- | Summary information about a provisioning artifact (also known as a
--   version) for a product.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProvisioningArtifactSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ProvisioningArtifactSummary
ProvisioningArtifactSummary' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ProvisioningArtifactSummary

-- | The metadata for the provisioning artifact. This is used with AWS
--   Marketplace products.
[$sel:provisioningArtifactMetadata:ProvisioningArtifactSummary'] :: ProvisioningArtifactSummary -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
[$sel:createdTime:ProvisioningArtifactSummary'] :: ProvisioningArtifactSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the provisioning artifact.
[$sel:name:ProvisioningArtifactSummary'] :: ProvisioningArtifactSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact.
[$sel:id:ProvisioningArtifactSummary'] :: ProvisioningArtifactSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the provisioning artifact.
[$sel:description:ProvisioningArtifactSummary'] :: ProvisioningArtifactSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ProvisioningArtifactSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisioningArtifactMetadata:ProvisioningArtifactSummary'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactSummary_provisioningArtifactMetadata</a> - The
--   metadata for the provisioning artifact. This is used with AWS
--   Marketplace products.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdTime:ProvisioningArtifactSummary'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactSummary_createdTime</a> - The UTC time stamp of
--   the creation time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ProvisioningArtifactSummary'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactSummary_name</a> - The name of the provisioning
--   artifact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ProvisioningArtifactSummary'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactSummary_id</a> - The identifier of the
--   provisioning artifact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ProvisioningArtifactSummary'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactSummary_description</a> - The description of
--   the provisioning artifact.
newProvisioningArtifactSummary :: ProvisioningArtifactSummary

-- | The metadata for the provisioning artifact. This is used with AWS
--   Marketplace products.
provisioningArtifactSummary_provisioningArtifactMetadata :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactSummary (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
provisioningArtifactSummary_createdTime :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the provisioning artifact.
provisioningArtifactSummary_name :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact.
provisioningArtifactSummary_id :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the provisioning artifact.
provisioningArtifactSummary_description :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactSummary (Maybe Text)

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifactSummary.ProvisioningArtifactSummary

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifactProperties

-- | Information about a provisioning artifact (also known as a version)
--   for a product.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProvisioningArtifactProperties</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ProvisioningArtifactProperties
ProvisioningArtifactProperties' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ProvisioningArtifactType -> Maybe Text -> HashMap Text Text -> ProvisioningArtifactProperties

-- | If set to true, AWS Service Catalog stops validating the specified
--   provisioning artifact even if it is invalid.
[$sel:disableTemplateValidation:ProvisioningArtifactProperties'] :: ProvisioningArtifactProperties -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the provisioning artifact (for example, v1 v2beta). No
--   spaces are allowed.
[$sel:name:ProvisioningArtifactProperties'] :: ProvisioningArtifactProperties -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of provisioning artifact.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CLOUD_FORMATION_TEMPLATE</tt> - AWS CloudFormation
--   template</li>
--   <li><tt>MARKETPLACE_AMI</tt> - AWS Marketplace AMI</li>
--   <li><tt>MARKETPLACE_CAR</tt> - AWS Marketplace Clusters and AWS
--   Resources</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':ProvisioningArtifactProperties'] :: ProvisioningArtifactProperties -> Maybe ProvisioningArtifactType

-- | The description of the provisioning artifact, including how it differs
--   from the previous provisioning artifact.
[$sel:description:ProvisioningArtifactProperties'] :: ProvisioningArtifactProperties -> Maybe Text

-- | Specify the template source with one of the following options, but not
--   both. Keys accepted: [ <tt>LoadTemplateFromURL</tt>,
--   <tt>ImportFromPhysicalId</tt> ]
--   
--   The URL of the CloudFormation template in Amazon S3. Specify the URL
--   in JSON format as follows:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "LoadTemplateFromURL": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/cf-templates-ozkq9d3hgiq2-us-east-1/..."
--   </pre>
--   
--   <tt>ImportFromPhysicalId</tt>: The physical id of the resource that
--   contains the template. Currently only supports CloudFormation stack
--   arn. Specify the physical id in JSON format as follows:
--   <tt>ImportFromPhysicalId:
--   arn:aws:cloudformation:[us-east-1]:[accountId]:stack/[StackName]/[resourceId]</tt>
[$sel:info:ProvisioningArtifactProperties'] :: ProvisioningArtifactProperties -> HashMap Text Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ProvisioningArtifactProperties</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:disableTemplateValidation:ProvisioningArtifactProperties'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactProperties_disableTemplateValidation</a> - If
--   set to true, AWS Service Catalog stops validating the specified
--   provisioning artifact even if it is invalid.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ProvisioningArtifactProperties'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactProperties_name</a> - The name of the
--   provisioning artifact (for example, v1 v2beta). No spaces are allowed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ProvisioningArtifactProperties'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactProperties_type</a> - The type of provisioning
--   artifact.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CLOUD_FORMATION_TEMPLATE</tt> - AWS CloudFormation
--   template</li>
--   <li><tt>MARKETPLACE_AMI</tt> - AWS Marketplace AMI</li>
--   <li><tt>MARKETPLACE_CAR</tt> - AWS Marketplace Clusters and AWS
--   Resources</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ProvisioningArtifactProperties'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactProperties_description</a> - The description of
--   the provisioning artifact, including how it differs from the previous
--   provisioning artifact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:info:ProvisioningArtifactProperties'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningArtifactProperties_info</a> - Specify the template
--   source with one of the following options, but not both. Keys accepted:
--   [ <tt>LoadTemplateFromURL</tt>, <tt>ImportFromPhysicalId</tt> ]
--   
--   The URL of the CloudFormation template in Amazon S3. Specify the URL
--   in JSON format as follows:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "LoadTemplateFromURL": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/cf-templates-ozkq9d3hgiq2-us-east-1/..."
--   </pre>
--   
--   <tt>ImportFromPhysicalId</tt>: The physical id of the resource that
--   contains the template. Currently only supports CloudFormation stack
--   arn. Specify the physical id in JSON format as follows:
--   <tt>ImportFromPhysicalId:
--   arn:aws:cloudformation:[us-east-1]:[accountId]:stack/[StackName]/[resourceId]</tt>
newProvisioningArtifactProperties :: ProvisioningArtifactProperties

-- | If set to true, AWS Service Catalog stops validating the specified
--   provisioning artifact even if it is invalid.
provisioningArtifactProperties_disableTemplateValidation :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactProperties (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the provisioning artifact (for example, v1 v2beta). No
--   spaces are allowed.
provisioningArtifactProperties_name :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactProperties (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of provisioning artifact.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CLOUD_FORMATION_TEMPLATE</tt> - AWS CloudFormation
--   template</li>
--   <li><tt>MARKETPLACE_AMI</tt> - AWS Marketplace AMI</li>
--   <li><tt>MARKETPLACE_CAR</tt> - AWS Marketplace Clusters and AWS
--   Resources</li>
--   </ul>
provisioningArtifactProperties_type :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactProperties (Maybe ProvisioningArtifactType)

-- | The description of the provisioning artifact, including how it differs
--   from the previous provisioning artifact.
provisioningArtifactProperties_description :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactProperties (Maybe Text)

-- | Specify the template source with one of the following options, but not
--   both. Keys accepted: [ <tt>LoadTemplateFromURL</tt>,
--   <tt>ImportFromPhysicalId</tt> ]
--   
--   The URL of the CloudFormation template in Amazon S3. Specify the URL
--   in JSON format as follows:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "LoadTemplateFromURL": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/cf-templates-ozkq9d3hgiq2-us-east-1/..."
--   </pre>
--   
--   <tt>ImportFromPhysicalId</tt>: The physical id of the resource that
--   contains the template. Currently only supports CloudFormation stack
--   arn. Specify the physical id in JSON format as follows:
--   <tt>ImportFromPhysicalId:
--   arn:aws:cloudformation:[us-east-1]:[accountId]:stack/[StackName]/[resourceId]</tt>
provisioningArtifactProperties_info :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactProperties (HashMap Text Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifactProperties.ProvisioningArtifactProperties
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifactProperties.ProvisioningArtifactProperties
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifactProperties.ProvisioningArtifactProperties

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifactDetail

-- | Information about a provisioning artifact (also known as a version)
--   for a product.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProvisioningArtifactDetail</a> smart constructor.

ProvisioningArtifactDetail' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ProvisioningArtifactType -> Maybe ProvisioningArtifactGuidance -> Maybe Text -> ProvisioningArtifactDetail

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
[$sel:createdTime:ProvisioningArtifactDetail'] :: ProvisioningArtifactDetail -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Indicates whether the product version is active.
[$sel:active:ProvisioningArtifactDetail'] :: ProvisioningArtifactDetail -> Maybe Bool

[$sel:name:ProvisioningArtifactDetail'] :: ProvisioningArtifactDetail -> Maybe Text

--

--   template</li>
--   <li><tt>MARKETPLACE_AMI</tt> - AWS Marketplace AMI</li>
--   <li><tt>MARKETPLACE_CAR</tt> - AWS Marketplace Clusters and AWS
--   Resources</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':ProvisioningArtifactDetail'] :: ProvisioningArtifactDetail -> Maybe ProvisioningArtifactType

-- | Information set by the administrator to provide guidance to end users
--   about which provisioning artifacts to use.
[$sel:guidance:ProvisioningArtifactDetail'] :: ProvisioningArtifactDetail -> Maybe ProvisioningArtifactGuidance

[$sel:description:ProvisioningArtifactDetail'] :: ProvisioningArtifactDetail -> Maybe Text

--   fields omitted.

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningArtifactView

--

--   also known as a product version.

--   as a product version.

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningPreferences

-- | The user-defined preferences that will be applied when updating a
--   provisioned product. Not all preferences are applicable to all
--   provisioned product type
--   
--   One or more AWS accounts that will have access to the provisioned
--   product.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The AWS accounts specified should be within the list of accounts in
--   the <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of accounts in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all accounts from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProvisioningPreferences</a> smart constructor.
data ProvisioningPreferences
ProvisioningPreferences' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Natural -> ProvisioningPreferences

-- | One or more AWS Regions where the provisioned product will be
--   available.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The specified regions should be within the list of regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of regions in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
[$sel:stackSetRegions:ProvisioningPreferences'] :: ProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The maximum percentage of accounts in which to perform this operation
--   at one time.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   This is true except in cases where rounding down would result is zero.
--   In this case, AWS Service Catalog sets the number as <tt>1</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
[$sel:stackSetMaxConcurrencyPercentage:ProvisioningPreferences'] :: ProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe Natural

-- | The number of accounts, per region, for which this operation can fail
--   before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that region. If the
--   operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog doesn't attempt
--   the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>0</tt> if no value is specified.
[$sel:stackSetFailureToleranceCount:ProvisioningPreferences'] :: ProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe Natural

-- | The percentage of accounts, per region, for which this stack operation
--   can fail before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that
--   region. If the operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog
--   doesn't attempt the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
[$sel:stackSetFailureTolerancePercentage:ProvisioningPreferences'] :: ProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe Natural

-- | One or more AWS accounts where the provisioned product will be
--   available.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The specified accounts should be within the list of accounts from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of accounts in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all acounts from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
[$sel:stackSetAccounts:ProvisioningPreferences'] :: ProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The maximum number of accounts in which to perform this operation at
--   one time. This is dependent on the value of
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> is at most one more than the
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
[$sel:stackSetMaxConcurrencyCount:ProvisioningPreferences'] :: ProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ProvisioningPreferences</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetRegions:ProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningPreferences_stackSetRegions</a> - One or more AWS
--   Regions where the provisioned product will be available.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The specified regions should be within the list of regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of regions in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetMaxConcurrencyPercentage:ProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningPreferences_stackSetMaxConcurrencyPercentage</a> - The
--   maximum percentage of accounts in which to perform this operation at
--   one time.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   This is true except in cases where rounding down would result is zero.
--   In this case, AWS Service Catalog sets the number as <tt>1</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetFailureToleranceCount:ProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningPreferences_stackSetFailureToleranceCount</a> - The
--   number of accounts, per region, for which this operation can fail
--   before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that region. If the
--   operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog doesn't attempt
--   the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>0</tt> if no value is specified.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetFailureTolerancePercentage:ProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningPreferences_stackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</a> -
--   The percentage of accounts, per region, for which this stack operation
--   can fail before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that
--   region. If the operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog
--   doesn't attempt the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetAccounts:ProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningPreferences_stackSetAccounts</a> - One or more AWS
--   accounts where the provisioned product will be available.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The specified accounts should be within the list of accounts from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of accounts in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all acounts from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetMaxConcurrencyCount:ProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningPreferences_stackSetMaxConcurrencyCount</a> - The
--   maximum number of accounts in which to perform this operation at one
--   time. This is dependent on the value of
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> is at most one more than the
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
newProvisioningPreferences :: ProvisioningPreferences

-- | One or more AWS Regions where the provisioned product will be
--   available.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The specified regions should be within the list of regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of regions in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
provisioningPreferences_stackSetRegions :: Lens' ProvisioningPreferences (Maybe [Text])

-- | The maximum percentage of accounts in which to perform this operation
--   at one time.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   This is true except in cases where rounding down would result is zero.
--   In this case, AWS Service Catalog sets the number as <tt>1</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
provisioningPreferences_stackSetMaxConcurrencyPercentage :: Lens' ProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | The number of accounts, per region, for which this operation can fail
--   before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that region. If the
--   operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog doesn't attempt
--   the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>0</tt> if no value is specified.
provisioningPreferences_stackSetFailureToleranceCount :: Lens' ProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | The percentage of accounts, per region, for which this stack operation
--   can fail before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that
--   region. If the operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog
--   doesn't attempt the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
provisioningPreferences_stackSetFailureTolerancePercentage :: Lens' ProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | One or more AWS accounts where the provisioned product will be
--   available.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The specified accounts should be within the list of accounts from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of accounts in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all acounts from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
provisioningPreferences_stackSetAccounts :: Lens' ProvisioningPreferences (Maybe [Text])

-- | The maximum number of accounts in which to perform this operation at
--   one time. This is dependent on the value of
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> is at most one more than the
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
provisioningPreferences_stackSetMaxConcurrencyCount :: Lens' ProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningPreferences.ProvisioningPreferences
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningPreferences.ProvisioningPreferences
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningPreferences.ProvisioningPreferences
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningPreferences.ProvisioningPreferences
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningPreferences.ProvisioningPreferences
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningPreferences.ProvisioningPreferences
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisioningPreferences.ProvisioningPreferences


module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.RecordError

-- | The error code and description resulting from an operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecordError</a> smart constructor.
data RecordError
RecordError' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RecordError

-- | The numeric value of the error.
[$sel:code:RecordError'] :: RecordError -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the error.
[$sel:description:RecordError'] :: RecordError -> Maybe Text

--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   value of the error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:RecordError'</a>, <a>recordError_description</a> -
--   The description of the error.
newRecordError :: RecordError

-- | The description of the error.
recordError_description :: Lens' RecordError (Maybe Text)

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.RecordDetail

-- | Information about a request operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecordDetail</a> smart constructor.
data RecordDetail
RecordDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe RecordStatus -> Maybe [RecordTag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [RecordError] -> Maybe Text -> RecordDetail

-- | The ARN of the launch role associated with the provisioned product.
[$sel:launchRoleArn:RecordDetail'] :: RecordDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the provisioned product.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CREATED</tt> - The request was created but the operation has
--   not started.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> - The requested operation is in
--   progress.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS_IN_ERROR</tt> - The provisioned product is under
--   change but the requested operation failed and some remediation is
--   occurring. For example, a rollback.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt> - The requested operation has successfully
--   completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> - The requested operation has unsuccessfully
--   completed. Investigate using the error messages returned.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:RecordDetail'] :: RecordDetail -> Maybe RecordStatus

-- | One or more tags.
[$sel:recordTags:RecordDetail'] :: RecordDetail -> Maybe [RecordTag]

-- | The user-friendly name of the provisioned product.
[$sel:provisionedProductName:RecordDetail'] :: RecordDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact.
[$sel:provisioningArtifactId:RecordDetail'] :: RecordDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
[$sel:createdTime:RecordDetail'] :: RecordDetail -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The record type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>PROVISION_PRODUCT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UPDATE_PROVISIONED_PRODUCT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TERMINATE_PROVISIONED_PRODUCT</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:recordType:RecordDetail'] :: RecordDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the record.
[$sel:recordId:RecordDetail'] :: RecordDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of provisioned product. The supported values are
--   <tt>CFN_STACK</tt> and <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt>.
[$sel:provisionedProductType:RecordDetail'] :: RecordDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The time when the record was last updated.
[$sel:updatedTime:RecordDetail'] :: RecordDetail -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The path identifier.
[$sel:pathId:RecordDetail'] :: RecordDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the provisioned product.
[$sel:provisionedProductId:RecordDetail'] :: RecordDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The errors that occurred.
[$sel:recordErrors:RecordDetail'] :: RecordDetail -> Maybe [RecordError]

-- | The product identifier.
[$sel:productId:RecordDetail'] :: RecordDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RecordDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:launchRoleArn:RecordDetail'</a>,
--   <a>recordDetail_launchRoleArn</a> - The ARN of the launch role
--   associated with the provisioned product.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:RecordDetail'</a>, <a>recordDetail_status</a> - The
--   status of the provisioned product.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CREATED</tt> - The request was created but the operation has
--   not started.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> - The requested operation is in
--   progress.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS_IN_ERROR</tt> - The provisioned product is under
--   change but the requested operation failed and some remediation is
--   occurring. For example, a rollback.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt> - The requested operation has successfully
--   completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> - The requested operation has unsuccessfully
--   completed. Investigate using the error messages returned.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordTags:RecordDetail'</a>, <a>recordDetail_recordTags</a> -
--   One or more tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedProductName:RecordDetail'</a>,
--   <a>recordDetail_provisionedProductName</a> - The user-friendly name of
--   the provisioned product.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisioningArtifactId:RecordDetail'</a>,
--   <a>recordDetail_provisioningArtifactId</a> - The identifier of the
--   provisioning artifact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdTime:RecordDetail'</a>, <a>recordDetail_createdTime</a>
--   - The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordType:RecordDetail'</a>, <a>recordDetail_recordType</a> -
--   The record type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>PROVISION_PRODUCT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UPDATE_PROVISIONED_PRODUCT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TERMINATE_PROVISIONED_PRODUCT</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordId:RecordDetail'</a>, <a>recordDetail_recordId</a> - The
--   identifier of the record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedProductType:RecordDetail'</a>,
--   <a>recordDetail_provisionedProductType</a> - The type of provisioned
--   product. The supported values are <tt>CFN_STACK</tt> and
--   <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updatedTime:RecordDetail'</a>, <a>recordDetail_updatedTime</a>
--   - The time when the record was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pathId:RecordDetail'</a>, <a>recordDetail_pathId</a> - The
--   path identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedProductId:RecordDetail'</a>,
--   <a>recordDetail_provisionedProductId</a> - The identifier of the
--   provisioned product.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordErrors:RecordDetail'</a>,
--   <a>recordDetail_recordErrors</a> - The errors that occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productId:RecordDetail'</a>, <a>recordDetail_productId</a> -
--   The product identifier.
newRecordDetail :: RecordDetail

-- | The ARN of the launch role associated with the provisioned product.
recordDetail_launchRoleArn :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the provisioned product.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CREATED</tt> - The request was created but the operation has
--   not started.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> - The requested operation is in
--   progress.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS_IN_ERROR</tt> - The provisioned product is under
--   change but the requested operation failed and some remediation is
--   occurring. For example, a rollback.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt> - The requested operation has successfully
--   completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> - The requested operation has unsuccessfully
--   completed. Investigate using the error messages returned.</li>
--   </ul>
recordDetail_status :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe RecordStatus)

-- | One or more tags.
recordDetail_recordTags :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe [RecordTag])

-- | The user-friendly name of the provisioned product.
recordDetail_provisionedProductName :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact.
recordDetail_provisioningArtifactId :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
recordDetail_createdTime :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The record type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>PROVISION_PRODUCT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UPDATE_PROVISIONED_PRODUCT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TERMINATE_PROVISIONED_PRODUCT</pre></li>
--   </ul>
recordDetail_recordType :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the record.
recordDetail_recordId :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of provisioned product. The supported values are
--   <tt>CFN_STACK</tt> and <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt>.

-- | The time when the record was last updated.

-- | The path identifier.

recordDetail_provisionedProductId :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe Text)

recordDetail_recordErrors :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe [RecordError])

-- | The product identifier.
recordDetail_productId :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe Text)

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProductViewDetail

-- | Information about a product view.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProductViewDetail</a> smart constructor.
data ProductViewDetail
ProductViewDetail' :: Maybe RequestStatus -> Maybe ProductViewSummary -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> ProductViewDetail

-- | The status of the product.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AVAILABLE</tt> - The product is ready for use.</li>
--   <li><tt>CREATING</tt> - Product creation has started; the product is
--   not ready for use.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> - An action failed.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:ProductViewDetail'] :: ProductViewDetail -> Maybe RequestStatus

-- | Summary information about the product view.
[$sel:productViewSummary:ProductViewDetail'] :: ProductViewDetail -> Maybe ProductViewSummary

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
[$sel:createdTime:ProductViewDetail'] :: ProductViewDetail -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ARN of the product.
[$sel:productARN:ProductViewDetail'] :: ProductViewDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ProductViewDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ProductViewDetail'</a>, <a>productViewDetail_status</a>
--   - The status of the product.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AVAILABLE</tt> - The product is ready for use.</li>
--   <li><tt>CREATING</tt> - Product creation has started; the product is
--   not ready for use.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> - An action failed.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:productViewSummary:ProductViewDetail'</a>,
--   <a>productViewDetail_productViewSummary</a> - Summary information
--   about the product view.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdTime:ProductViewDetail'</a>,
--   <a>productViewDetail_createdTime</a> - The UTC time stamp of the
--   creation time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productARN:ProductViewDetail'</a>,
--   <a>productViewDetail_productARN</a> - The ARN of the product.
newProductViewDetail :: ProductViewDetail

-- | The status of the product.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AVAILABLE</tt> - The product is ready for use.</li>
--   <li><tt>CREATING</tt> - Product creation has started; the product is
--   not ready for use.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> - An action failed.</li>
--   </ul>
productViewDetail_status :: Lens' ProductViewDetail (Maybe RequestStatus)

-- | Summary information about the product view.
productViewDetail_productViewSummary :: Lens' ProductViewDetail (Maybe ProductViewSummary)

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
productViewDetail_createdTime :: Lens' ProductViewDetail (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ARN of the product.
productViewDetail_productARN :: Lens' ProductViewDetail (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProductViewDetail.ProductViewDetail
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProductViewDetail.ProductViewDetail
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProductViewDetail.ProductViewDetail
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProductViewDetail.ProductViewDetail

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ResourceTargetDefinition

-- | Information about a change to a resource attribute.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceTargetDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceTargetDefinition
ResourceTargetDefinition' :: Maybe ResourceAttribute -> Maybe RequiresRecreation -> Maybe Text -> ResourceTargetDefinition

-- | The attribute to be changed.
[$sel:attribute:ResourceTargetDefinition'] :: ResourceTargetDefinition -> Maybe ResourceAttribute

-- | If the attribute is <tt>Properties</tt>, indicates whether a change to
--   this property causes the resource to be re-created.
[$sel:requiresRecreation:ResourceTargetDefinition'] :: ResourceTargetDefinition -> Maybe RequiresRecreation

-- | If the attribute is <tt>Properties</tt>, the value is the name of the
--   property. Otherwise, the value is null.
[$sel:name:ResourceTargetDefinition'] :: ResourceTargetDefinition -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceTargetDefinition</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attribute:ResourceTargetDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>resourceTargetDefinition_attribute</a> - The attribute to be
--   changed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requiresRecreation:ResourceTargetDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>resourceTargetDefinition_requiresRecreation</a> - If the attribute
--   is <tt>Properties</tt>, indicates whether a change to this property
--   causes the resource to be re-created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ResourceTargetDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>resourceTargetDefinition_name</a> - If the attribute is
--   <tt>Properties</tt>, the value is the name of the property. Otherwise,
--   the value is null.
newResourceTargetDefinition :: ResourceTargetDefinition

-- | The attribute to be changed.
resourceTargetDefinition_attribute :: Lens' ResourceTargetDefinition (Maybe ResourceAttribute)

-- | If the attribute is <tt>Properties</tt>, indicates whether a change to
--   this property causes the resource to be re-created.
resourceTargetDefinition_requiresRecreation :: Lens' ResourceTargetDefinition (Maybe RequiresRecreation)

-- | If the attribute is <tt>Properties</tt>, the value is the name of the
--   property. Otherwise, the value is null.
resourceTargetDefinition_name :: Lens' ResourceTargetDefinition (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ResourceTargetDefinition.ResourceTargetDefinition
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ResourceTargetDefinition.ResourceTargetDefinition
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ResourceTargetDefinition.ResourceTargetDefinition
