module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ResourceChangeDetail

-- | Information about a change to a resource attribute.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceChangeDetail</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceChangeDetail
ResourceChangeDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe EvaluationType -> Maybe ResourceTargetDefinition -> ResourceChangeDetail

-- | The ID of the entity that caused the change.
[$sel:causingEntity:ResourceChangeDetail'] :: ResourceChangeDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | For static evaluations, the value of the resource attribute will
--   change and the new value is known. For dynamic evaluations, the value
--   might change, and any new value will be determined when the plan is
--   updated.
[$sel:evaluation:ResourceChangeDetail'] :: ResourceChangeDetail -> Maybe EvaluationType

-- | Information about the resource attribute to be modified.
[$sel:target:ResourceChangeDetail'] :: ResourceChangeDetail -> Maybe ResourceTargetDefinition

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceChangeDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:causingEntity:ResourceChangeDetail'</a>,
--   <a>resourceChangeDetail_causingEntity</a> - The ID of the entity that
--   caused the change.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluation:ResourceChangeDetail'</a>,
--   <a>resourceChangeDetail_evaluation</a> - For static evaluations, the
--   value of the resource attribute will change and the new value is
--   known. For dynamic evaluations, the value might change, and any new
--   value will be determined when the plan is updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:target:ResourceChangeDetail'</a>,
--   <a>resourceChangeDetail_target</a> - Information about the resource
--   attribute to be modified.
newResourceChangeDetail :: ResourceChangeDetail

-- | The ID of the entity that caused the change.
resourceChangeDetail_causingEntity :: Lens' ResourceChangeDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | For static evaluations, the value of the resource attribute will
--   change and the new value is known. For dynamic evaluations, the value
--   might change, and any new value will be determined when the plan is
--   updated.
resourceChangeDetail_evaluation :: Lens' ResourceChangeDetail (Maybe EvaluationType)

-- | Information about the resource attribute to be modified.
resourceChangeDetail_target :: Lens' ResourceChangeDetail (Maybe ResourceTargetDefinition)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ResourceChangeDetail.ResourceChangeDetail
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ResourceChangeDetail.ResourceChangeDetail
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ResourceChangeDetail.ResourceChangeDetail
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ResourceChangeDetail.ResourceChangeDetail

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ResourceChange

-- | Information about a resource change that will occur when a plan is
--   executed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceChange</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceChange
ResourceChange' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChangeAction -> Maybe [ResourceAttribute] -> Maybe [ResourceChangeDetail] -> Maybe Replacement -> ResourceChange

-- | The ID of the resource, as defined in the CloudFormation template.
[$sel:logicalResourceId:ResourceChange'] :: ResourceChange -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the resource, if it was already created.
[$sel:physicalResourceId:ResourceChange'] :: ResourceChange -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of resource.
[$sel:resourceType:ResourceChange'] :: ResourceChange -> Maybe Text

-- | The change action.
[$sel:action:ResourceChange'] :: ResourceChange -> Maybe ChangeAction

-- | The change scope.
[$sel:scope:ResourceChange'] :: ResourceChange -> Maybe [ResourceAttribute]

-- | Information about the resource changes.
[$sel:details:ResourceChange'] :: ResourceChange -> Maybe [ResourceChangeDetail]

-- | If the change type is <tt>Modify</tt>, indicates whether the existing
--   resource is deleted and replaced with a new one.
[$sel:replacement:ResourceChange'] :: ResourceChange -> Maybe Replacement

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceChange</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:logicalResourceId:ResourceChange'</a>,
--   <a>resourceChange_logicalResourceId</a> - The ID of the resource, as
--   defined in the CloudFormation template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:physicalResourceId:ResourceChange'</a>,
--   <a>resourceChange_physicalResourceId</a> - The ID of the resource, if
--   it was already created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ResourceChange'</a>,
--   <a>resourceChange_resourceType</a> - The type of resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:ResourceChange'</a>, <a>resourceChange_action</a> - The
--   change action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scope:ResourceChange'</a>, <a>resourceChange_scope</a> - The
--   change scope.
--   
--   <a>$sel:details:ResourceChange'</a>, <a>resourceChange_details</a> -
--   Information about the resource changes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replacement:ResourceChange'</a>,
--   <a>resourceChange_replacement</a> - If the change type is
--   <tt>Modify</tt>, indicates whether the existing resource is deleted
--   and replaced with a new one.
newResourceChange :: ResourceChange

-- | The ID of the resource, as defined in the CloudFormation template.
resourceChange_logicalResourceId :: Lens' ResourceChange (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the resource, if it was already created.
resourceChange_physicalResourceId :: Lens' ResourceChange (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of resource.
resourceChange_resourceType :: Lens' ResourceChange (Maybe Text)

-- | The change action.
resourceChange_action :: Lens' ResourceChange (Maybe ChangeAction)

-- | The change scope.
resourceChange_scope :: Lens' ResourceChange (Maybe [ResourceAttribute])

-- | Information about the resource changes.
resourceChange_details :: Lens' ResourceChange (Maybe [ResourceChangeDetail])

-- | If the change type is <tt>Modify</tt>, indicates whether the existing
--   resource is deleted and replaced with a new one.
resourceChange_replacement :: Lens' ResourceChange (Maybe Replacement)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ResourceChange.ResourceChange
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ResourceChange.ResourceChange
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ResourceChange.ResourceChange
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ResourceChange.ResourceChange
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ResourceChange.ResourceChange
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ResourceChange.ResourceChange
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ResourceChange.ResourceChange


module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ServiceActionAssociation

-- | A self-service action association consisting of the Action ID, the
--   Product ID, and the Provisioning Artifact ID.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newServiceActionAssociation</a> smart constructor.
data ServiceActionAssociation
ServiceActionAssociation' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ServiceActionAssociation

-- | The self-service action identifier. For example,
--   <tt>act-fs7abcd89wxyz</tt>.
[$sel:serviceActionId:ServiceActionAssociation'] :: ServiceActionAssociation -> Text

-- | The product identifier. For example, <tt>prod-abcdzk7xy33qa</tt>.
[$sel:productId:ServiceActionAssociation'] :: ServiceActionAssociation -> Text

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact. For example,
--   <tt>pa-4abcdjnxjj6ne</tt>.
[$sel:provisioningArtifactId:ServiceActionAssociation'] :: ServiceActionAssociation -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ServiceActionAssociation</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceActionId:ServiceActionAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>serviceActionAssociation_serviceActionId</a> - The self-service
--   action identifier. For example, <tt>act-fs7abcd89wxyz</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productId:ServiceActionAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>serviceActionAssociation_productId</a> - The product identifier.
--   For example, <tt>prod-abcdzk7xy33qa</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisioningArtifactId:ServiceActionAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>serviceActionAssociation_provisioningArtifactId</a> - The
--   identifier of the provisioning artifact. For example,
--   <tt>pa-4abcdjnxjj6ne</tt>.
newServiceActionAssociation :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ServiceActionAssociation

-- | The self-service action identifier. For example,
--   <tt>act-fs7abcd89wxyz</tt>.
serviceActionAssociation_serviceActionId :: Lens' ServiceActionAssociation Text

-- | The product identifier. For example, <tt>prod-abcdzk7xy33qa</tt>.
serviceActionAssociation_productId :: Lens' ServiceActionAssociation Text

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact. For example,
--   <tt>pa-4abcdjnxjj6ne</tt>.
serviceActionAssociation_provisioningArtifactId :: Lens' ServiceActionAssociation Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ServiceActionAssociation.ServiceActionAssociation
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ServiceActionAssociation.ServiceActionAssociation
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ServiceActionAssociation.ServiceActionAssociation
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ServiceActionAssociation.ServiceActionAssociation
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ServiceActionAssociation.ServiceActionAssociation
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ServiceActionAssociation.ServiceActionAssociation
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ServiceActionAssociation.ServiceActionAssociation

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.FailedServiceActionAssociation

-- | An object containing information about the error, along with
--   identifying information about the self-service action and its
--   associations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFailedServiceActionAssociation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data FailedServiceActionAssociation
FailedServiceActionAssociation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ServiceActionAssociationErrorCode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> FailedServiceActionAssociation

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact. For example,
--   <tt>pa-4abcdjnxjj6ne</tt>.
[$sel:provisioningArtifactId:FailedServiceActionAssociation'] :: FailedServiceActionAssociation -> Maybe Text

-- | The error code. Valid values are listed below.
[$sel:errorCode:FailedServiceActionAssociation'] :: FailedServiceActionAssociation -> Maybe ServiceActionAssociationErrorCode

-- | A text description of the error.
[$sel:errorMessage:FailedServiceActionAssociation'] :: FailedServiceActionAssociation -> Maybe Text

-- | The self-service action identifier. For example,
--   <tt>act-fs7abcd89wxyz</tt>.
[$sel:serviceActionId:FailedServiceActionAssociation'] :: FailedServiceActionAssociation -> Maybe Text

-- | The product identifier. For example, <tt>prod-abcdzk7xy33qa</tt>.
[$sel:productId:FailedServiceActionAssociation'] :: FailedServiceActionAssociation -> Maybe Text

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   identifier of the provisioning artifact. For example,
--   <tt>pa-4abcdjnxjj6ne</tt>.

--   <a>$sel:errorCode:FailedServiceActionAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>failedServiceActionAssociation_errorCode</a> - The error code.
--   Valid values are listed below.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorMessage:FailedServiceActionAssociation'</a>,

--   description of the error.

--   <a>$sel:serviceActionId:FailedServiceActionAssociation'</a>,

--   self-service action identifier. For example,
--   <tt>act-fs7abcd89wxyz</tt>.

--   <a>failedServiceActionAssociation_productId</a> - The product
--   identifier. For example, <tt>prod-abcdzk7xy33qa</tt>.

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.StackInstance

-- | An AWS CloudFormation stack, in a specific account and region, that's
--   part of a stack set operation. A stack instance is a reference to an
--   attempted or actual stack in a given account within a given region. A
--   stack instance can exist without a stackfor example, if the stack
--   couldn't be created for some reason. A stack instance is associated
--   with only one stack set. Each stack instance contains the ID of its
--   associated stack set, as well as the ID of the actual stack and the
--   stack status.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackInstance</a> smart constructor.
data StackInstance
StackInstance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackInstanceStatus -> StackInstance

-- | The name of the AWS account that the stack instance is associated
--   with.
[$sel:account:StackInstance'] :: StackInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the AWS region that the stack instance is associated with.
[$sel:region:StackInstance'] :: StackInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the stack instance, in terms of its synchronization with
--   its associated stack set.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>INOPERABLE</tt>: A <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation has
--   failed and left the stack in an unstable state. Stacks in this state
--   are excluded from further <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operations. You
--   might need to perform a <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation, with
--   <tt>RetainStacks</tt> set to true, to delete the stack instance, and
--   then delete the stack manually.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUTDATED</tt>: The stack isn't currently up to date with the
--   stack set because either the associated stack failed during a
--   <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operation, or the
--   stack was part of a <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt>
--   operation that failed or was stopped before the stack was created or
--   updated.</li>
--   <li><tt>CURRENT</tt>: The stack is currently up to date with the stack
--   set.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:stackInstanceStatus:StackInstance'] :: StackInstance -> Maybe StackInstanceStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>StackInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:account:StackInstance'</a>, <a>stackInstance_account</a> - The
--   name of the AWS account that the stack instance is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:StackInstance'</a>, <a>stackInstance_region</a> - The
--   name of the AWS region that the stack instance is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackInstanceStatus:StackInstance'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstance_stackInstanceStatus</a> - The status of the stack
--   instance, in terms of its synchronization with its associated stack
--   set.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>INOPERABLE</tt>: A <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation has
--   failed and left the stack in an unstable state. Stacks in this state
--   are excluded from further <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operations. You
--   might need to perform a <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation, with
--   <tt>RetainStacks</tt> set to true, to delete the stack instance, and
--   then delete the stack manually.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUTDATED</tt>: The stack isn't currently up to date with the
--   stack set because either the associated stack failed during a
--   <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operation, or the
--   stack was part of a <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt>
--   operation that failed or was stopped before the stack was created or
--   updated.</li>
--   <li><tt>CURRENT</tt>: The stack is currently up to date with the stack
--   set.</li>
--   </ul>
newStackInstance :: StackInstance

-- | The name of the AWS account that the stack instance is associated
--   with.
stackInstance_account :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the AWS region that the stack instance is associated with.
stackInstance_region :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the stack instance, in terms of its synchronization with
--   its associated stack set.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>INOPERABLE</tt>: A <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation has
--   failed and left the stack in an unstable state. Stacks in this state
--   are excluded from further <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operations. You
--   might need to perform a <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation, with
--   <tt>RetainStacks</tt> set to true, to delete the stack instance, and
--   then delete the stack manually.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUTDATED</tt>: The stack isn't currently up to date with the
--   stack set because either the associated stack failed during a
--   <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operation, or the
--   stack was part of a <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt>
--   operation that failed or was stopped before the stack was created or
--   updated.</li>
--   <li><tt>CURRENT</tt>: The stack is currently up to date with the stack
--   set.</li>
--   </ul>
stackInstance_stackInstanceStatus :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe StackInstanceStatus)

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.Tag

-- | Information about a tag. A tag is a key-value pair. Tags are
--   propagated to the resources created when provisioning a product.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | The tag key.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | The value for this key.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The tag key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The value for this key.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | The tag key.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The value for this key.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.Tag.Tag

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.ProvisionedProductAttribute

-- | Information about a provisioned product.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProvisionedProductAttribute</a> smart constructor.
data ProvisionedProductAttribute
ProvisionedProductAttribute' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ProvisionedProductStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> ProvisionedProductAttribute

-- | A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If
--   multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same
--   response is returned for each repeated request.
[$sel:idempotencyToken:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The current status of the provisioned product.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AVAILABLE</tt> - Stable state, ready to perform any operation.
--   The most recent operation succeeded and completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNDER_CHANGE</tt> - Transitive state. Operations performed
--   might not have valid results. Wait for an <tt>AVAILABLE</tt> status
--   before performing operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>TAINTED</tt> - Stable state, ready to perform any operation.
--   The stack has completed the requested operation but is not exactly
--   what was requested. For example, a request to update to a new version
--   failed and the stack rolled back to the current version.</li>
--   <li><tt>ERROR</tt> - An unexpected error occurred. The provisioned
--   product exists but the stack is not running. For example,
--   CloudFormation received a parameter value that was not valid and could
--   not launch the stack.</li>
--   <li><tt>PLAN_IN_PROGRESS</tt> - Transitive state. The plan operations
--   were performed to provision a new product, but resources have not yet
--   been created. After reviewing the list of resources to be created,
--   execute the plan. Wait for an <tt>AVAILABLE</tt> status before
--   performing operations.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe ProvisionedProductStatus

-- | The name of the product.
[$sel:productName:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The record identifier of the last successful request performed on this
--   provisioned product of the following types:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ProvisionedProduct</li>
--   <li>UpdateProvisionedProduct</li>
--   <li>ExecuteProvisionedProductPlan</li>
--   <li>TerminateProvisionedProduct</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:lastSuccessfulProvisioningRecordId:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact.
[$sel:provisioningArtifactId:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the provisioned product.
[$sel:arn:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
[$sel:createdTime:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the provisioning artifact.
[$sel:provisioningArtifactName:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM user.
[$sel:userArn:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The current status message of the provisioned product.
[$sel:statusMessage:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The user-friendly name of the provisioned product.
[$sel:name:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The record identifier of the last request performed on this
--   provisioned product.
[$sel:lastRecordId:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the IAM user in the session. This ARN might contain a
--   session ID.
[$sel:userArnSession:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the provisioned product.
[$sel:id:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of provisioned product. The supported values are
--   <tt>CFN_STACK</tt> and <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt>.
[$sel:type':ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The assigned identifier for the resource, such as an EC2 instance ID
--   or an S3 bucket name.
[$sel:physicalId:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The record identifier of the last request performed on this
--   provisioned product of the following types:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ProvisionedProduct</li>
--   <li>UpdateProvisionedProduct</li>
--   <li>ExecuteProvisionedProductPlan</li>
--   <li>TerminateProvisionedProduct</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:lastProvisioningRecordId:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The product identifier.
[$sel:productId:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more tags.
[$sel:tags:ProvisionedProductAttribute'] :: ProvisionedProductAttribute -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>ProvisionedProductAttribute</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

-- | Summary information about a product path for a user.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLaunchPathSummary</a> smart constructor.
data LaunchPathSummary
LaunchPathSummary' :: Maybe [ConstraintSummary] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> LaunchPathSummary

-- | The constraints on the portfolio-product relationship.
[$sel:constraintSummaries:LaunchPathSummary'] :: LaunchPathSummary -> Maybe [ConstraintSummary]

[$sel:name:LaunchPathSummary'] :: LaunchPathSummary -> Maybe Text

--   The name of the portfolio to which the user was assigned.

--   identifier of the product path.

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.TagOptionDetail

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.UpdateProvisioningPreferences

-- | The user-defined preferences that will be applied when updating a
--   provisioned product. Not all preferences are applicable to all
--   provisioned product types.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateProvisioningPreferences</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateProvisioningPreferences
UpdateProvisioningPreferences' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe StackSetOperationType -> UpdateProvisioningPreferences

-- | One or more AWS Regions where the provisioned product will be
--   available.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The specified regions should be within the list of regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of regions in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
[$sel:stackSetRegions:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'] :: UpdateProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The maximum percentage of accounts in which to perform this operation
--   at one time.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   This is true except in cases where rounding down would result is zero.
--   In this case, AWS Service Catalog sets the number as <tt>1</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
[$sel:stackSetMaxConcurrencyPercentage:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'] :: UpdateProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe Natural

-- | The number of accounts, per region, for which this operation can fail
--   before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that region. If the
--   operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog doesn't attempt
--   the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>0</tt> if no value is specified.
[$sel:stackSetFailureToleranceCount:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'] :: UpdateProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe Natural

-- | The percentage of accounts, per region, for which this stack operation
--   can fail before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that
--   region. If the operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog
--   doesn't attempt the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
[$sel:stackSetFailureTolerancePercentage:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'] :: UpdateProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe Natural

-- | One or more AWS accounts that will have access to the provisioned
--   product.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The AWS accounts specified should be within the list of accounts in
--   the <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of accounts in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all accounts from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
[$sel:stackSetAccounts:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'] :: UpdateProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The maximum number of accounts in which to perform this operation at
--   one time. This is dependent on the value of
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> is at most one more than the
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
[$sel:stackSetMaxConcurrencyCount:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'] :: UpdateProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe Natural

-- | Determines what action AWS Service Catalog performs to a stack set or
--   a stack instance represented by the provisioned product. The default
--   value is <tt>UPDATE</tt> if nothing is specified.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>CREATE</i> Creates a new stack instance in the stack set
--   represented by the provisioned product. In this case, only new stack
--   instances are created based on accounts and regions; if new ProductId
--   or ProvisioningArtifactID are passed, they will be ignored.</li>
--   <li><i>UPDATE</i> Updates the stack set represented by the provisioned
--   product and also its stack instances.</li>
--   <li><i>DELETE</i> Deletes a stack instance in the stack set
--   represented by the provisioned product.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:stackSetOperationType:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'] :: UpdateProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe StackSetOperationType

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateProvisioningPreferences</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetRegions:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetRegions</a> - One or more AWS
--   Regions where the provisioned product will be available.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The specified regions should be within the list of regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of regions in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetMaxConcurrencyPercentage:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetMaxConcurrencyPercentage</a>
--   - The maximum percentage of accounts in which to perform this
--   operation at one time.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   This is true except in cases where rounding down would result is zero.
--   In this case, AWS Service Catalog sets the number as <tt>1</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetFailureToleranceCount:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetFailureToleranceCount</a> -
--   The number of accounts, per region, for which this operation can fail
--   before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that region. If the
--   operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog doesn't attempt
--   the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>0</tt> if no value is specified.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetFailureTolerancePercentage:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</a>
--   - The percentage of accounts, per region, for which this stack
--   operation can fail before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in
--   that region. If the operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service
--   Catalog doesn't attempt the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetAccounts:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetAccounts</a> - One or more
--   AWS accounts that will have access to the provisioned product.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The AWS accounts specified should be within the list of accounts in
--   the <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of accounts in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all accounts from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetMaxConcurrencyCount:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetMaxConcurrencyCount</a> - The
--   maximum number of accounts in which to perform this operation at one
--   time. This is dependent on the value of
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> is at most one more than the
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetOperationType:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetOperationType</a> -
--   Determines what action AWS Service Catalog performs to a stack set or
--   a stack instance represented by the provisioned product. The default
--   value is <tt>UPDATE</tt> if nothing is specified.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>CREATE</i> Creates a new stack instance in the stack set
--   represented by the provisioned product. In this case, only new stack
--   instances are created based on accounts and regions; if new ProductId
--   or ProvisioningArtifactID are passed, they will be ignored.</li>
--   <li><i>UPDATE</i> Updates the stack set represented by the provisioned
--   product and also its stack instances.</li>
--   <li><i>DELETE</i> Deletes a stack instance in the stack set
--   represented by the provisioned product.</li>
--   </ul>
newUpdateProvisioningPreferences :: UpdateProvisioningPreferences

-- | One or more AWS Regions where the provisioned product will be
--   available.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The specified regions should be within the list of regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of regions in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetRegions :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe [Text])

-- | The maximum percentage of accounts in which to perform this operation
--   at one time.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   This is true except in cases where rounding down would result is zero.
--   In this case, AWS Service Catalog sets the number as <tt>1</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetMaxConcurrencyPercentage :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | The number of accounts, per region, for which this operation can fail
--   before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that region. If the
--   operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog doesn't attempt
--   the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>0</tt> if no value is specified.
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetFailureToleranceCount :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | The percentage of accounts, per region, for which this stack operation
--   can fail before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that
--   region. If the operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog
--   doesn't attempt the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetFailureTolerancePercentage :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | One or more AWS accounts that will have access to the provisioned
--   product.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The AWS accounts specified should be within the list of accounts in
--   the <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of accounts in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all accounts from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetAccounts :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe [Text])

-- | The maximum number of accounts in which to perform this operation at
--   one time. This is dependent on the value of
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> is at most one more than the
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetMaxConcurrencyCount :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | Determines what action AWS Service Catalog performs to a stack set or
--   a stack instance represented by the provisioned product. The default
--   value is <tt>UPDATE</tt> if nothing is specified.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>CREATE</i> Creates a new stack instance in the stack set
--   represented by the provisioned product. In this case, only new stack
--   instances are created based on accounts and regions; if new ProductId
--   or ProvisioningArtifactID are passed, they will be ignored.</li>
--   <li><i>UPDATE</i> Updates the stack set represented by the provisioned
--   product and also its stack instances.</li>
--   <li><i>DELETE</i> Deletes a stack instance in the stack set
--   represented by the provisioned product.</li>
--   </ul>
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetOperationType :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe StackSetOperationType)

instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types.UpdateProvisioningPreferences.UpdateProvisioningPreferences

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Types

-- | API version <tt>2015-12-10</tt> of the Amazon Service Catalog SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | One or more parameters provided to the operation are not valid.
_InvalidParametersException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource is a duplicate.
_DuplicateResourceException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation is not supported.
_OperationNotSupportedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An operation requiring TagOptions failed because the TagOptions
--   migration process has not been performed for this account. Please use
--   the AWS console to perform the migration process before retrying the
--   operation.
_TagOptionNotMigratedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource was not found.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An attempt was made to modify a resource that is in a state that is
--   not valid. Check your resources to ensure that they are in valid
--   states before retrying the operation.
_InvalidStateException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The current limits of the service would have been exceeded by this
--   operation. Decrease your resource use or increase your service limits
--   and retry the operation.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A resource that is currently in use. Ensure that the resource is not
--   in use and retry the operation.
_ResourceInUseException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The access level to use to filter results.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessLevelFilter</a> smart constructor.
data AccessLevelFilter
AccessLevelFilter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe AccessLevelFilterKey -> AccessLevelFilter

-- | The user to which the access level applies. The only supported value
--   is <tt>Self</tt>.
[$sel:value:AccessLevelFilter'] :: AccessLevelFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | The access level.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Account</tt> - Filter results based on the account.</li>
--   <li><tt>Role</tt> - Filter results based on the federated role of the
--   specified user.</li>
--   <li><tt>User</tt> - Filter results based on the specified user.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:key:AccessLevelFilter'] :: AccessLevelFilter -> Maybe AccessLevelFilterKey

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessLevelFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:AccessLevelFilter'</a>, <a>accessLevelFilter_value</a> -
--   The user to which the access level applies. The only supported value
--   is <tt>Self</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:AccessLevelFilter'</a>, <a>accessLevelFilter_key</a> - The
--   access level.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Account</tt> - Filter results based on the account.</li>
--   <li><tt>Role</tt> - Filter results based on the federated role of the
--   specified user.</li>
--   <li><tt>User</tt> - Filter results based on the specified user.</li>
--   </ul>
newAccessLevelFilter :: AccessLevelFilter

-- | The user to which the access level applies. The only supported value
--   is <tt>Self</tt>.
accessLevelFilter_value :: Lens' AccessLevelFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | The access level.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Account</tt> - Filter results based on the account.</li>
--   <li><tt>Role</tt> - Filter results based on the federated role of the
--   specified user.</li>
--   <li><tt>User</tt> - Filter results based on the specified user.</li>
--   </ul>
accessLevelFilter_key :: Lens' AccessLevelFilter (Maybe AccessLevelFilterKey)

-- | Information about a constraint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newConstraintDetail</a> smart constructor.
data ConstraintDetail
ConstraintDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ConstraintDetail

-- | The identifier of the portfolio the product resides in. The constraint
--   applies only to the instance of the product that lives within this
--   portfolio.
[$sel:portfolioId:ConstraintDetail'] :: ConstraintDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the constraint.
[$sel:constraintId:ConstraintDetail'] :: ConstraintDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The owner of the constraint.
[$sel:owner:ConstraintDetail'] :: ConstraintDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of constraint.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LAUNCH</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NOTIFICATION</pre></li>
--   <li>STACKSET</li>
--   <li><pre>TEMPLATE</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':ConstraintDetail'] :: ConstraintDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the constraint.
[$sel:description:ConstraintDetail'] :: ConstraintDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the product the constraint applies to. Note that a
--   constraint applies to a specific instance of a product within a
--   certain portfolio.
[$sel:productId:ConstraintDetail'] :: ConstraintDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ConstraintDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:portfolioId:ConstraintDetail'</a>,
--   <a>constraintDetail_portfolioId</a> - The identifier of the portfolio
--   the product resides in. The constraint applies only to the instance of
--   the product that lives within this portfolio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:constraintId:ConstraintDetail'</a>,
--   <a>constraintDetail_constraintId</a> - The identifier of the
--   constraint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:owner:ConstraintDetail'</a>, <a>constraintDetail_owner</a> -
--   The owner of the constraint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ConstraintDetail'</a>, <a>constraintDetail_type</a> -
--   The type of constraint.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LAUNCH</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NOTIFICATION</pre></li>
--   <li>STACKSET</li>
--   <li><pre>TEMPLATE</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ConstraintDetail'</a>,
--   <a>constraintDetail_description</a> - The description of the
--   constraint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productId:ConstraintDetail'</a>,
--   <a>constraintDetail_productId</a> - The identifier of the product the
--   constraint applies to. Note that a constraint applies to a specific
--   instance of a product within a certain portfolio.
newConstraintDetail :: ConstraintDetail

-- | The identifier of the portfolio the product resides in. The constraint
--   applies only to the instance of the product that lives within this
--   portfolio.
constraintDetail_portfolioId :: Lens' ConstraintDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the constraint.
constraintDetail_constraintId :: Lens' ConstraintDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The owner of the constraint.
constraintDetail_owner :: Lens' ConstraintDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of constraint.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LAUNCH</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NOTIFICATION</pre></li>
--   <li>STACKSET</li>
--   <li><pre>TEMPLATE</pre></li>
--   </ul>
constraintDetail_type :: Lens' ConstraintDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the constraint.
constraintDetail_description :: Lens' ConstraintDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the product the constraint applies to. Note that a
--   constraint applies to a specific instance of a product within a
--   certain portfolio.
constraintDetail_productId :: Lens' ConstraintDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | Summary information about a constraint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newConstraintSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ConstraintSummary
ConstraintSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ConstraintSummary

-- | The type of constraint.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LAUNCH</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NOTIFICATION</pre></li>
--   <li>STACKSET</li>
--   <li><pre>TEMPLATE</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':ConstraintSummary'] :: ConstraintSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the constraint.
[$sel:description:ConstraintSummary'] :: ConstraintSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ConstraintSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ConstraintSummary'</a>, <a>constraintSummary_type</a> -
--   The type of constraint.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LAUNCH</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NOTIFICATION</pre></li>
--   <li>STACKSET</li>
--   <li><pre>TEMPLATE</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ConstraintSummary'</a>,
--   <a>constraintSummary_description</a> - The description of the
--   constraint.
newConstraintSummary :: ConstraintSummary

-- | The type of constraint.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LAUNCH</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NOTIFICATION</pre></li>
--   <li>STACKSET</li>
--   <li><pre>TEMPLATE</pre></li>
--   </ul>
constraintSummary_type :: Lens' ConstraintSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the constraint.
constraintSummary_description :: Lens' ConstraintSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Details of an execution parameter value that is passed to a
--   self-service action when executed on a provisioned product.

-- | An object containing information about the error, along with
--   identifying information about the self-service action and its
--   associations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFailedServiceActionAssociation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data FailedServiceActionAssociation
FailedServiceActionAssociation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ServiceActionAssociationErrorCode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> FailedServiceActionAssociation

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact. For example,
--   <tt>pa-4abcdjnxjj6ne</tt>.
[$sel:provisioningArtifactId:FailedServiceActionAssociation'] :: FailedServiceActionAssociation -> Maybe Text

-- | The error code. Valid values are listed below.
[$sel:errorCode:FailedServiceActionAssociation'] :: FailedServiceActionAssociation -> Maybe ServiceActionAssociationErrorCode

-- | A text description of the error.
[$sel:errorMessage:FailedServiceActionAssociation'] :: FailedServiceActionAssociation -> Maybe Text

-- | The self-service action identifier. For example,
--   <tt>act-fs7abcd89wxyz</tt>.
[$sel:serviceActionId:FailedServiceActionAssociation'] :: FailedServiceActionAssociation -> Maybe Text

-- | The product identifier. For example, <tt>prod-abcdzk7xy33qa</tt>.
[$sel:productId:FailedServiceActionAssociation'] :: FailedServiceActionAssociation -> Maybe Text

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   identifier of the provisioning artifact. For example,
--   <tt>pa-4abcdjnxjj6ne</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCode:FailedServiceActionAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>failedServiceActionAssociation_errorCode</a> - The error code.
--   Valid values are listed below.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorMessage:FailedServiceActionAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>failedServiceActionAssociation_errorMessage</a> - A text
--   description of the error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceActionId:FailedServiceActionAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>failedServiceActionAssociation_serviceActionId</a> - The
--   self-service action identifier. For example,
--   <tt>act-fs7abcd89wxyz</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productId:FailedServiceActionAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>failedServiceActionAssociation_productId</a> - The product
--   identifier. For example, <tt>prod-abcdzk7xy33qa</tt>.
newFailedServiceActionAssociation :: FailedServiceActionAssociation

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact. For example,
--   <tt>pa-4abcdjnxjj6ne</tt>.
failedServiceActionAssociation_provisioningArtifactId :: Lens' FailedServiceActionAssociation (Maybe Text)

-- | The error code. Valid values are listed below.
failedServiceActionAssociation_errorCode :: Lens' FailedServiceActionAssociation (Maybe ServiceActionAssociationErrorCode)

-- | A text description of the error.
failedServiceActionAssociation_errorMessage :: Lens' FailedServiceActionAssociation (Maybe Text)

-- | The self-service action identifier. For example,
--   <tt>act-fs7abcd89wxyz</tt>.
failedServiceActionAssociation_serviceActionId :: Lens' FailedServiceActionAssociation (Maybe Text)

-- | The product identifier. For example, <tt>prod-abcdzk7xy33qa</tt>.
failedServiceActionAssociation_productId :: Lens' FailedServiceActionAssociation (Maybe Text)

--   portfolio-product relationship.

newLaunchPathSummary :: LaunchPathSummary

-- | The tags associated with this product path.
launchPathSummary_tags :: Lens' LaunchPathSummary (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The constraints that the administrator has put on the parameter.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newParameterConstraints</a> smart constructor.
data ParameterConstraints
ParameterConstraints' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> ParameterConstraints

-- | A numeric value that determines the largest numeric value you want to
--   allow for <tt>Number</tt> types.
[$sel:maxValue:ParameterConstraints'] :: ParameterConstraints -> Maybe Text

-- | An integer value that determines the largest number of characters you
--   want to allow for <tt>String</tt> types.
[$sel:maxLength:ParameterConstraints'] :: ParameterConstraints -> Maybe Text

-- | A string that explains a constraint when the constraint is violated.
--   For example, without a constraint description, a parameter that has an
--   allowed pattern of <tt>[A-Za-z0-9]+</tt> displays the following error
--   message when the user specifies an invalid value:
--   
--   <pre>
--   Malformed input-Parameter MyParameter must match pattern [A-Za-z0-9]+
--   </pre>
--   
--   By adding a constraint description, such as must only contain letters
--   (uppercase and lowercase) and numbers, you can display the following
--   customized error message:
--   
--   <pre>
--   Malformed input-Parameter MyParameter must only contain uppercase and lowercase letters and numbers.
--   </pre>
[$sel:constraintDescription:ParameterConstraints'] :: ParameterConstraints -> Maybe Text

-- | An integer value that determines the smallest number of characters you
--   want to allow for <tt>String</tt> types.
[$sel:minLength:ParameterConstraints'] :: ParameterConstraints -> Maybe Text

-- | A regular expression that represents the patterns that allow for
--   <tt>String</tt> types. The pattern must match the entire parameter
--   value provided.
[$sel:allowedPattern:ParameterConstraints'] :: ParameterConstraints -> Maybe Text

-- | The values that the administrator has allowed for the parameter.
[$sel:allowedValues:ParameterConstraints'] :: ParameterConstraints -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A numeric value that determines the smallest numeric value you want to
--   allow for <tt>Number</tt> types.
[$sel:minValue:ParameterConstraints'] :: ParameterConstraints -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ParameterConstraints</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxValue:ParameterConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>parameterConstraints_maxValue</a> - A numeric value that determines
--   the largest numeric value you want to allow for <tt>Number</tt> types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxLength:ParameterConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>parameterConstraints_maxLength</a> - An integer value that
--   determines the largest number of characters you want to allow for
--   <tt>String</tt> types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:constraintDescription:ParameterConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>parameterConstraints_constraintDescription</a> - A string that
--   explains a constraint when the constraint is violated. For example,
--   without a constraint description, a parameter that has an allowed
--   pattern of <tt>[A-Za-z0-9]+</tt> displays the following error message
--   when the user specifies an invalid value:
--   
--   <pre>
--   Malformed input-Parameter MyParameter must match pattern [A-Za-z0-9]+
--   </pre>
--   
--   By adding a constraint description, such as must only contain letters
--   (uppercase and lowercase) and numbers, you can display the following
--   customized error message:
--   
--   <pre>
--   Malformed input-Parameter MyParameter must only contain uppercase and lowercase letters and numbers.
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:minLength:ParameterConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>parameterConstraints_minLength</a> - An integer value that
--   determines the smallest number of characters you want to allow for
--   <tt>String</tt> types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedPattern:ParameterConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>parameterConstraints_allowedPattern</a> - A regular expression that
--   represents the patterns that allow for <tt>String</tt> types. The
--   pattern must match the entire parameter value provided.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedValues:ParameterConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>parameterConstraints_allowedValues</a> - The values that the
--   administrator has allowed for the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minValue:ParameterConstraints'</a>,
--   <a>parameterConstraints_minValue</a> - A numeric value that determines
--   the smallest numeric value you want to allow for <tt>Number</tt>
--   types.
newParameterConstraints :: ParameterConstraints

-- | A numeric value that determines the largest numeric value you want to
--   allow for <tt>Number</tt> types.
parameterConstraints_maxValue :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)

-- | An integer value that determines the largest number of characters you
--   want to allow for <tt>String</tt> types.
parameterConstraints_maxLength :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)

-- | A string that explains a constraint when the constraint is violated.
--   For example, without a constraint description, a parameter that has an
--   allowed pattern of <tt>[A-Za-z0-9]+</tt> displays the following error
--   message when the user specifies an invalid value:
--   
--   <pre>
--   Malformed input-Parameter MyParameter must match pattern [A-Za-z0-9]+
--   </pre>
--   
--   By adding a constraint description, such as must only contain letters
--   (uppercase and lowercase) and numbers, you can display the following
--   customized error message:
--   
--   <pre>
--   Malformed input-Parameter MyParameter must only contain uppercase and lowercase letters and numbers.
--   </pre>
parameterConstraints_constraintDescription :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)

-- | An integer value that determines the smallest number of characters you
--   want to allow for <tt>String</tt> types.
parameterConstraints_minLength :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)

-- | A regular expression that represents the patterns that allow for
--   <tt>String</tt> types. The pattern must match the entire parameter
--   value provided.
parameterConstraints_allowedPattern :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)

-- | The values that the administrator has allowed for the parameter.
parameterConstraints_allowedValues :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe [Text])

-- | A numeric value that determines the smallest numeric value you want to
--   allow for <tt>Number</tt> types.
parameterConstraints_minValue :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about a portfolio.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPortfolioDetail</a> smart constructor.
data PortfolioDetail
PortfolioDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PortfolioDetail

-- | The ARN assigned to the portfolio.
[$sel:arn:PortfolioDetail'] :: PortfolioDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
[$sel:createdTime:PortfolioDetail'] :: PortfolioDetail -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The portfolio identifier.
[$sel:id:PortfolioDetail'] :: PortfolioDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The name to use for display purposes.
[$sel:displayName:PortfolioDetail'] :: PortfolioDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the portfolio.
[$sel:description:PortfolioDetail'] :: PortfolioDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the portfolio provider.
[$sel:providerName:PortfolioDetail'] :: PortfolioDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PortfolioDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:PortfolioDetail'</a>, <a>portfolioDetail_arn</a> - The ARN
--   assigned to the portfolio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdTime:PortfolioDetail'</a>,
--   <a>portfolioDetail_createdTime</a> - The UTC time stamp of the
--   creation time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:PortfolioDetail'</a>, <a>portfolioDetail_id</a> - The
--   portfolio identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:PortfolioDetail'</a>,
--   <a>portfolioDetail_displayName</a> - The name to use for display
--   purposes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:PortfolioDetail'</a>,
--   <a>portfolioDetail_description</a> - The description of the portfolio.
--   
--   <a>$sel:providerName:PortfolioDetail'</a>,
--   <a>portfolioDetail_providerName</a> - The name of the portfolio
--   provider.
newPortfolioDetail :: PortfolioDetail

-- | The ARN assigned to the portfolio.
portfolioDetail_arn :: Lens' PortfolioDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
portfolioDetail_createdTime :: Lens' PortfolioDetail (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The portfolio identifier.
portfolioDetail_id :: Lens' PortfolioDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The name to use for display purposes.
portfolioDetail_displayName :: Lens' PortfolioDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the portfolio.
portfolioDetail_description :: Lens' PortfolioDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the portfolio provider.
portfolioDetail_providerName :: Lens' PortfolioDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the portfolio share.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPortfolioShareDetail</a> smart constructor.
data PortfolioShareDetail
PortfolioShareDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe DescribePortfolioShareType -> Maybe Bool -> PortfolioShareDetail

-- | The identifier of the recipient entity that received the portfolio
--   share. The recipient entities can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>An external account.</li>
--   <li>An organziation member account.</li>
--   <li>An organzational unit (OU).</li>
--   <li>The organization itself. (This shares with every account in the
--   organization).</li>
--   </ol>
[$sel:principalId:PortfolioShareDetail'] :: PortfolioShareDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether TagOptions sharing is enabled or disabled for the
--   portfolio share.
[$sel:shareTagOptions:PortfolioShareDetail'] :: PortfolioShareDetail -> Maybe Bool

-- | The type of the portfolio share.
[$sel:type':PortfolioShareDetail'] :: PortfolioShareDetail -> Maybe DescribePortfolioShareType

-- | Indicates whether the shared portfolio is imported by the recipient
--   account. If the recipient is in an organization node, the share is
--   automatically imported, and the field is always set to true.
[$sel:accepted:PortfolioShareDetail'] :: PortfolioShareDetail -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>PortfolioShareDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:principalId:PortfolioShareDetail'</a>,
--   <a>portfolioShareDetail_principalId</a> - The identifier of the
--   recipient entity that received the portfolio share. The recipient
--   entities can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>An external account.</li>
--   <li>An organziation member account.</li>
--   <li>An organzational unit (OU).</li>
--   <li>The organization itself. (This shares with every account in the
--   organization).</li>
--   </ol>
--   
--   <a>$sel:shareTagOptions:PortfolioShareDetail'</a>,
--   <a>portfolioShareDetail_shareTagOptions</a> - Indicates whether
--   TagOptions sharing is enabled or disabled for the portfolio share.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':PortfolioShareDetail'</a>,
--   <a>portfolioShareDetail_type</a> - The type of the portfolio share.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accepted:PortfolioShareDetail'</a>,
--   <a>portfolioShareDetail_accepted</a> - Indicates whether the shared
--   portfolio is imported by the recipient account. If the recipient is in
--   an organization node, the share is automatically imported, and the
--   field is always set to true.
newPortfolioShareDetail :: PortfolioShareDetail

-- | The identifier of the recipient entity that received the portfolio
--   share. The recipient entities can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>An external account.</li>
--   <li>An organziation member account.</li>
--   <li>An organzational unit (OU).</li>
--   <li>The organization itself. (This shares with every account in the
--   organization).</li>
--   </ol>
portfolioShareDetail_principalId :: Lens' PortfolioShareDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether TagOptions sharing is enabled or disabled for the
--   portfolio share.
portfolioShareDetail_shareTagOptions :: Lens' PortfolioShareDetail (Maybe Bool)

-- | The type of the portfolio share.
portfolioShareDetail_type :: Lens' PortfolioShareDetail (Maybe DescribePortfolioShareType)

-- | Indicates whether the shared portfolio is imported by the recipient
--   account. If the recipient is in an organization node, the share is
--   automatically imported, and the field is always set to true.
portfolioShareDetail_accepted :: Lens' PortfolioShareDetail (Maybe Bool)

-- | Information about a principal.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPrincipal</a> smart constructor.
data Principal
Principal' :: Maybe PrincipalType -> Maybe Text -> Principal

-- | The principal type. The supported value is <tt>IAM</tt>.
[$sel:principalType:Principal'] :: Principal -> Maybe PrincipalType

-- | The ARN of the principal (IAM user, role, or group).
[$sel:principalARN:Principal'] :: Principal -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Principal</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:principalType:Principal'</a>, <a>principal_principalType</a> -
--   The principal type. The supported value is <tt>IAM</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:principalARN:Principal'</a>, <a>principal_principalARN</a> -
--   The ARN of the principal (IAM user, role, or group).
newPrincipal :: Principal

-- | The principal type. The supported value is <tt>IAM</tt>.
principal_principalType :: Lens' Principal (Maybe PrincipalType)

-- | The ARN of the principal (IAM user, role, or group).
principal_principalARN :: Lens' Principal (Maybe Text)

-- | A single product view aggregation value/count pair, containing
--   metadata about each product to which the calling user has access.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProductViewAggregationValue</a> smart constructor.
data ProductViewAggregationValue
ProductViewAggregationValue' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> ProductViewAggregationValue

-- | The value of the product view aggregation.
[$sel:value:ProductViewAggregationValue'] :: ProductViewAggregationValue -> Maybe Text

-- | An approximate count of the products that match the value.
[$sel:approximateCount:ProductViewAggregationValue'] :: ProductViewAggregationValue -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ProductViewAggregationValue</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ProductViewAggregationValue'</a>,

--   view aggregation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:approximateCount:ProductViewAggregationValue'</a>,
--   <a>productViewAggregationValue_approximateCount</a> - An approximate
--   count of the products that match the value.
newProductViewAggregationValue :: ProductViewAggregationValue

productViewAggregationValue_approximateCount :: Lens' ProductViewAggregationValue (Maybe Int)

-- | Information about a product view.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProductViewDetail</a> smart constructor.
data ProductViewDetail
ProductViewDetail' :: Maybe RequestStatus -> Maybe ProductViewSummary -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> ProductViewDetail

-- | The status of the product.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AVAILABLE</tt> - The product is ready for use.</li>
--   <li><tt>CREATING</tt> - Product creation has started; the product is
--   not ready for use.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> - An action failed.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:ProductViewDetail'] :: ProductViewDetail -> Maybe RequestStatus

-- | Summary information about the product view.
[$sel:productViewSummary:ProductViewDetail'] :: ProductViewDetail -> Maybe ProductViewSummary

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
[$sel:createdTime:ProductViewDetail'] :: ProductViewDetail -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ARN of the product.
[$sel:productARN:ProductViewDetail'] :: ProductViewDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ProductViewDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ProductViewDetail'</a>, <a>productViewDetail_status</a>
--   - The status of the product.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AVAILABLE</tt> - The product is ready for use.</li>
--   <li><tt>CREATING</tt> - Product creation has started; the product is
--   not ready for use.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> - An action failed.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:productViewSummary:ProductViewDetail'</a>,
--   <a>productViewDetail_productViewSummary</a> - Summary information
--   about the product view.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdTime:ProductViewDetail'</a>,
--   <a>productViewDetail_createdTime</a> - The UTC time stamp of the
--   creation time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productARN:ProductViewDetail'</a>,
--   <a>productViewDetail_productARN</a> - The ARN of the product.
newProductViewDetail :: ProductViewDetail

-- | The status of the product.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AVAILABLE</tt> - The product is ready for use.</li>
--   <li><tt>CREATING</tt> - Product creation has started; the product is
--   not ready for use.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> - An action failed.</li>
--   </ul>
productViewDetail_status :: Lens' ProductViewDetail (Maybe RequestStatus)

-- | Summary information about the product view.
productViewDetail_productViewSummary :: Lens' ProductViewDetail (Maybe ProductViewSummary)

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
productViewDetail_createdTime :: Lens' ProductViewDetail (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ARN of the product.
productViewDetail_productARN :: Lens' ProductViewDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | Summary information about a product view.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProductViewSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ProductViewSummary
ProductViewSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ProductType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ProductViewSummary

-- | The owner of the product. Contact the product administrator for the
--   significance of this value.
[$sel:owner:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL information to obtain support for this Product.
[$sel:supportUrl:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Short description of the product.
[$sel:shortDescription:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether the product has a default path. If the product does
--   not have a default path, call ListLaunchPaths to disambiguate between
--   paths. Otherwise, ListLaunchPaths is not required, and the output of
--   ProductViewSummary can be used directly with
--   DescribeProvisioningParameters.
[$sel:hasDefaultPath:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Bool

-- | The distributor of the product. Contact the product administrator for
--   the significance of this value.
[$sel:distributor:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the product.
[$sel:name:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The product view identifier.
[$sel:id:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The product type. Contact the product administrator for the
--   significance of this value. If this value is <tt>MARKETPLACE</tt>, the
--   product was created by AWS Marketplace.
[$sel:type':ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe ProductType

-- | The email contact information to obtain support for this Product.
[$sel:supportEmail:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The product identifier.
[$sel:productId:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the support for this Product.
[$sel:supportDescription:ProductViewSummary'] :: ProductViewSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ProductViewSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:owner:ProductViewSummary'</a>, <a>productViewSummary_owner</a>
--   - The owner of the product. Contact the product administrator for the
--   significance of this value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportUrl:ProductViewSummary'</a>,
--   <a>productViewSummary_supportUrl</a> - The URL information to obtain
--   support for this Product.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shortDescription:ProductViewSummary'</a>,
--   <a>productViewSummary_shortDescription</a> - Short description of the
--   product.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasDefaultPath:ProductViewSummary'</a>,
--   <a>productViewSummary_hasDefaultPath</a> - Indicates whether the
--   product has a default path. If the product does not have a default
--   path, call ListLaunchPaths to disambiguate between paths. Otherwise,
--   ListLaunchPaths is not required, and the output of ProductViewSummary
--   can be used directly with DescribeProvisioningParameters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:distributor:ProductViewSummary'</a>,
--   <a>productViewSummary_distributor</a> - The distributor of the
--   product. Contact the product administrator for the significance of
--   this value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ProductViewSummary'</a>, <a>productViewSummary_name</a> -
--   The name of the product.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ProductViewSummary'</a>, <a>productViewSummary_id</a> - The
--   product view identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ProductViewSummary'</a>, <a>productViewSummary_type</a>
--   - The product type. Contact the product administrator for the
--   significance of this value. If this value is <tt>MARKETPLACE</tt>, the
--   product was created by AWS Marketplace.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportEmail:ProductViewSummary'</a>,
--   <a>productViewSummary_supportEmail</a> - The email contact information
--   to obtain support for this Product.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productId:ProductViewSummary'</a>,
--   <a>productViewSummary_productId</a> - The product identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportDescription:ProductViewSummary'</a>,
--   <a>productViewSummary_supportDescription</a> - The description of the
--   support for this Product.
newProductViewSummary :: ProductViewSummary

--   significance of this value.

productViewSummary_supportUrl :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

productViewSummary_shortDescription :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether the product has a default path. If the product does
--   not have a default path, call ListLaunchPaths to disambiguate between
--   paths. Otherwise, ListLaunchPaths is not required, and the output of
--   ProductViewSummary can be used directly with
--   DescribeProvisioningParameters.

--   the significance of this value.
