-- | Errors that occurred during the portfolio share operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newShareError</a> smart constructor.
data ShareError
ShareError' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ShareError

-- | List of accounts impacted by the error.
[$sel:accounts:ShareError'] :: ShareError -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Error type that happened when processing the operation.
[$sel:error:ShareError'] :: ShareError -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the error.
[$sel:message:ShareError'] :: ShareError -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ShareError</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accounts:ShareError'</a>, <a>shareError_accounts</a> - List of
--   accounts impacted by the error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:error:ShareError'</a>, <a>shareError_error</a> - Error type
--   that happened when processing the operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:ShareError'</a>, <a>shareError_message</a> -
--   Information about the error.
newShareError :: ShareError

-- | List of accounts impacted by the error.
shareError_accounts :: Lens' ShareError (Maybe [Text])

-- | Error type that happened when processing the operation.
shareError_error :: Lens' ShareError (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the error.
shareError_message :: Lens' ShareError (Maybe Text)

-- | An AWS CloudFormation stack, in a specific account and region, that's
--   part of a stack set operation. A stack instance is a reference to an
--   attempted or actual stack in a given account within a given region. A
--   stack instance can exist without a stackfor example, if the stack
--   couldn't be created for some reason. A stack instance is associated
--   with only one stack set. Each stack instance contains the ID of its
--   associated stack set, as well as the ID of the actual stack and the
--   stack status.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackInstance</a> smart constructor.
data StackInstance
StackInstance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackInstanceStatus -> StackInstance

-- | The name of the AWS account that the stack instance is associated
--   with.
[$sel:account:StackInstance'] :: StackInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the AWS region that the stack instance is associated with.
[$sel:region:StackInstance'] :: StackInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the stack instance, in terms of its synchronization with
--   its associated stack set.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>INOPERABLE</tt>: A <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation has
--   failed and left the stack in an unstable state. Stacks in this state
--   are excluded from further <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operations. You
--   might need to perform a <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation, with
--   <tt>RetainStacks</tt> set to true, to delete the stack instance, and
--   then delete the stack manually.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUTDATED</tt>: The stack isn't currently up to date with the
--   stack set because either the associated stack failed during a
--   <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operation, or the
--   stack was part of a <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt>
--   operation that failed or was stopped before the stack was created or
--   updated.</li>
--   <li><tt>CURRENT</tt>: The stack is currently up to date with the stack
--   set.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:stackInstanceStatus:StackInstance'] :: StackInstance -> Maybe StackInstanceStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>StackInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:account:StackInstance'</a>, <a>stackInstance_account</a> - The
--   name of the AWS account that the stack instance is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:StackInstance'</a>, <a>stackInstance_region</a> - The
--   name of the AWS region that the stack instance is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackInstanceStatus:StackInstance'</a>,
--   <a>stackInstance_stackInstanceStatus</a> - The status of the stack
--   instance, in terms of its synchronization with its associated stack
--   set.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>INOPERABLE</tt>: A <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation has
--   failed and left the stack in an unstable state. Stacks in this state
--   are excluded from further <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operations. You
--   might need to perform a <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation, with
--   <tt>RetainStacks</tt> set to true, to delete the stack instance, and
--   then delete the stack manually.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUTDATED</tt>: The stack isn't currently up to date with the
--   stack set because either the associated stack failed during a
--   <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operation, or the
--   stack was part of a <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt>
--   operation that failed or was stopped before the stack was created or
--   updated.</li>
--   <li><tt>CURRENT</tt>: The stack is currently up to date with the stack
--   set.</li>
--   </ul>
newStackInstance :: StackInstance

-- | The name of the AWS account that the stack instance is associated
--   with.
stackInstance_account :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the AWS region that the stack instance is associated with.
stackInstance_region :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the stack instance, in terms of its synchronization with
--   its associated stack set.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>INOPERABLE</tt>: A <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation has
--   failed and left the stack in an unstable state. Stacks in this state
--   are excluded from further <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operations. You
--   might need to perform a <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation, with
--   <tt>RetainStacks</tt> set to true, to delete the stack instance, and
--   then delete the stack manually.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUTDATED</tt>: The stack isn't currently up to date with the
--   stack set because either the associated stack failed during a
--   <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operation, or the
--   stack was part of a <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt>
--   operation that failed or was stopped before the stack was created or
--   updated.</li>
--   <li><tt>CURRENT</tt>: The stack is currently up to date with the stack
--   set.</li>
--   </ul>
stackInstance_stackInstanceStatus :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe StackInstanceStatus)

-- | Information about a tag. A tag is a key-value pair. Tags are
--   propagated to the resources created when provisioning a product.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | The tag key.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | The value for this key.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The tag key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The value for this key.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | The tag key.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The value for this key.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | Information about a TagOption.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTagOptionDetail</a> smart constructor.
data TagOptionDetail
TagOptionDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> TagOptionDetail

-- | The TagOption value.
[$sel:value:TagOptionDetail'] :: TagOptionDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The AWS account Id of the owner account that created the TagOption.
[$sel:owner:TagOptionDetail'] :: TagOptionDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The TagOption active state.
[$sel:active:TagOptionDetail'] :: TagOptionDetail -> Maybe Bool

-- | The TagOption key.
[$sel:key:TagOptionDetail'] :: TagOptionDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The TagOption identifier.
[$sel:id:TagOptionDetail'] :: TagOptionDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TagOptionDetail</a> with all optional fields

-- | The parameter key-value pair used to update a provisioned product.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateProvisioningParameter</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateProvisioningParameter
UpdateProvisioningParameter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> UpdateProvisioningParameter

-- | The parameter value.
[$sel:value:UpdateProvisioningParameter'] :: UpdateProvisioningParameter -> Maybe Text

-- | The parameter key.
[$sel:key:UpdateProvisioningParameter'] :: UpdateProvisioningParameter -> Maybe Text

-- | If set to true, <tt>Value</tt> is ignored and the previous parameter
--   value is kept.
[$sel:usePreviousValue:UpdateProvisioningParameter'] :: UpdateProvisioningParameter -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateProvisioningParameter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   <tt>Value</tt> is ignored and the previous parameter value is kept.
newUpdateProvisioningParameter :: UpdateProvisioningParameter

updateProvisioningParameter_key :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningParameter (Maybe Text)

--   value is kept.
updateProvisioningParameter_usePreviousValue :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningParameter (Maybe Bool)

-- | The user-defined preferences that will be applied when updating a
--   provisioned product. Not all preferences are applicable to all
--   provisioned product types.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateProvisioningPreferences</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateProvisioningPreferences
UpdateProvisioningPreferences' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe StackSetOperationType -> UpdateProvisioningPreferences

-- | One or more AWS Regions where the provisioned product will be
--   available.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The specified regions should be within the list of regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of regions in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
[$sel:stackSetRegions:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'] :: UpdateProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The maximum percentage of accounts in which to perform this operation
--   at one time.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   This is true except in cases where rounding down would result is zero.
--   In this case, AWS Service Catalog sets the number as <tt>1</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
[$sel:stackSetMaxConcurrencyPercentage:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'] :: UpdateProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe Natural

-- | The number of accounts, per region, for which this operation can fail
--   before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that region. If the
--   operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog doesn't attempt
--   the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>0</tt> if no value is specified.
[$sel:stackSetFailureToleranceCount:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'] :: UpdateProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe Natural

-- | The percentage of accounts, per region, for which this stack operation
--   can fail before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that
--   region. If the operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog
--   doesn't attempt the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
[$sel:stackSetFailureTolerancePercentage:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'] :: UpdateProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe Natural

-- | One or more AWS accounts that will have access to the provisioned
--   product.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The AWS accounts specified should be within the list of accounts in
--   the <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of accounts in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all accounts from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
[$sel:stackSetAccounts:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'] :: UpdateProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The maximum number of accounts in which to perform this operation at
--   one time. This is dependent on the value of
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> is at most one more than the
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
[$sel:stackSetMaxConcurrencyCount:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'] :: UpdateProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe Natural

-- | Determines what action AWS Service Catalog performs to a stack set or
--   a stack instance represented by the provisioned product. The default
--   value is <tt>UPDATE</tt> if nothing is specified.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>CREATE</i> Creates a new stack instance in the stack set
--   represented by the provisioned product. In this case, only new stack
--   instances are created based on accounts and regions; if new ProductId
--   or ProvisioningArtifactID are passed, they will be ignored.</li>
--   <li><i>UPDATE</i> Updates the stack set represented by the provisioned
--   product and also its stack instances.</li>
--   <li><i>DELETE</i> Deletes a stack instance in the stack set
--   represented by the provisioned product.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:stackSetOperationType:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'] :: UpdateProvisioningPreferences -> Maybe StackSetOperationType

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateProvisioningPreferences</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetRegions:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetRegions</a> - One or more AWS
--   Regions where the provisioned product will be available.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The specified regions should be within the list of regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of regions in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetMaxConcurrencyPercentage:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetMaxConcurrencyPercentage</a>
--   - The maximum percentage of accounts in which to perform this
--   operation at one time.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   This is true except in cases where rounding down would result is zero.
--   In this case, AWS Service Catalog sets the number as <tt>1</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetFailureToleranceCount:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetFailureToleranceCount</a> -
--   The number of accounts, per region, for which this operation can fail
--   before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that region. If the
--   operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog doesn't attempt
--   the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>0</tt> if no value is specified.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetFailureTolerancePercentage:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</a>
--   - The percentage of accounts, per region, for which this stack
--   operation can fail before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in
--   that region. If the operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service
--   Catalog doesn't attempt the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified

--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetAccounts:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetAccounts</a> - One or more
--   AWS accounts that will have access to the provisioned product.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The AWS accounts specified should be within the list of accounts in
--   the <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of accounts in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all accounts from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetMaxConcurrencyCount:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetMaxConcurrencyCount</a> - The
--   maximum number of accounts in which to perform this operation at one
--   time. This is dependent on the value of
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> is at most one more than the
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackSetOperationType:UpdateProvisioningPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetOperationType</a> -
--   Determines what action AWS Service Catalog performs to a stack set or
--   a stack instance represented by the provisioned product. The default
--   value is <tt>UPDATE</tt> if nothing is specified.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>CREATE</i> Creates a new stack instance in the stack set
--   represented by the provisioned product. In this case, only new stack
--   instances are created based on accounts and regions; if new ProductId
--   or ProvisioningArtifactID are passed, they will be ignored.</li>
--   <li><i>UPDATE</i> Updates the stack set represented by the provisioned
--   product and also its stack instances.</li>
--   <li><i>DELETE</i> Deletes a stack instance in the stack set
--   represented by the provisioned product.</li>
--   </ul>
newUpdateProvisioningPreferences :: UpdateProvisioningPreferences

-- | One or more AWS Regions where the provisioned product will be
--   available.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The specified regions should be within the list of regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of regions in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetRegions :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe [Text])

-- | The maximum percentage of accounts in which to perform this operation
--   at one time.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   This is true except in cases where rounding down would result is zero.
--   In this case, AWS Service Catalog sets the number as <tt>1</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetMaxConcurrencyPercentage :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | The number of accounts, per region, for which this operation can fail
--   before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that region. If the
--   operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog doesn't attempt
--   the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--

--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>0</tt> if no value is specified.
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetFailureToleranceCount :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | The percentage of accounts, per region, for which this stack operation
--   can fail before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that
--   region. If the operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog
--   doesn't attempt the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified

updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetFailureTolerancePercentage :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

--   product.
--

--   the <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of accounts in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.

--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetAccounts :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe [Text])

-- | The maximum number of accounts in which to perform this operation at
--   one time. This is dependent on the value of
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> is at most one more than the
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.

--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetMaxConcurrencyCount :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | Determines what action AWS Service Catalog performs to a stack set or
--   a stack instance represented by the provisioned product. The default
--   value is <tt>UPDATE</tt> if nothing is specified.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--

--   represented by the provisioned product. In this case, only new stack
--   instances are created based on accounts and regions; if new ProductId
--   or ProvisioningArtifactID are passed, they will be ignored.</li>

--   represented by the provisioned product.</li>

updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetOperationType :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe StackSetOperationType)

-- | Additional information provided by the administrator.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUsageInstruction</a> smart constructor.
data UsageInstruction
UsageInstruction' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> UsageInstruction

-- | The usage instruction value for this type.
[$sel:value:UsageInstruction'] :: UsageInstruction -> Maybe Text

-- | The usage instruction type for the value.
[$sel:type':UsageInstruction'] :: UsageInstruction -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UsageInstruction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:UsageInstruction'</a>, <a>usageInstruction_value</a> -
--   The usage instruction value for this type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':UsageInstruction'</a>, <a>usageInstruction_type</a> -
--   The usage instruction type for the value.
newUsageInstruction :: UsageInstruction

-- | The usage instruction value for this type.
usageInstruction_value :: Lens' UsageInstruction (Maybe Text)

-- | The usage instruction type for the value.
usageInstruction_type :: Lens' UsageInstruction (Maybe Text)


-- | Terminates the specified provisioned product.
--   
--   This operation does not delete any records associated with the
--   provisioned product.
--   
--   You can check the status of this request using DescribeRecord.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.TerminateProvisionedProduct

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTerminateProvisionedProduct</a> smart constructor.
data TerminateProvisionedProduct
TerminateProvisionedProduct' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> TerminateProvisionedProduct

-- | The name of the provisioned product. You cannot specify both
--   <tt>ProvisionedProductName</tt> and <tt>ProvisionedProductId</tt>.
[$sel:provisionedProductName:TerminateProvisionedProduct'] :: TerminateProvisionedProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | When this boolean parameter is set to true, the
--   <tt>TerminateProvisionedProduct</tt> API deletes the Service Catalog
--   provisioned product. However, it does not remove the CloudFormation
--   stack, stack set, or the underlying resources of the deleted
--   provisioned product. The default value is false.
[$sel:retainPhysicalResources:TerminateProvisionedProduct'] :: TerminateProvisionedProduct -> Maybe Bool

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:acceptLanguage:TerminateProvisionedProduct'] :: TerminateProvisionedProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | If set to true, AWS Service Catalog stops managing the specified
--   provisioned product even if it cannot delete the underlying resources.
[$sel:ignoreErrors:TerminateProvisionedProduct'] :: TerminateProvisionedProduct -> Maybe Bool

-- | The identifier of the provisioned product. You cannot specify both
--   <tt>ProvisionedProductName</tt> and <tt>ProvisionedProductId</tt>.
[$sel:provisionedProductId:TerminateProvisionedProduct'] :: TerminateProvisionedProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | An idempotency token that uniquely identifies the termination request.
--   This token is only valid during the termination process. After the
--   provisioned product is terminated, subsequent requests to terminate
--   the same provisioned product always return <b>ResourceNotFound</b>.
[$sel:terminateToken:TerminateProvisionedProduct'] :: TerminateProvisionedProduct -> Text

--

-- | Rejects an offer to share the specified portfolio.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.RejectPortfolioShare

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRejectPortfolioShare</a> smart constructor.
data RejectPortfolioShare
RejectPortfolioShare' :: Maybe PortfolioShareType -> Maybe Text -> Text -> RejectPortfolioShare

-- | The type of shared portfolios to reject. The default is to reject
--   imported portfolios.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_ORGANIZATIONS</tt> - Reject portfolios shared by the
--   management account of your organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>IMPORTED</tt> - Reject imported portfolios.</li>
--   <li><tt>AWS_SERVICECATALOG</tt> - Not supported. (Throws
--   ResourceNotFoundException.)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For example, <tt>aws servicecatalog reject-portfolio-share
--   --portfolio-id "port-2qwzkwxt3y5fk" --portfolio-share-type
--   AWS_ORGANIZATIONS</tt>
[$sel:portfolioShareType:RejectPortfolioShare'] :: RejectPortfolioShare -> Maybe PortfolioShareType

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:acceptLanguage:RejectPortfolioShare'] :: RejectPortfolioShare -> Maybe Text

-- | Provisions the specified product.
--   
--   A provisioned product is a resourced instance of a product. For
--   example, provisioning a product based on a CloudFormation template
--   launches a CloudFormation stack and its underlying resources. You can
--   check the status of this request using DescribeRecord.
--   
--   If the request contains a tag key with an empty list of values, there
--   is a tag conflict for that key. Do not include conflicted keys as
--   tags, or this causes the error "Parameter validation failed: Missing
--   required parameter in Tags[<i>N</i>]:<i>Value</i>".
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.ProvisionProduct

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newProvisionProduct</a> smart constructor.
data ProvisionProduct
ProvisionProduct' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [ProvisioningParameter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe ProvisioningPreferences -> Text -> Text -> ProvisionProduct

-- | The name of the product. You must provide the name or ID, but not
--   both.
[$sel:productName:ProvisionProduct'] :: ProvisionProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact. You must provide the name
--   or ID, but not both.
[$sel:provisioningArtifactId:ProvisionProduct'] :: ProvisionProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the provisioning artifact. You must provide the name or
--   ID, but not both.
[$sel:provisioningArtifactName:ProvisionProduct'] :: ProvisionProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | Passed to CloudFormation. The SNS topic ARNs to which to publish
--   stack-related events.
[$sel:notificationArns:ProvisionProduct'] :: ProvisionProduct -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The name of the path. You must provide the name or ID, but not both.
[$sel:pathName:ProvisionProduct'] :: ProvisionProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:acceptLanguage:ProvisionProduct'] :: ProvisionProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | The path identifier of the product. This value is optional if the
--   product has a default path, and required if the product has more than
--   one path. To list the paths for a product, use ListLaunchPaths. You
--   must provide the name or ID, but not both.
[$sel:pathId:ProvisionProduct'] :: ProvisionProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | Parameters specified by the administrator that are required for
--   provisioning the product.
[$sel:provisioningParameters:ProvisionProduct'] :: ProvisionProduct -> Maybe [ProvisioningParameter]

-- | The product identifier. You must provide the name or ID, but not both.
[$sel:productId:ProvisionProduct'] :: ProvisionProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more tags.
[$sel:tags:ProvisionProduct'] :: ProvisionProduct -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | An object that contains information about the provisioning preferences
--   for a stack set.
[$sel:provisioningPreferences:ProvisionProduct'] :: ProvisionProduct -> Maybe ProvisioningPreferences

-- | A user-friendly name for the provisioned product. This value must be
--   unique for the AWS account and cannot be updated after the product is
--   provisioned.
[$sel:provisionedProductName:ProvisionProduct'] :: ProvisionProduct -> Text

-- | An idempotency token that uniquely identifies the provisioning
--   request.
[$sel:provisionToken:ProvisionProduct'] :: ProvisionProduct -> Text

-- | Lists the organization nodes that have access to the specified
--   portfolio. This API can only be called by the management account in
--   the organization or by a delegated admin.
--   
--   If a delegated admin is de-registered, they can no longer perform this
--   operation.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

--   portfolio.</li>

--   </ul>

-- | The type of shared portfolios to list. The default is to list imported
--   portfolios.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_ORGANIZATIONS</tt> - List portfolios shared by the
--   management account of your organization</li>
--   <li><tt>AWS_SERVICECATALOG</tt> - List default portfolios</li>
--   <li><tt>IMPORTED</tt> - List imported portfolios</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:portfolioShareType:ListAcceptedPortfolioShares'] :: ListAcceptedPortfolioShares -> Maybe PortfolioShareType

-- | The language code.

--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>

--   of results, use null.

-- | Requests the import of a resource as a Service Catalog provisioned
--   product that is associated to a Service Catalog product and
--   provisioning artifact. Once imported, all supported Service Catalog
--   governance actions are supported on the provisioned product.
--   
--   Resource import only supports CloudFormation stack ARNs.
--   CloudFormation StackSets and non-root nested stacks are not supported.
--   
--   The CloudFormation stack must have one of the following statuses to be
--   imported: <tt>CREATE_COMPLETE</tt>, <tt>UPDATE_COMPLETE</tt>,
--   <tt>UPDATE_ROLLBACK_COMPLETE</tt>, <tt>IMPORT_COMPLETE</tt>,
--   <tt>IMPORT_ROLLBACK_COMPLETE</tt>.
--   
--   Import of the resource requires that the CloudFormation stack template
--   matches the associated Service Catalog product provisioning artifact.
--   
--   The user or role that performs this operation must have the
--   <tt>cloudformation:GetTemplate</tt> and
--   <tt>cloudformation:DescribeStacks</tt> IAM policy permissions.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.ImportAsProvisionedProduct

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newImportAsProvisionedProduct</a> smart constructor.
data ImportAsProvisionedProduct
ImportAsProvisionedProduct' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ImportAsProvisionedProduct

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:acceptLanguage:ImportAsProvisionedProduct'] :: ImportAsProvisionedProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | The product identifier.
[$sel:productId:ImportAsProvisionedProduct'] :: ImportAsProvisionedProduct -> Text

-- | The user-friendly name of the provisioned product. The value must be
--   unique for the AWS account. The name cannot be updated after the
--   product is provisioned.
[$sel:provisionedProductName:ImportAsProvisionedProduct'] :: ImportAsProvisionedProduct -> Text

-- | The unique identifier of the resource to be imported. It only
--   currently supports CloudFormation stack IDs.
[$sel:physicalId:ImportAsProvisionedProduct'] :: ImportAsProvisionedProduct -> Text

-- | A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If
--   multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same
--   response is returned for each repeated request.
[$sel:idempotencyToken:ImportAsProvisionedProduct'] :: ImportAsProvisionedProduct -> Text

-- | Enable portfolio sharing feature through AWS Organizations. This API
--   will allow Service Catalog to receive updates on your organization in
--   order to sync your shares with the current structure. This API can
--   only be called by the management account in the organization.
--   
--   By calling this API Service Catalog will make a call to
--   organizations:EnableAWSServiceAccess on your behalf so that your
--   shares can be in sync with any changes in your AWS Organizations
--   structure.
--   
--   Note that a delegated administrator is not authorized to invoke
--   <tt>EnableAWSOrganizationsAccess</tt>.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.EnableAWSOrganizationsAccess

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newEnableAWSOrganizationsAccess</a> smart constructor.

-- | Disable portfolio sharing through AWS Organizations feature. This
--   feature will not delete your current shares but it will prevent you
--   from creating new shares throughout your organization. Current shares
--   will not be in sync with your organization structure if it changes
--   after calling this API. This API can only be called by the management
--   account in the organization.
--   
--   This API can't be invoked if there are active delegated administrators
--   in the organization.
--   
--   Note that a delegated administrator is not authorized to invoke
--   <tt>DisableAWSOrganizationsAccess</tt>.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.DisableAWSOrganizationsAccess

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisableAWSOrganizationsAccess</a> smart constructor.
data DisableAWSOrganizationsAccess
DisableAWSOrganizationsAccess' :: DisableAWSOrganizationsAccess

-- | Create a value of <a>DisableAWSOrganizationsAccess</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDisableAWSOrganizationsAccess :: DisableAWSOrganizationsAccess

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisableAWSOrganizationsAccessResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

--   all optional fields omitted.

-- | Gets information about the specified request operation.
--   
--   Use this operation after calling a request operation (for example,
--   ProvisionProduct, TerminateProvisionedProduct, or
--   UpdateProvisionedProduct).
--   
--   If a provisioned product was transferred to a new owner using
--   UpdateProvisionedProductProperties, the new owner will be able to
--   describe all past records for that product. The previous owner will no
--   longer be able to describe the records, but will be able to use
--   ListRecordHistory to see the product's history from when he was the
--   owner.

-- | Gets information about the configuration required to provision the
--   specified product using the specified provisioning artifact.
--   
--   If the output contains a TagOption key with an empty list of values,
--   there is a TagOption conflict for that key. The end user cannot take
--   action to fix the conflict, and launch is not blocked. In subsequent
--   calls to ProvisionProduct, do not include conflicted TagOption keys as
--   tags, or this causes the error "Parameter validation failed: Missing
--   required parameter in Tags[<i>N</i>]:<i>Value</i>". Tag the
--   provisioned product with the value
--   <tt>sc-tagoption-conflict-portfolioId-productId</tt>.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.DescribeProvisioningParameters

-- | Gets information about the specified provisioned product.

-- | DescribeProvisionedProductAPI input structure. AcceptLanguage -
--   [Optional] The language code for localization. Id - [Optional] The
--   provisioned product identifier. Name - [Optional] Another provisioned
--   product identifier. Customers must provide either Id or Name.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeProvisionedProduct</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeProvisionedProduct

--   but not both.
--   
--   If you do not provide a name or ID, or you provide both name and ID,
--   an <tt>InvalidParametersException</tt> will occur.

-- | The language code.

--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>

--   but not both.

-- | Returns a summary of each of the portfolio shares that were created
--   for the specified portfolio.
--   
--   You can use this API to determine which accounts or organizational
--   nodes this portfolio have been shared, whether the recipient entity
--   has imported the share, and whether TagOptions are included with the
--   share.
--   
--   The <tt>PortfolioId</tt> and <tt>Type</tt> parameters are both
--   required.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.DescribePortfolioShares

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribePortfolioShares</a> smart constructor.
data DescribePortfolioShares
DescribePortfolioShares' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> DescribePortfolioShareType -> DescribePortfolioShares

-- | The page token for the next set of results. To retrieve the first set
--   of results, use null.
[$sel:pageToken:DescribePortfolioShares'] :: DescribePortfolioShares -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of items to return with this call.
[$sel:pageSize:DescribePortfolioShares'] :: DescribePortfolioShares -> Maybe Natural

-- | The unique identifier of the portfolio for which shares will be
--   retrieved.
[$sel:portfolioId:DescribePortfolioShares'] :: DescribePortfolioShares -> Text

-- | The type of portfolio share to summarize. This field acts as a filter
--   on the type of portfolio share, which can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li><tt>ACCOUNT</tt> - Represents an external account to account
--   share.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATION</tt> - Represents a share to an organization.
--   This share is available to every account in the organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATIONAL_UNIT</tt> - Represents a share to an
--   organizational unit.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATION_MEMBER_ACCOUNT</tt> - Represents a share to an
--   account in the organization.</li>
--   </ol>
[$sel:type':DescribePortfolioShares'] :: DescribePortfolioShares -> DescribePortfolioShareType

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribePortfolioShares</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageToken:DescribePortfolioShares'</a>,
--   <a>describePortfolioShares_pageToken</a> - The page token for the next
--   set of results. To retrieve the first set of results, use null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageSize:DescribePortfolioShares'</a>,
--   <a>describePortfolioShares_pageSize</a> - The maximum number of items
--   to return with this call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:portfolioId:DescribePortfolioShares'</a>,
--   <a>describePortfolioShares_portfolioId</a> - The unique identifier of
--   the portfolio for which shares will be retrieved.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':DescribePortfolioShares'</a>,
--   <a>describePortfolioShares_type</a> - The type of portfolio share to
--   summarize. This field acts as a filter on the type of portfolio share,
--   which can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li><tt>ACCOUNT</tt> - Represents an external account to account
--   share.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATION</tt> - Represents a share to an organization.
--   This share is available to every account in the organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATIONAL_UNIT</tt> - Represents a share to an
--   organizational unit.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATION_MEMBER_ACCOUNT</tt> - Represents a share to an
--   account in the organization.</li>
--   </ol>
newDescribePortfolioShares :: Text -> DescribePortfolioShareType -> DescribePortfolioShares

-- | The page token for the next set of results. To retrieve the first set
--   of results, use null.
describePortfolioShares_pageToken :: Lens' DescribePortfolioShares (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of items to return with this call.
describePortfolioShares_pageSize :: Lens' DescribePortfolioShares (Maybe Natural)

-- | The unique identifier of the portfolio for which shares will be
--   retrieved.
describePortfolioShares_portfolioId :: Lens' DescribePortfolioShares Text

-- | The type of portfolio share to summarize. This field acts as a filter
--   on the type of portfolio share, which can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li><tt>ACCOUNT</tt> - Represents an external account to account
--   share.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATION</tt> - Represents a share to an organization.
--   This share is available to every account in the organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATIONAL_UNIT</tt> - Represents a share to an
--   organizational unit.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATION_MEMBER_ACCOUNT</tt> - Represents a share to an
--   account in the organization.</li>
--   </ol>
describePortfolioShares_type :: Lens' DescribePortfolioShares DescribePortfolioShareType

-- | Stops sharing the specified portfolio with the specified account or
--   organization node. Shares to an organization node can only be deleted
--   by the management account of an organization or by a delegated
--   administrator.
--   
--   Note that if a delegated admin is de-registered, portfolio shares
--   created from that account are removed.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.DeletePortfolioShare

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeletePortfolioShare</a> smart constructor.
data DeletePortfolioShare
DeletePortfolioShare' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe OrganizationNode -> Text -> DeletePortfolioShare

-- | The AWS account ID.
[$sel:accountId:DeletePortfolioShare'] :: DeletePortfolioShare -> Maybe Text

-- | The language code.
--

-- | Creates a self-service action.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.CreateServiceAction

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateServiceAction</a> smart constructor.
data CreateServiceAction
CreateServiceAction' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> ServiceActionDefinitionType -> HashMap ServiceActionDefinitionKey Text -> Text -> CreateServiceAction

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:acceptLanguage:CreateServiceAction'] :: CreateServiceAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The self-service action description.
[$sel:description:CreateServiceAction'] :: CreateServiceAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The self-service action name.
[$sel:name:CreateServiceAction'] :: CreateServiceAction -> Text

-- | The service action definition type. For example,
--   <tt>SSM_AUTOMATION</tt>.
[$sel:definitionType:CreateServiceAction'] :: CreateServiceAction -> ServiceActionDefinitionType

-- | The self-service action definition. Can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>Name</i> The name of the AWS Systems Manager document (SSM
--   document). For example, <tt>AWS-RestartEC2Instance</tt>.If you are
--   using a shared SSM document, you must provide the ARN instead of the
--   name.</li>
--   <li><i>Version</i> The AWS Systems Manager automation document
--   version. For example, <tt>"Version": "1"</tt></li>
--   <li><i>AssumeRole</i> The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role that
--   performs the self-service actions on your behalf. For example,
--   <tt>"AssumeRole": "arn:aws:iam::12345678910:role/ActionRole"</tt>.To
--   reuse the provisioned product launch role, set to <tt>"AssumeRole":
--   "LAUNCH_ROLE"</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>Parameters</i> The list of parameters in JSON format.For
--   example: <tt>[{\"Name\":\"InstanceId\",\"Type\":\"TARGET\"}]</tt> or
--   <tt>[{\"Name\":\"InstanceId\",\"Type\":\"TEXT_VALUE\"}]</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:definition:CreateServiceAction'] :: CreateServiceAction -> HashMap ServiceActionDefinitionKey Text

-- | A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If
--   multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same
--   response is returned for each repeated request.

-- | Creates a provisioning artifact (also known as a version) for the
--   specified product.
--   
--   You cannot create a provisioning artifact for a product that was
--   shared with you.
--   
--   The user or role that performs this operation must have the
--   <tt>cloudformation:GetTemplate</tt> IAM policy permission. This policy
--   permission is required when using the <tt>ImportFromPhysicalId</tt>
--   template source in the information data section.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.CreateProvisioningArtifact

-- | Creates a plan. A plan includes the list of resources to be created
--   (when provisioning a new product) or modified (when updating a
--   provisioned product) when the plan is executed.
--   
--   You can create one plan per provisioned product. To create a plan for
--   an existing provisioned product, the product status must be AVAILBLE
--   or TAINTED.
--   
--   To view the resource changes in the change set, use
--   DescribeProvisionedProductPlan. To create or modify the provisioned
--   product, use ExecuteProvisionedProductPlan.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.CreateProvisionedProductPlan

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateProvisionedProductPlan</a> smart constructor.
data CreateProvisionedProductPlan

--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>

--   <tt>TagUpdatesOnProvisionedProduct</tt> set to <tt>ALLOWED</tt> to
--   allow tag updates.

-- | Creates a product.
--   
--   A delegated admin is authorized to invoke this command.
--   
--   The user or role that performs this operation must have the
--   <tt>cloudformation:GetTemplate</tt> IAM policy permission. This policy
--   permission is required when using the <tt>ImportFromPhysicalId</tt>
--   template source in the information data section.

-- | Shares the specified portfolio with the specified account or
--   organization node. Shares to an organization node can only be created
--   by the management account of an organization or by a delegated
--   administrator. You can share portfolios to an organization, an
--   organizational unit, or a specific account.
--   
--   Note that if a delegated admin is de-registered, they can no longer
--   create portfolio shares.
--   
--   <tt>AWSOrganizationsAccess</tt> must be enabled in order to create a
--   portfolio share to an organization node.
--   
--   You can't share a shared resource, including portfolios that contain a
--   shared product.
--   
--   If the portfolio share with the specified account or organization node
--   already exists, this action will have no effect and will not return an
--   error. To update an existing share, you must use the <tt>
--   UpdatePortfolioShare</tt> API instead.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.CreatePortfolioShare

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreatePortfolioShare</a> smart constructor.

--   disabled.

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:acceptLanguage:CreatePortfolioShare'] :: CreatePortfolioShare -> Maybe Text

-- | The organization node to whom you are going to share. If
--   <tt>OrganizationNode</tt> is passed in, <tt>PortfolioShare</tt> will
--   be created for the node an ListOrganizationPortfolioAccessd its
--   children (when applies), and a <tt>PortfolioShareToken</tt> will be
--   returned in the output in order for the administrator to monitor the
--   status of the <tt>PortfolioShare</tt> creation process.
[$sel:organizationNode:CreatePortfolioShare'] :: CreatePortfolioShare -> Maybe OrganizationNode

[$sel:portfolioId:CreatePortfolioShare'] :: CreatePortfolioShare -> Text

-- | Creates a constraint.
--   
--   A delegated admin is authorized to invoke this command.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.CreateConstraint

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateConstraint</a> smart constructor.
data CreateConstraint
CreateConstraint' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateConstraint

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:acceptLanguage:CreateConstraint'] :: CreateConstraint -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the constraint.
[$sel:description:CreateConstraint'] :: CreateConstraint -> Maybe Text

-- | The portfolio identifier.
[$sel:portfolioId:CreateConstraint'] :: CreateConstraint -> Text

-- | The product identifier.
[$sel:productId:CreateConstraint'] :: CreateConstraint -> Text

-- | The constraint parameters, in JSON format. The syntax depends on the
--   constraint type as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>LAUNCH</i> You are required to specify either the
--   <tt>RoleArn</tt> or the <tt>LocalRoleName</tt> but can't use
--   both.Specify the <tt>RoleArn</tt> property as follows:<pre>{"RoleArn"
--   : "arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/LaunchRole"}</pre>Specify the
--   <tt>LocalRoleName</tt> property as follows:<pre>{"LocalRoleName":
--   "SCBasicLaunchRole"}</pre>If you specify the <tt>LocalRoleName</tt>
--   property, when an account uses the launch constraint, the IAM role
--   with that name in the account will be used. This allows launch-role
--   constraints to be account-agnostic so the administrator can create
--   fewer resources per shared account.The given role name must exist in
--   the account used to create the launch constraint and the account of
--   the user who launches a product with this launch constraint.You cannot
--   have both a <tt>LAUNCH</tt> and a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.You
--   also cannot have more than one <tt>LAUNCH</tt> constraint on a product
--   and portfolio.</li>
--   <li><i>NOTIFICATION</i> Specify the <tt>NotificationArns</tt> property
--   as follows:<pre>{"NotificationArns" :
--   ["arn:aws:sns:us-east-1:123456789012:Topic"]}</pre></li>
--   <li><i>RESOURCE_UPDATE</i> Specify the
--   <tt>TagUpdatesOnProvisionedProduct</tt> property as
--   follows:<pre>{"Version":"2.0","Properties":{"TagUpdateOnProvisionedProduct":"String"}}</pre>The
--   <tt>TagUpdatesOnProvisionedProduct</tt> property accepts a string
--   value of <tt>ALLOWED</tt> or <tt>NOT_ALLOWED</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>STACKSET</i> Specify the <tt>Parameters</tt> property as
--   follows:<pre>{"Version": "String", "Properties": {"AccountList": [
--   "String" ], "RegionList": [ "String" ], "AdminRole": "String",
--   "ExecutionRole": "String"}}</pre>You cannot have both a
--   <tt>LAUNCH</tt> and a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.You also cannot
--   have more than one <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint on a product and
--   portfolio.Products with a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint will launch an
--   AWS CloudFormation stack set.</li>
--   <li><i>TEMPLATE</i> Specify the <tt>Rules</tt> property. For more
--   information, see <a>Template Constraint Rules</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:parameters:CreateConstraint'] :: CreateConstraint -> Text

-- | The type of constraint.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LAUNCH</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NOTIFICATION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>RESOURCE_UPDATE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>STACKSET</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TEMPLATE</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':CreateConstraint'] :: CreateConstraint -> Text

-- | A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If
--   multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same
--   response is returned for each repeated request.
[$sel:idempotencyToken:CreateConstraint'] :: CreateConstraint -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateConstraint</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptLanguage:CreateConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>createConstraint_acceptLanguage</a> - The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CreateConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>createConstraint_description</a> - The description of the
--   constraint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:portfolioId:CreateConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>createConstraint_portfolioId</a> - The portfolio identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productId:CreateConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>createConstraint_productId</a> - The product identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameters:CreateConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>createConstraint_parameters</a> - The constraint parameters, in
--   JSON format. The syntax depends on the constraint type as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>LAUNCH</i> You are required to specify either the
--   <tt>RoleArn</tt> or the <tt>LocalRoleName</tt> but can't use
--   both.Specify the <tt>RoleArn</tt> property as follows:<pre>{"RoleArn"
--   : "arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/LaunchRole"}</pre>Specify the
--   <tt>LocalRoleName</tt> property as follows:<pre>{"LocalRoleName":
--   "SCBasicLaunchRole"}</pre>If you specify the <tt>LocalRoleName</tt>
--   property, when an account uses the launch constraint, the IAM role
--   with that name in the account will be used. This allows launch-role
--   constraints to be account-agnostic so the administrator can create
--   fewer resources per shared account.The given role name must exist in
--   the account used to create the launch constraint and the account of
--   the user who launches a product with this launch constraint.You cannot
--   have both a <tt>LAUNCH</tt> and a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.You
--   also cannot have more than one <tt>LAUNCH</tt> constraint on a product
--   and portfolio.</li>
--   <li><i>NOTIFICATION</i> Specify the <tt>NotificationArns</tt> property
--   as follows:<pre>{"NotificationArns" :
--   ["arn:aws:sns:us-east-1:123456789012:Topic"]}</pre></li>
--   <li><i>RESOURCE_UPDATE</i> Specify the
--   <tt>TagUpdatesOnProvisionedProduct</tt> property as
--   follows:<pre>{"Version":"2.0","Properties":{"TagUpdateOnProvisionedProduct":"String"}}</pre>The
--   <tt>TagUpdatesOnProvisionedProduct</tt> property accepts a string
--   value of <tt>ALLOWED</tt> or <tt>NOT_ALLOWED</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>STACKSET</i> Specify the <tt>Parameters</tt> property as
--   follows:<pre>{"Version": "String", "Properties": {"AccountList": [
--   "String" ], "RegionList": [ "String" ], "AdminRole": "String",
--   "ExecutionRole": "String"}}</pre>You cannot have both a
--   <tt>LAUNCH</tt> and a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.You also cannot
--   have more than one <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint on a product and
--   portfolio.Products with a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint will launch an
--   AWS CloudFormation stack set.</li>
--   <li><i>TEMPLATE</i> Specify the <tt>Rules</tt> property. For more
--   information, see <a>Template Constraint Rules</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':CreateConstraint'</a>, <a>createConstraint_type</a> -
--   The type of constraint.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LAUNCH</pre></li>

-- | Copies the specified source product to the specified target product or
--   a new product.
--   
--   You can copy a product to the same account or another account. You can
--   copy a product to the same region or another region.
--   
--   This operation is performed asynchronously. To track the progress of
--   the operation, use DescribeCopyProductStatus.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.CopyProduct

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCopyProduct</a> smart constructor.
data CopyProduct

--   created.
[$sel:targetProductId:CopyProduct'] :: CopyProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifiers of the provisioning artifacts (also known as versions)
--   of the product to copy. By default, all provisioning artifacts are
--   copied.
[$sel:sourceProvisioningArtifactIdentifiers:CopyProduct'] :: CopyProduct -> Maybe [HashMap ProvisioningArtifactPropertyName Text]

-- | A name for the target product. The default is the name of the source
--   product.
[$sel:targetProductName:CopyProduct'] :: CopyProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | The copy options. If the value is <tt>CopyTags</tt>, the tags from the
--   source product are copied to the target product.
[$sel:copyOptions:CopyProduct'] :: CopyProduct -> Maybe [CopyOption]

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>

--   multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same
--   response is returned for each repeated request.
[$sel:idempotencyToken:CopyProduct'] :: CopyProduct -> Text

--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>

associatePrincipalWithPortfolio_portfolioId :: Lens' AssociatePrincipalWithPortfolio Text

-- | The ARN of the principal (IAM user, role, or group).
associatePrincipalWithPortfolio_principalARN :: Lens' AssociatePrincipalWithPortfolio Text

-- | The principal type. The supported value is <tt>IAM</tt>.
associatePrincipalWithPortfolio_principalType :: Lens' AssociatePrincipalWithPortfolio PrincipalType

-- | Accepts an offer to share the specified portfolio.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.AcceptPortfolioShare

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAcceptPortfolioShare</a> smart constructor.
data AcceptPortfolioShare
AcceptPortfolioShare' :: Maybe PortfolioShareType -> Maybe Text -> Text -> AcceptPortfolioShare

-- | The type of shared portfolios to accept. The default is to accept
--   imported portfolios.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_ORGANIZATIONS</tt> - Accept portfolios shared by the
--   management account of your organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>IMPORTED</tt> - Accept imported portfolios.</li>
--   <li><tt>AWS_SERVICECATALOG</tt> - Not supported. (Throws
--   ResourceNotFoundException.)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For example, <tt>aws servicecatalog accept-portfolio-share
--   --portfolio-id "port-2qwzkwxt3y5fk" --portfolio-share-type
--   AWS_ORGANIZATIONS</tt>
[$sel:portfolioShareType:AcceptPortfolioShare'] :: AcceptPortfolioShare -> Maybe PortfolioShareType

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:acceptLanguage:AcceptPortfolioShare'] :: AcceptPortfolioShare -> Maybe Text

[$sel:portfolioId:AcceptPortfolioShare'] :: AcceptPortfolioShare -> Text

-- | Updates the specified constraint.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.UpdateConstraint

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateConstraint</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateConstraint
UpdateConstraint' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateConstraint

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:acceptLanguage:UpdateConstraint'] :: UpdateConstraint -> Maybe Text

-- | The constraint parameters, in JSON format. The syntax depends on the
--   constraint type as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>LAUNCH</i> You are required to specify either the
--   <tt>RoleArn</tt> or the <tt>LocalRoleName</tt> but can't use
--   both.Specify the <tt>RoleArn</tt> property as follows:<pre>{"RoleArn"
--   : "arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/LaunchRole"}</pre>Specify the
--   <tt>LocalRoleName</tt> property as follows:<pre>{"LocalRoleName":
--   "SCBasicLaunchRole"}</pre>If you specify the <tt>LocalRoleName</tt>
--   property, when an account uses the launch constraint, the IAM role
--   with that name in the account will be used. This allows launch-role
--   constraints to be account-agnostic so the administrator can create
--   fewer resources per shared account.The given role name must exist in
--   the account used to create the launch constraint and the account of
--   the user who launches a product with this launch constraint.You cannot
--   have both a <tt>LAUNCH</tt> and a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.You
--   also cannot have more than one <tt>LAUNCH</tt> constraint on a product
--   and portfolio.</li>
--   <li><i>NOTIFICATION</i> Specify the <tt>NotificationArns</tt> property
--   as follows:<pre>{"NotificationArns" :
--   ["arn:aws:sns:us-east-1:123456789012:Topic"]}</pre></li>
--   <li><i>RESOURCE_UPDATE</i> Specify the
--   <tt>TagUpdatesOnProvisionedProduct</tt> property as
--   follows:<pre>{"Version":"2.0","Properties":{"TagUpdateOnProvisionedProduct":"String"}}</pre>The
--   <tt>TagUpdatesOnProvisionedProduct</tt> property accepts a string
--   value of <tt>ALLOWED</tt> or <tt>NOT_ALLOWED</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>STACKSET</i> Specify the <tt>Parameters</tt> property as
--   follows:<pre>{"Version": "String", "Properties": {"AccountList": [
--   "String" ], "RegionList": [ "String" ], "AdminRole": "String",
--   "ExecutionRole": "String"}}</pre>You cannot have both a
--   <tt>LAUNCH</tt> and a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.You also cannot
--   have more than one <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint on a product and
--   portfolio.Products with a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint will launch an
--   AWS CloudFormation stack set.</li>
--   <li><i>TEMPLATE</i> Specify the <tt>Rules</tt> property. For more
--   information, see <a>Template Constraint Rules</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:parameters:UpdateConstraint'] :: UpdateConstraint -> Maybe Text

-- | The updated description of the constraint.
[$sel:description:UpdateConstraint'] :: UpdateConstraint -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the constraint.
[$sel:id:UpdateConstraint'] :: UpdateConstraint -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateConstraint</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptLanguage:UpdateConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>updateConstraint_acceptLanguage</a> - The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameters:UpdateConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>updateConstraint_parameters</a> - The constraint parameters, in
--   JSON format. The syntax depends on the constraint type as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>LAUNCH</i> You are required to specify either the
--   <tt>RoleArn</tt> or the <tt>LocalRoleName</tt> but can't use
--   both.Specify the <tt>RoleArn</tt> property as follows:<pre>{"RoleArn"
--   : "arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/LaunchRole"}</pre>Specify the
--   <tt>LocalRoleName</tt> property as follows:<pre>{"LocalRoleName":
--   "SCBasicLaunchRole"}</pre>If you specify the <tt>LocalRoleName</tt>
--   property, when an account uses the launch constraint, the IAM role
--   with that name in the account will be used. This allows launch-role
--   constraints to be account-agnostic so the administrator can create

--   the account used to create the launch constraint and the account of
--   the user who launches a product with this launch constraint.You cannot

--   also cannot have more than one <tt>LAUNCH</tt> constraint on a product
--   and portfolio.</li>

--   identifier of the constraint.

-- | Updates the specified portfolio share. You can use this API to enable
--   or disable TagOptions sharing for an existing portfolio share.
--   
--   The portfolio share cannot be updated if the <tt>
--   CreatePortfolioShare</tt> operation is <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, as the
--   share is not available to recipient entities. In this case, you must
--   wait for the portfolio share to be COMPLETED.
--   
--   You must provide the <tt>accountId</tt> or organization node in the
--   input, but not both.
--   
--   If the portfolio is shared to both an external account and an
--   organization node, and both shares need to be updated, you must invoke
--   <tt>UpdatePortfolioShare</tt> separately for each share type.
--   
--   This API cannot be used for removing the portfolio share. You must use
--   <tt>DeletePortfolioShare</tt> API for that action.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.UpdatePortfolioShare

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdatePortfolioShare</a> smart constructor.
data UpdatePortfolioShare
UpdatePortfolioShare' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe OrganizationNode -> Text -> UpdatePortfolioShare

-- | The AWS Account Id of the recipient account. This field is required
--   when updating an external account to account type share.
[$sel:accountId:UpdatePortfolioShare'] :: UpdatePortfolioShare -> Maybe Text

-- | A flag to enable or disable TagOptions sharing for the portfolio
--   share. If this field is not provided, the current state of TagOptions
--   sharing on the portfolio share will not be modified.
[$sel:shareTagOptions:UpdatePortfolioShare'] :: UpdatePortfolioShare -> Maybe Bool

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:acceptLanguage:UpdatePortfolioShare'] :: UpdatePortfolioShare -> Maybe Text
[$sel:organizationNode:UpdatePortfolioShare'] :: UpdatePortfolioShare -> Maybe OrganizationNode

-- | The unique identifier of the portfolio for which the share will be
--   updated.
[$sel:portfolioId:UpdatePortfolioShare'] :: UpdatePortfolioShare -> Text

--   omitted.

-- | Requests updates to the configuration of the specified provisioned
--   product.
--   
--   If there are tags associated with the object, they cannot be updated
--   or added. Depending on the specific updates requested, this operation
--   can update with no interruption, with some interruption, or replace
--   the provisioned product entirely.
--   
--   You can check the status of this request using DescribeRecord.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.UpdateProvisionedProduct

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateProvisionedProduct</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateProvisionedProduct
UpdateProvisionedProduct' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [UpdateProvisioningParameter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe UpdateProvisioningPreferences -> Text -> UpdateProvisionedProduct

-- | The name of the product. You must provide the name or ID, but not
--   both.
[$sel:productName:UpdateProvisionedProduct'] :: UpdateProvisionedProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the provisioned product. You cannot specify both
--   <tt>ProvisionedProductName</tt> and <tt>ProvisionedProductId</tt>.
[$sel:provisionedProductName:UpdateProvisionedProduct'] :: UpdateProvisionedProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact.
[$sel:provisioningArtifactId:UpdateProvisionedProduct'] :: UpdateProvisionedProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the provisioning artifact. You must provide the name or
--   ID, but not both.
[$sel:provisioningArtifactName:UpdateProvisionedProduct'] :: UpdateProvisionedProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the path. You must provide the name or ID, but not both.
[$sel:pathName:UpdateProvisionedProduct'] :: UpdateProvisionedProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:acceptLanguage:UpdateProvisionedProduct'] :: UpdateProvisionedProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | The path identifier. This value is optional if the product has a
--   default path, and required if the product has more than one path. You
--   must provide the name or ID, but not both.
[$sel:pathId:UpdateProvisionedProduct'] :: UpdateProvisionedProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | The new parameters.
[$sel:provisioningParameters:UpdateProvisionedProduct'] :: UpdateProvisionedProduct -> Maybe [UpdateProvisioningParameter]

-- | The identifier of the provisioned product. You must provide the name
--   or ID, but not both.
[$sel:provisionedProductId:UpdateProvisionedProduct'] :: UpdateProvisionedProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the product. You must provide the name or ID, but
--   not both.
[$sel:productId:UpdateProvisionedProduct'] :: UpdateProvisionedProduct -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more tags. Requires the product to have
--   <tt>RESOURCE_UPDATE</tt> constraint with

-- | Requests updates to the properties of the specified provisioned
--   product.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.UpdateProvisionedProductProperties

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateProvisionedProductProperties</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateProvisionedProductProperties
UpdateProvisionedProductProperties' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> HashMap PropertyKey Text -> Text -> UpdateProvisionedProductProperties

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:acceptLanguage:UpdateProvisionedProductProperties'] :: UpdateProvisionedProductProperties -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the provisioned product.
[$sel:provisionedProductId:UpdateProvisionedProductProperties'] :: UpdateProvisionedProductProperties -> Text

-- | A map that contains the provisioned product properties to be updated.
--   
--   The <tt>LAUNCH_ROLE</tt> key accepts role ARNs. This key allows an
--   administrator to call <tt>UpdateProvisionedProductProperties</tt> to
--   update the launch role that is associated with a provisioned product.
--   This role is used when an end user calls a provisioning operation such
--   as <tt>UpdateProvisionedProduct</tt>,
--   <tt>TerminateProvisionedProduct</tt>, or
--   <tt>ExecuteProvisionedProductServiceAction</tt>. Only a role ARN is
--   valid. A user ARN is invalid.
--   
--   The <tt>OWNER</tt> key accepts user ARNs and role ARNs. The owner is
--   the user that has permission to see, update, terminate, and execute
--   service actions in the provisioned product.
--   
--   The administrator can change the owner of a provisioned product to
--   another IAM user within the same account. Both end user owners and
--   administrators can see ownership history of the provisioned product
--   using the <tt>ListRecordHistory</tt> API. The new owner can describe
--   all past records for the provisioned product using the
--   <tt>DescribeRecord</tt> API. The previous owner can no longer use
--   <tt>DescribeRecord</tt>, but can still see the product's history from
--   when he was an owner using <tt>ListRecordHistory</tt>.
--   
--   If a provisioned product ownership is assigned to an end user, they
--   can see and perform any action through the API or Service Catalog
--   console such as update, terminate, and execute service actions. If an
--   end user provisions a product and the owner is updated to someone
--   else, they will no longer be able to see or perform any actions
--   through API or the Service Catalog console on that provisioned
--   product.
[$sel:provisionedProductProperties:UpdateProvisionedProductProperties'] :: UpdateProvisionedProductProperties -> HashMap PropertyKey Text

-- | The idempotency token that uniquely identifies the provisioning
--   product update request.
[$sel:idempotencyToken:UpdateProvisionedProductProperties'] :: UpdateProvisionedProductProperties -> Text
