-- | Updates the specified provisioning artifact (also known as a version)
--   for the specified product.
--   
--   You cannot update a provisioning artifact for a product that was
--   shared with you.
module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.UpdateProvisioningArtifact

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateProvisioningArtifact</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateProvisioningArtifact
UpdateProvisioningArtifact' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ProvisioningArtifactGuidance -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateProvisioningArtifact

-- | Indicates whether the product version is active.
--   
--   Inactive provisioning artifacts are invisible to end users. End users
--   cannot launch or update a provisioned product from an inactive
--   provisioning artifact.
[$sel:active:UpdateProvisioningArtifact'] :: UpdateProvisioningArtifact -> Maybe Bool

-- | The updated name of the provisioning artifact.
[$sel:name:UpdateProvisioningArtifact'] :: UpdateProvisioningArtifact -> Maybe Text

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:acceptLanguage:UpdateProvisioningArtifact'] :: UpdateProvisioningArtifact -> Maybe Text

-- | Information set by the administrator to provide guidance to end users
--   about which provisioning artifacts to use.
--   
--   The <tt>DEFAULT</tt> value indicates that the product version is
--   active.
--   
--   The administrator can set the guidance to <tt>DEPRECATED</tt> to
--   inform users that the product version is deprecated. Users are able to
--   make updates to a provisioned product of a deprecated version but
--   cannot launch new provisioned products using a deprecated version.
[$sel:guidance:UpdateProvisioningArtifact'] :: UpdateProvisioningArtifact -> Maybe ProvisioningArtifactGuidance

-- | The updated description of the provisioning artifact.
[$sel:description:UpdateProvisioningArtifact'] :: UpdateProvisioningArtifact -> Maybe Text

-- | The product identifier.
[$sel:productId:UpdateProvisioningArtifact'] :: UpdateProvisioningArtifact -> Text

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact.
[$sel:provisioningArtifactId:UpdateProvisioningArtifact'] :: UpdateProvisioningArtifact -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateProvisioningArtifact</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:active:UpdateProvisioningArtifact'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningArtifact_active</a> - Indicates whether the
--   product version is active.
--   
--   Inactive provisioning artifacts are invisible to end users. End users
--   cannot launch or update a provisioned product from an inactive
--   provisioning artifact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateProvisioningArtifact'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningArtifact_name</a> - The updated name of the
--   provisioning artifact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptLanguage:UpdateProvisioningArtifact'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningArtifact_acceptLanguage</a> - The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:guidance:UpdateProvisioningArtifact'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningArtifact_guidance</a> - Information set by the
--   administrator to provide guidance to end users about which
--   provisioning artifacts to use.
--   
--   The <tt>DEFAULT</tt> value indicates that the product version is
--   active.
--   
--   The administrator can set the guidance to <tt>DEPRECATED</tt> to
--   inform users that the product version is deprecated. Users are able to
--   make updates to a provisioned product of a deprecated version but
--   cannot launch new provisioned products using a deprecated version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:UpdateProvisioningArtifact'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningArtifact_description</a> - The updated
--   description of the provisioning artifact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productId:UpdateProvisioningArtifact'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningArtifact_productId</a> - The product identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisioningArtifactId:UpdateProvisioningArtifact'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningArtifact_provisioningArtifactId</a> - The
--   identifier of the provisioning artifact.
newUpdateProvisioningArtifact :: Text -> Text -> UpdateProvisioningArtifact

-- | Indicates whether the product version is active.
--   
--   Inactive provisioning artifacts are invisible to end users. End users
--   cannot launch or update a provisioned product from an inactive
--   provisioning artifact.
updateProvisioningArtifact_active :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningArtifact (Maybe Bool)

-- | The updated name of the provisioning artifact.
updateProvisioningArtifact_name :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningArtifact (Maybe Text)

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
updateProvisioningArtifact_acceptLanguage :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningArtifact (Maybe Text)

-- | Information set by the administrator to provide guidance to end users
--   about which provisioning artifacts to use.
--   
--   The <tt>DEFAULT</tt> value indicates that the product version is
--   active.
--   
--   The administrator can set the guidance to <tt>DEPRECATED</tt> to
--   inform users that the product version is deprecated. Users are able to
--   make updates to a provisioned product of a deprecated version but
--   cannot launch new provisioned products using a deprecated version.
updateProvisioningArtifact_guidance :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningArtifact (Maybe ProvisioningArtifactGuidance)

-- | The updated description of the provisioning artifact.
updateProvisioningArtifact_description :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningArtifact (Maybe Text)

-- | The product identifier.
updateProvisioningArtifact_productId :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningArtifact Text

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact.
updateProvisioningArtifact_provisioningArtifactId :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningArtifact Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateProvisioningArtifactResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

module Amazonka.ServiceCatalog.Lens

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
importAsProvisionedProduct_acceptLanguage :: Lens' ImportAsProvisionedProduct (Maybe Text)

-- | The product identifier.
importAsProvisionedProduct_productId :: Lens' ImportAsProvisionedProduct Text

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact.
importAsProvisionedProduct_provisioningArtifactId :: Lens' ImportAsProvisionedProduct Text

-- | The user-friendly name of the provisioned product. The value must be
--   unique for the AWS account. The name cannot be updated after the
--   product is provisioned.
importAsProvisionedProduct_provisionedProductName :: Lens' ImportAsProvisionedProduct Text

-- | The unique identifier of the resource to be imported. It only
--   currently supports CloudFormation stack IDs.
importAsProvisionedProduct_physicalId :: Lens' ImportAsProvisionedProduct Text

-- | A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If
--   multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same
--   response is returned for each repeated request.
importAsProvisionedProduct_idempotencyToken :: Lens' ImportAsProvisionedProduct Text

-- | Undocumented member.
importAsProvisionedProductResponse_recordDetail :: Lens' ImportAsProvisionedProductResponse (Maybe RecordDetail)

-- | The response's http status code.
importAsProvisionedProductResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ImportAsProvisionedProductResponse Int

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
deleteConstraint_acceptLanguage :: Lens' DeleteConstraint (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the constraint.
deleteConstraint_id :: Lens' DeleteConstraint Text

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteConstraintResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteConstraintResponse Int

-- | The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
updateConstraint_acceptLanguage :: Lens' UpdateConstraint (Maybe Text)

-- | The constraint parameters, in JSON format. The syntax depends on the
--   constraint type as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>LAUNCH</i> You are required to specify either the
--   <tt>RoleArn</tt> or the <tt>LocalRoleName</tt> but can't use
--   both.Specify the <tt>RoleArn</tt> property as follows:<pre>{"RoleArn"
--   : "arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/LaunchRole"}</pre>Specify the
--   <tt>LocalRoleName</tt> property as follows:<pre>{"LocalRoleName":
--   "SCBasicLaunchRole"}</pre>If you specify the <tt>LocalRoleName</tt>
--   property, when an account uses the launch constraint, the IAM role
--   with that name in the account will be used. This allows launch-role
--   constraints to be account-agnostic so the administrator can create
--   fewer resources per shared account.The given role name must exist in
--   the account used to create the launch constraint and the account of
--   the user who launches a product with this launch constraint.You cannot
--   have both a <tt>LAUNCH</tt> and a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.You
--   also cannot have more than one <tt>LAUNCH</tt> constraint on a product
--   and portfolio.</li>
--   <li><i>NOTIFICATION</i> Specify the <tt>NotificationArns</tt> property
--   as follows:<pre>{"NotificationArns" :
--   ["arn:aws:sns:us-east-1:123456789012:Topic"]}</pre></li>
--   <li><i>RESOURCE_UPDATE</i> Specify the
--   <tt>TagUpdatesOnProvisionedProduct</tt> property as
--   follows:<pre>{"Version":"2.0","Properties":{"TagUpdateOnProvisionedProduct":"String"}}</pre>The
--   <tt>TagUpdatesOnProvisionedProduct</tt> property accepts a string
--   value of <tt>ALLOWED</tt> or <tt>NOT_ALLOWED</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>STACKSET</i> Specify the <tt>Parameters</tt> property as
--   follows:<pre>{"Version": "String", "Properties": {"AccountList": [
--   "String" ], "RegionList": [ "String" ], "AdminRole": "String",
--   "ExecutionRole": "String"}}</pre>You cannot have both a
--   <tt>LAUNCH</tt> and a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.You also cannot
--   have more than one <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint on a product and
--   portfolio.Products with a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint will launch an
--   AWS CloudFormation stack set.</li>
--   <li><i>TEMPLATE</i> Specify the <tt>Rules</tt> property. For more
--   information, see <a>Template Constraint Rules</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
updateConstraint_parameters :: Lens' UpdateConstraint (Maybe Text)

-- | The updated description of the constraint.
updateConstraint_description :: Lens' UpdateConstraint (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the constraint.
updateConstraint_id :: Lens' UpdateConstraint Text

-- | The status of the current request.
updateConstraintResponse_status :: Lens' UpdateConstraintResponse (Maybe RequestStatus)

-- | Information about the constraint.
updateConstraintResponse_constraintDetail :: Lens' UpdateConstraintResponse (Maybe ConstraintDetail)

-- | The constraint parameters.
updateConstraintResponse_constraintParameters :: Lens' UpdateConstraintResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
updateConstraintResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateConstraintResponse Int

-- | A map of all self-service action parameters and their values. If a

-- | The self-service action description.

-- | The self-service action name.
createServiceAction_name :: Lens' CreateServiceAction Text

-- | The service action definition type. For example,
--   <tt>SSM_AUTOMATION</tt>.
createServiceAction_definitionType :: Lens' CreateServiceAction ServiceActionDefinitionType

-- | The self-service action definition. Can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>Name</i> The name of the AWS Systems Manager document (SSM
--   document). For example, <tt>AWS-RestartEC2Instance</tt>.If you are
--   using a shared SSM document, you must provide the ARN instead of the
--   name.</li>
--   <li><i>Version</i> The AWS Systems Manager automation document
--   version. For example, <tt>"Version": "1"</tt></li>
--   <li><i>AssumeRole</i> The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role that
--   performs the self-service actions on your behalf. For example,
--   <tt>"AssumeRole": "arn:aws:iam::12345678910:role/ActionRole"</tt>.To
--   reuse the provisioned product launch role, set to <tt>"AssumeRole":
--   "LAUNCH_ROLE"</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>Parameters</i> The list of parameters in JSON format.For
--   example: <tt>[{\"Name\":\"InstanceId\",\"Type\":\"TARGET\"}]</tt> or
--   <tt>[{\"Name\":\"InstanceId\",\"Type\":\"TEXT_VALUE\"}]</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
createServiceAction_definition :: Lens' CreateServiceAction (HashMap ServiceActionDefinitionKey Text)

--   multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same
--   response is returned for each repeated request.

-- | When this boolean parameter is set to true, the
--   <tt>TerminateProvisionedProduct</tt> API deletes the Service Catalog
--   provisioned product. However, it does not remove the CloudFormation
--   stack, stack set, or the underlying resources of the deleted
--   provisioned product. The default value is false.

--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
createConstraint_acceptLanguage :: Lens' CreateConstraint (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the constraint.
createConstraint_description :: Lens' CreateConstraint (Maybe Text)

-- | The portfolio identifier.
createConstraint_portfolioId :: Lens' CreateConstraint Text

-- | The product identifier.
createConstraint_productId :: Lens' CreateConstraint Text

-- | The constraint parameters, in JSON format. The syntax depends on the
--   constraint type as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>LAUNCH</i> You are required to specify either the
--   <tt>RoleArn</tt> or the <tt>LocalRoleName</tt> but can't use
--   both.Specify the <tt>RoleArn</tt> property as follows:<pre>{"RoleArn"
--   : "arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/LaunchRole"}</pre>Specify the
--   <tt>LocalRoleName</tt> property as follows:<pre>{"LocalRoleName":
--   "SCBasicLaunchRole"}</pre>If you specify the <tt>LocalRoleName</tt>
--   property, when an account uses the launch constraint, the IAM role
--   with that name in the account will be used. This allows launch-role
--   constraints to be account-agnostic so the administrator can create
--   fewer resources per shared account.The given role name must exist in
--   the account used to create the launch constraint and the account of
--   the user who launches a product with this launch constraint.You cannot
--   have both a <tt>LAUNCH</tt> and a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.You
--   also cannot have more than one <tt>LAUNCH</tt> constraint on a product
--   and portfolio.</li>
--   <li><i>NOTIFICATION</i> Specify the <tt>NotificationArns</tt> property
--   as follows:<pre>{"NotificationArns" :
--   ["arn:aws:sns:us-east-1:123456789012:Topic"]}</pre></li>
--   <li><i>RESOURCE_UPDATE</i> Specify the
--   <tt>TagUpdatesOnProvisionedProduct</tt> property as
--   follows:<pre>{"Version":"2.0","Properties":{"TagUpdateOnProvisionedProduct":"String"}}</pre>The
--   <tt>TagUpdatesOnProvisionedProduct</tt> property accepts a string
--   value of <tt>ALLOWED</tt> or <tt>NOT_ALLOWED</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>STACKSET</i> Specify the <tt>Parameters</tt> property as
--   follows:<pre>{"Version": "String", "Properties": {"AccountList": [
--   "String" ], "RegionList": [ "String" ], "AdminRole": "String",
--   "ExecutionRole": "String"}}</pre>You cannot have both a
--   <tt>LAUNCH</tt> and a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.You also cannot
--   have more than one <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint on a product and
--   portfolio.Products with a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint will launch an
--   AWS CloudFormation stack set.</li>
--   <li><i>TEMPLATE</i> Specify the <tt>Rules</tt> property. For more
--   information, see <a>Template Constraint Rules</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
createConstraint_parameters :: Lens' CreateConstraint Text

-- | The type of constraint.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LAUNCH</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NOTIFICATION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>RESOURCE_UPDATE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>STACKSET</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TEMPLATE</pre></li>
--   </ul>
createConstraint_type :: Lens' CreateConstraint Text

-- | A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If
--   multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same
--   response is returned for each repeated request.
createConstraint_idempotencyToken :: Lens' CreateConstraint Text

-- | The status of the current request.
createConstraintResponse_status :: Lens' CreateConstraintResponse (Maybe RequestStatus)

-- | Information about the constraint.
createConstraintResponse_constraintDetail :: Lens' CreateConstraintResponse (Maybe ConstraintDetail)

-- | The constraint parameters.
createConstraintResponse_constraintParameters :: Lens' CreateConstraintResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
createConstraintResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateConstraintResponse Int

--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_ORGANIZATIONS</tt> - Accept portfolios shared by the
--   management account of your organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>IMPORTED</tt> - Accept imported portfolios.</li>
--   <li><tt>AWS_SERVICECATALOG</tt> - Not supported. (Throws
--   ResourceNotFoundException.)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For example, <tt>aws servicecatalog accept-portfolio-share
--   --portfolio-id "port-2qwzkwxt3y5fk" --portfolio-share-type
--   AWS_ORGANIZATIONS</tt>
acceptPortfolioShare_portfolioShareType :: Lens' AcceptPortfolioShare (Maybe PortfolioShareType)

updateProvisionedProductProperties_acceptLanguage :: Lens' UpdateProvisionedProductProperties (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the provisioned product.
updateProvisionedProductProperties_provisionedProductId :: Lens' UpdateProvisionedProductProperties Text

-- | A map that contains the provisioned product properties to be updated.
--   
--   The <tt>LAUNCH_ROLE</tt> key accepts role ARNs. This key allows an
--   administrator to call <tt>UpdateProvisionedProductProperties</tt> to
--   update the launch role that is associated with a provisioned product.
--   This role is used when an end user calls a provisioning operation such
--   as <tt>UpdateProvisionedProduct</tt>,
--   <tt>TerminateProvisionedProduct</tt>, or
--   <tt>ExecuteProvisionedProductServiceAction</tt>. Only a role ARN is
--   valid. A user ARN is invalid.
--   
--   The <tt>OWNER</tt> key accepts user ARNs and role ARNs. The owner is
--   the user that has permission to see, update, terminate, and execute
--   service actions in the provisioned product.
--   
--   The administrator can change the owner of a provisioned product to
--   another IAM user within the same account. Both end user owners and
--   administrators can see ownership history of the provisioned product
--   using the <tt>ListRecordHistory</tt> API. The new owner can describe
--   all past records for the provisioned product using the
--   <tt>DescribeRecord</tt> API. The previous owner can no longer use
--   <tt>DescribeRecord</tt>, but can still see the product's history from
--   when he was an owner using <tt>ListRecordHistory</tt>.
--   
--   If a provisioned product ownership is assigned to an end user, they
--   can see and perform any action through the API or Service Catalog
--   console such as update, terminate, and execute service actions. If an
--   end user provisions a product and the owner is updated to someone
--   else, they will no longer be able to see or perform any actions
--   through API or the Service Catalog console on that provisioned
--   product.
updateProvisionedProductProperties_provisionedProductProperties :: Lens' UpdateProvisionedProductProperties (HashMap PropertyKey Text)

-- | The idempotency token that uniquely identifies the provisioning
--   product update request.
updateProvisionedProductProperties_idempotencyToken :: Lens' UpdateProvisionedProductProperties Text

-- | The status of the request.
updateProvisionedProductPropertiesResponse_status :: Lens' UpdateProvisionedProductPropertiesResponse (Maybe RecordStatus)

-- | A map that contains the properties updated.
updateProvisionedProductPropertiesResponse_provisionedProductProperties :: Lens' UpdateProvisionedProductPropertiesResponse (Maybe (HashMap PropertyKey Text))

-- | The identifier of the record.
updateProvisionedProductPropertiesResponse_recordId :: Lens' UpdateProvisionedProductPropertiesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The provisioned product identifier.
updateProvisionedProductPropertiesResponse_provisionedProductId :: Lens' UpdateProvisionedProductPropertiesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
updateProvisionedProductPropertiesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateProvisionedProductPropertiesResponse Int

--   Inactive provisioning artifacts are invisible to end users. End users

--   provisioning artifact.

--   </ul>

-- | Information set by the administrator to provide guidance to end users
--   about which provisioning artifacts to use.
--   
--   The <tt>DEFAULT</tt> value indicates that the product version is
--   active.
--   
--   The administrator can set the guidance to <tt>DEPRECATED</tt> to
--   inform users that the product version is deprecated. Users are able to
--   make updates to a provisioned product of a deprecated version but
--   cannot launch new provisioned products using a deprecated version.

-- | The type of portfolio share to summarize. This field acts as a filter
--   on the type of portfolio share, which can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li><tt>ACCOUNT</tt> - Represents an external account to account
--   share.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATION</tt> - Represents a share to an organization.
--   This share is available to every account in the organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATIONAL_UNIT</tt> - Represents a share to an
--   organizational unit.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATION_MEMBER_ACCOUNT</tt> - Represents a share to an
--   account in the organization.</li>
--   </ol>

-- | A numeric value that determines the largest numeric value you want to
--   allow for <tt>Number</tt> types.
parameterConstraints_maxValue :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)

-- | An integer value that determines the largest number of characters you
--   want to allow for <tt>String</tt> types.
parameterConstraints_maxLength :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)

-- | A string that explains a constraint when the constraint is violated.
--   For example, without a constraint description, a parameter that has an
--   allowed pattern of <tt>[A-Za-z0-9]+</tt> displays the following error
--   message when the user specifies an invalid value:
--   
--   <pre>
--   Malformed input-Parameter MyParameter must match pattern [A-Za-z0-9]+
--   </pre>
--   
--   By adding a constraint description, such as must only contain letters
--   (uppercase and lowercase) and numbers, you can display the following
--   customized error message:
--   
--   <pre>
--   Malformed input-Parameter MyParameter must only contain uppercase and lowercase letters and numbers.
--   </pre>
parameterConstraints_constraintDescription :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)

-- | An integer value that determines the smallest number of characters you
--   want to allow for <tt>String</tt> types.
parameterConstraints_minLength :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)

-- | A regular expression that represents the patterns that allow for
--   <tt>String</tt> types. The pattern must match the entire parameter
--   value provided.
parameterConstraints_allowedPattern :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)

-- | The values that the administrator has allowed for the parameter.
parameterConstraints_allowedValues :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe [Text])

-- | A numeric value that determines the smallest numeric value you want to
--   allow for <tt>Number</tt> types.
parameterConstraints_minValue :: Lens' ParameterConstraints (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN assigned to the portfolio.
portfolioDetail_arn :: Lens' PortfolioDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
portfolioDetail_createdTime :: Lens' PortfolioDetail (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The portfolio identifier.
portfolioDetail_id :: Lens' PortfolioDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The name to use for display purposes.
portfolioDetail_displayName :: Lens' PortfolioDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the portfolio.
portfolioDetail_description :: Lens' PortfolioDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the portfolio provider.
portfolioDetail_providerName :: Lens' PortfolioDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the recipient entity that received the portfolio
--   share. The recipient entities can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>An external account.</li>
--   <li>An organziation member account.</li>
--   <li>An organzational unit (OU).</li>
--   <li>The organization itself. (This shares with every account in the
--   organization).</li>
--   </ol>
portfolioShareDetail_principalId :: Lens' PortfolioShareDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether TagOptions sharing is enabled or disabled for the
--   portfolio share.
portfolioShareDetail_shareTagOptions :: Lens' PortfolioShareDetail (Maybe Bool)

-- | The type of the portfolio share.
portfolioShareDetail_type :: Lens' PortfolioShareDetail (Maybe DescribePortfolioShareType)

-- | Indicates whether the shared portfolio is imported by the recipient
--   account. If the recipient is in an organization node, the share is
--   automatically imported, and the field is always set to true.
portfolioShareDetail_accepted :: Lens' PortfolioShareDetail (Maybe Bool)

-- | The principal type. The supported value is <tt>IAM</tt>.
principal_principalType :: Lens' Principal (Maybe PrincipalType)

-- | The ARN of the principal (IAM user, role, or group).
principal_principalARN :: Lens' Principal (Maybe Text)

-- | The value of the product view aggregation.
productViewAggregationValue_value :: Lens' ProductViewAggregationValue (Maybe Text)

-- | An approximate count of the products that match the value.
productViewAggregationValue_approximateCount :: Lens' ProductViewAggregationValue (Maybe Int)

-- | The status of the product.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AVAILABLE</tt> - The product is ready for use.</li>
--   <li><tt>CREATING</tt> - Product creation has started; the product is
--   not ready for use.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> - An action failed.</li>
--   </ul>
productViewDetail_status :: Lens' ProductViewDetail (Maybe RequestStatus)

-- | Summary information about the product view.
productViewDetail_productViewSummary :: Lens' ProductViewDetail (Maybe ProductViewSummary)

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
productViewDetail_createdTime :: Lens' ProductViewDetail (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ARN of the product.
productViewDetail_productARN :: Lens' ProductViewDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The owner of the product. Contact the product administrator for the
--   significance of this value.
productViewSummary_owner :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL information to obtain support for this Product.
productViewSummary_supportUrl :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Short description of the product.
productViewSummary_shortDescription :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether the product has a default path. If the product does
--   not have a default path, call ListLaunchPaths to disambiguate between
--   paths. Otherwise, ListLaunchPaths is not required, and the output of
--   ProductViewSummary can be used directly with
--   DescribeProvisioningParameters.
productViewSummary_hasDefaultPath :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Bool)

-- | The distributor of the product. Contact the product administrator for
--   the significance of this value.
productViewSummary_distributor :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the product.
productViewSummary_name :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The product view identifier.
productViewSummary_id :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The product type. Contact the product administrator for the
--   significance of this value. If this value is <tt>MARKETPLACE</tt>, the
--   product was created by AWS Marketplace.
productViewSummary_type :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe ProductType)

-- | The email contact information to obtain support for this Product.
productViewSummary_supportEmail :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The product identifier.
productViewSummary_productId :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the support for this Product.
productViewSummary_supportDescription :: Lens' ProductViewSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If
--   multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same
--   response is returned for each repeated request.
provisionedProductAttribute_idempotencyToken :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The current status of the provisioned product.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AVAILABLE</tt> - Stable state, ready to perform any operation.
--   The most recent operation succeeded and completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNDER_CHANGE</tt> - Transitive state. Operations performed
--   might not have valid results. Wait for an <tt>AVAILABLE</tt> status
--   before performing operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>TAINTED</tt> - Stable state, ready to perform any operation.
--   The stack has completed the requested operation but is not exactly
--   what was requested. For example, a request to update to a new version
--   failed and the stack rolled back to the current version.</li>
--   <li><tt>ERROR</tt> - An unexpected error occurred. The provisioned
--   product exists but the stack is not running. For example,
--   CloudFormation received a parameter value that was not valid and could
--   not launch the stack.</li>
--   <li><tt>PLAN_IN_PROGRESS</tt> - Transitive state. The plan operations
--   were performed to provision a new product, but resources have not yet
--   been created. After reviewing the list of resources to be created,
--   execute the plan. Wait for an <tt>AVAILABLE</tt> status before
--   performing operations.</li>
--   </ul>
provisionedProductAttribute_status :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe ProvisionedProductStatus)

-- | The name of the product.
provisionedProductAttribute_productName :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The record identifier of the last successful request performed on this
--   provisioned product of the following types:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ProvisionedProduct</li>
--   <li>UpdateProvisionedProduct</li>
--   <li>ExecuteProvisionedProductPlan</li>
--   <li>TerminateProvisionedProduct</li>
--   </ul>
provisionedProductAttribute_lastSuccessfulProvisioningRecordId :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact.
provisionedProductAttribute_provisioningArtifactId :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the provisioned product.
provisionedProductAttribute_arn :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
provisionedProductAttribute_createdTime :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the provisioning artifact.
provisionedProductAttribute_provisioningArtifactName :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM user.
provisionedProductAttribute_userArn :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The current status message of the provisioned product.
provisionedProductAttribute_statusMessage :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The user-friendly name of the provisioned product.
provisionedProductAttribute_name :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The record identifier of the last request performed on this
--   provisioned product.
provisionedProductAttribute_lastRecordId :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the IAM user in the session. This ARN might contain a
--   session ID.
provisionedProductAttribute_userArnSession :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the provisioned product.
provisionedProductAttribute_id :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of provisioned product. The supported values are
--   <tt>CFN_STACK</tt> and <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt>.
provisionedProductAttribute_type :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The assigned identifier for the resource, such as an EC2 instance ID
--   or an S3 bucket name.
provisionedProductAttribute_physicalId :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The record identifier of the last request performed on this
--   provisioned product of the following types:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ProvisionedProduct</li>
--   <li>UpdateProvisionedProduct</li>
--   <li>ExecuteProvisionedProductPlan</li>
--   <li>TerminateProvisionedProduct</li>
--   </ul>
provisionedProductAttribute_lastProvisioningRecordId :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The product identifier.
provisionedProductAttribute_productId :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more tags.
provisionedProductAttribute_tags :: Lens' ProvisionedProductAttribute (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The ARN of the launch role associated with the provisioned product.
provisionedProductDetail_launchRoleArn :: Lens' ProvisionedProductDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If
--   multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same
--   response is returned for each repeated request.
provisionedProductDetail_idempotencyToken :: Lens' ProvisionedProductDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The current status of the provisioned product.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AVAILABLE</tt> - Stable state, ready to perform any operation.
--   The most recent operation succeeded and completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNDER_CHANGE</tt> - Transitive state. Operations performed
--   might not have valid results. Wait for an <tt>AVAILABLE</tt> status
--   before performing operations.</li>
--   <li><tt>TAINTED</tt> - Stable state, ready to perform any operation.
--   The stack has completed the requested operation but is not exactly
--   what was requested. For example, a request to update to a new version
--   failed and the stack rolled back to the current version.</li>
--   <li><tt>ERROR</tt> - An unexpected error occurred. The provisioned
--   product exists but the stack is not running. For example,
--   CloudFormation received a parameter value that was not valid and could
--   not launch the stack.</li>
--   <li><tt>PLAN_IN_PROGRESS</tt> - Transitive state. The plan operations
--   were performed to provision a new product, but resources have not yet
--   been created. After reviewing the list of resources to be created,
--   execute the plan. Wait for an <tt>AVAILABLE</tt> status before
--   performing operations.</li>
--   </ul>
provisionedProductDetail_status :: Lens' ProvisionedProductDetail (Maybe ProvisionedProductStatus)

-- | If this value is true, the value for this parameter is obfuscated from
--   view when the parameter is retrieved. This parameter is used to hide
--   sensitive information.
provisioningArtifactParameter_isNoEcho :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactParameter (Maybe Bool)

provisioningArtifactParameter_defaultValue :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the parameter.
provisioningArtifactParameter_description :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more AWS Regions where stack instances are deployed from the
--   stack set. These regions can be scoped in
--   <tt>ProvisioningPreferences$StackSetRegions</tt> and
--   <tt>UpdateProvisioningPreferences$StackSetRegions</tt>.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
provisioningArtifactPreferences_stackSetRegions :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactPreferences (Maybe [Text])

-- | One or more AWS accounts where stack instances are deployed from the
--   stack set. These accounts can be scoped in
--   <tt>ProvisioningPreferences$StackSetAccounts</tt> and
--   <tt>UpdateProvisioningPreferences$StackSetAccounts</tt>.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
provisioningArtifactPreferences_stackSetAccounts :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactPreferences (Maybe [Text])

-- | If set to true, AWS Service Catalog stops validating the specified
--   provisioning artifact even if it is invalid.
provisioningArtifactProperties_disableTemplateValidation :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactProperties (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the provisioning artifact (for example, v1 v2beta). No
--   spaces are allowed.
provisioningArtifactProperties_name :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactProperties (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of provisioning artifact.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CLOUD_FORMATION_TEMPLATE</tt> - AWS CloudFormation
--   template</li>
--   <li><tt>MARKETPLACE_AMI</tt> - AWS Marketplace AMI</li>
--   <li><tt>MARKETPLACE_CAR</tt> - AWS Marketplace Clusters and AWS
--   Resources</li>
--   </ul>
provisioningArtifactProperties_type :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactProperties (Maybe ProvisioningArtifactType)

-- | The description of the provisioning artifact, including how it differs
--   from the previous provisioning artifact.
provisioningArtifactProperties_description :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactProperties (Maybe Text)

-- | Specify the template source with one of the following options, but not
--   both. Keys accepted: [ <tt>LoadTemplateFromURL</tt>,
--   <tt>ImportFromPhysicalId</tt> ]
--   
--   The URL of the CloudFormation template in Amazon S3. Specify the URL
--   in JSON format as follows:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "LoadTemplateFromURL": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/cf-templates-ozkq9d3hgiq2-us-east-1/..."
--   </pre>
--   
--   <tt>ImportFromPhysicalId</tt>: The physical id of the resource that
--   contains the template. Currently only supports CloudFormation stack
--   arn. Specify the physical id in JSON format as follows:
--   <tt>ImportFromPhysicalId:
--   arn:aws:cloudformation:[us-east-1]:[accountId]:stack/[StackName]/[resourceId]</tt>
provisioningArtifactProperties_info :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactProperties (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The metadata for the provisioning artifact. This is used with AWS
--   Marketplace products.
provisioningArtifactSummary_provisioningArtifactMetadata :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactSummary (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
provisioningArtifactSummary_createdTime :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the provisioning artifact.
provisioningArtifactSummary_name :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact.
provisioningArtifactSummary_id :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the provisioning artifact.
provisioningArtifactSummary_description :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Summary information about a product view.
provisioningArtifactView_productViewSummary :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactView (Maybe ProductViewSummary)

-- | Information about a provisioning artifact. A provisioning artifact is
--   also known as a product version.
provisioningArtifactView_provisioningArtifact :: Lens' ProvisioningArtifactView (Maybe ProvisioningArtifact)

-- | The parameter value.
provisioningParameter_value :: Lens' ProvisioningParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | The parameter key.
provisioningParameter_key :: Lens' ProvisioningParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more AWS Regions where the provisioned product will be
--   available.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The specified regions should be within the list of regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of regions in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
provisioningPreferences_stackSetRegions :: Lens' ProvisioningPreferences (Maybe [Text])

-- | The maximum percentage of accounts in which to perform this operation
--   at one time.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   This is true except in cases where rounding down would result is zero.
--   In this case, AWS Service Catalog sets the number as <tt>1</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
provisioningPreferences_stackSetMaxConcurrencyPercentage :: Lens' ProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | The number of accounts, per region, for which this operation can fail
--   before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that region. If the
--   operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog doesn't attempt
--   the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>0</tt> if no value is specified.
provisioningPreferences_stackSetFailureToleranceCount :: Lens' ProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | The percentage of accounts, per region, for which this stack operation
--   can fail before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that
--   region. If the operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog
--   doesn't attempt the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
provisioningPreferences_stackSetFailureTolerancePercentage :: Lens' ProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | One or more AWS accounts where the provisioned product will be
--   available.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The specified accounts should be within the list of accounts from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of accounts in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all acounts from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
provisioningPreferences_stackSetAccounts :: Lens' ProvisioningPreferences (Maybe [Text])

-- | The maximum number of accounts in which to perform this operation at
--   one time. This is dependent on the value of
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> is at most one more than the
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
provisioningPreferences_stackSetMaxConcurrencyCount :: Lens' ProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | The ARN of the launch role associated with the provisioned product.
recordDetail_launchRoleArn :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the provisioned product.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CREATED</tt> - The request was created but the operation has
--   not started.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> - The requested operation is in
--   progress.</li>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS_IN_ERROR</tt> - The provisioned product is under
--   change but the requested operation failed and some remediation is
--   occurring. For example, a rollback.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCEEDED</tt> - The requested operation has successfully
--   completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> - The requested operation has unsuccessfully
--   completed. Investigate using the error messages returned.</li>
--   </ul>
recordDetail_status :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe RecordStatus)

-- | One or more tags.
recordDetail_recordTags :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe [RecordTag])

-- | The user-friendly name of the provisioned product.
recordDetail_provisionedProductName :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the provisioning artifact.
recordDetail_provisioningArtifactId :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The UTC time stamp of the creation time.
recordDetail_createdTime :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The record type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>PROVISION_PRODUCT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UPDATE_PROVISIONED_PRODUCT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TERMINATE_PROVISIONED_PRODUCT</pre></li>
--   </ul>
recordDetail_recordType :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the record.
recordDetail_recordId :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of provisioned product. The supported values are
--   <tt>CFN_STACK</tt> and <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt>.
recordDetail_provisionedProductType :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The time when the record was last updated.
recordDetail_updatedTime :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The path identifier.
recordDetail_pathId :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe Text)

recordDetail_provisionedProductId :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe Text)

recordDetail_recordErrors :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe [RecordError])

recordDetail_productId :: Lens' RecordDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The change scope.
resourceChange_scope :: Lens' ResourceChange (Maybe [ResourceAttribute])

resourceChange_details :: Lens' ResourceChange (Maybe [ResourceChangeDetail])

-- | If the change type is <tt>Modify</tt>, indicates whether the existing

resourceChange_replacement :: Lens' ResourceChange (Maybe Replacement)

resourceChangeDetail_causingEntity :: Lens' ResourceChangeDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | For static evaluations, the value of the resource attribute will
--   change and the new value is known. For dynamic evaluations, the value
--   might change, and any new value will be determined when the plan is
--   updated.
resourceChangeDetail_evaluation :: Lens' ResourceChangeDetail (Maybe EvaluationType)

resourceTargetDefinition_name :: Lens' ResourceTargetDefinition (Maybe Text)

--   with.

stackInstance_region :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the stack instance, in terms of its synchronization with
--   its associated stack set.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>INOPERABLE</tt>: A <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation has
--   failed and left the stack in an unstable state. Stacks in this state
--   are excluded from further <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operations. You
--   might need to perform a <tt>DeleteStackInstances</tt> operation, with
--   <tt>RetainStacks</tt> set to true, to delete the stack instance, and
--   then delete the stack manually.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUTDATED</tt>: The stack isn't currently up to date with the
--   stack set because either the associated stack failed during a
--   <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt> operation, or the
--   stack was part of a <tt>CreateStackSet</tt> or <tt>UpdateStackSet</tt>
--   operation that failed or was stopped before the stack was created or
--   updated.</li>
--   <li><tt>CURRENT</tt>: The stack is currently up to date with the stack
--   set.</li>
--   </ul>
stackInstance_stackInstanceStatus :: Lens' StackInstance (Maybe StackInstanceStatus)

--   value is kept.
updateProvisioningParameter_usePreviousValue :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningParameter (Maybe Bool)

-- | One or more AWS Regions where the provisioned product will be
--   available.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The specified regions should be within the list of regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of regions in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all regions from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetRegions :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe [Text])

-- | The maximum percentage of accounts in which to perform this operation
--   at one time.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   This is true except in cases where rounding down would result is zero.
--   In this case, AWS Service Catalog sets the number as <tt>1</tt>
--   instead.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetMaxConcurrencyPercentage :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | The number of accounts, per region, for which this operation can fail
--   before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that region. If the
--   operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog doesn't attempt
--   the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>0</tt> if no value is specified.
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetFailureToleranceCount :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | The percentage of accounts, per region, for which this stack operation
--   can fail before AWS Service Catalog stops the operation in that
--   region. If the operation is stopped in a region, AWS Service Catalog
--   doesn't attempt the operation in any subsequent regions.
--   
--   When calculating the number of accounts based on the specified
--   percentage, AWS Service Catalog rounds down to the next whole number.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetFailureTolerancePercentage</tt>, but not both.
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetFailureTolerancePercentage :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | One or more AWS accounts that will have access to the provisioned
--   product.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   The AWS accounts specified should be within the list of accounts in
--   the <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint. To get the list of accounts in the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint, use the
--   <tt>DescribeProvisioningParameters</tt> operation.
--   
--   If no values are specified, the default value is all accounts from the
--   <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetAccounts :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe [Text])

-- | The maximum number of accounts in which to perform this operation at
--   one time. This is dependent on the value of
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> is at most one more than the
--   <tt>StackSetFailureToleranceCount</tt>.
--   
--   Note that this setting lets you specify the maximum for operations.
--   For large deployments, under certain circumstances the actual number
--   of accounts acted upon concurrently may be lower due to service
--   throttling.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   Conditional: You must specify either
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentCount</tt> or
--   <tt>StackSetMaxConcurrentPercentage</tt>, but not both.
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetMaxConcurrencyCount :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe Natural)

-- | Determines what action AWS Service Catalog performs to a stack set or
--   a stack instance represented by the provisioned product. The default
--   value is <tt>UPDATE</tt> if nothing is specified.
--   
--   Applicable only to a <tt>CFN_STACKSET</tt> provisioned product type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>CREATE</i> Creates a new stack instance in the stack set
--   represented by the provisioned product. In this case, only new stack
--   instances are created based on accounts and regions; if new ProductId
--   or ProvisioningArtifactID are passed, they will be ignored.</li>
--   <li><i>UPDATE</i> Updates the stack set represented by the provisioned
--   product and also its stack instances.</li>
--   <li><i>DELETE</i> Deletes a stack instance in the stack set
--   represented by the provisioned product.</li>
--   </ul>
updateProvisioningPreferences_stackSetOperationType :: Lens' UpdateProvisioningPreferences (Maybe StackSetOperationType)

-- | The usage instruction value for this type.
usageInstruction_value :: Lens' UsageInstruction (Maybe Text)

-- | The usage instruction type for the value.
usageInstruction_type :: Lens' UsageInstruction (Maybe Text)

--   migration process has not been performed for this account. Please use

--   operation.

--   states before retrying the operation.

data UpdateConstraint
UpdateConstraint' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateConstraint

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateConstraint</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptLanguage:UpdateConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>updateConstraint_acceptLanguage</a> - The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameters:UpdateConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>updateConstraint_parameters</a> - The constraint parameters, in
--   JSON format. The syntax depends on the constraint type as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>LAUNCH</i> You are required to specify either the
--   <tt>RoleArn</tt> or the <tt>LocalRoleName</tt> but can't use
--   both.Specify the <tt>RoleArn</tt> property as follows:<pre>{"RoleArn"
--   : "arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/LaunchRole"}</pre>Specify the
--   <tt>LocalRoleName</tt> property as follows:<pre>{"LocalRoleName":
--   "SCBasicLaunchRole"}</pre>If you specify the <tt>LocalRoleName</tt>
--   property, when an account uses the launch constraint, the IAM role
--   with that name in the account will be used. This allows launch-role
--   constraints to be account-agnostic so the administrator can create
--   fewer resources per shared account.The given role name must exist in
--   the account used to create the launch constraint and the account of
--   the user who launches a product with this launch constraint.You cannot
--   have both a <tt>LAUNCH</tt> and a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.You
--   also cannot have more than one <tt>LAUNCH</tt> constraint on a product
--   and portfolio.</li>
--   <li><i>NOTIFICATION</i> Specify the <tt>NotificationArns</tt> property
--   as follows:<pre>{"NotificationArns" :
--   ["arn:aws:sns:us-east-1:123456789012:Topic"]}</pre></li>
--   <li><i>RESOURCE_UPDATE</i> Specify the
--   <tt>TagUpdatesOnProvisionedProduct</tt> property as
--   follows:<pre>{"Version":"2.0","Properties":{"TagUpdateOnProvisionedProduct":"String"}}</pre>The
--   <tt>TagUpdatesOnProvisionedProduct</tt> property accepts a string
--   value of <tt>ALLOWED</tt> or <tt>NOT_ALLOWED</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>STACKSET</i> Specify the <tt>Parameters</tt> property as
--   follows:<pre>{"Version": "String", "Properties": {"AccountList": [
--   "String" ], "RegionList": [ "String" ], "AdminRole": "String",
--   "ExecutionRole": "String"}}</pre>You cannot have both a
--   <tt>LAUNCH</tt> and a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.You also cannot
--   have more than one <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint on a product and
--   portfolio.Products with a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint will launch an
--   AWS CloudFormation stack set.</li>
--   <li><i>TEMPLATE</i> Specify the <tt>Rules</tt> property. For more
--   information, see <a>Template Constraint Rules</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:UpdateConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>updateConstraint_description</a> - The updated description of the
--   constraint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:UpdateConstraint'</a>, <a>updateConstraint_id</a> - The
--   identifier of the constraint.
newUpdateConstraint :: Text -> UpdateConstraint

--   <tt>ProvisionedProductName</tt> and <tt>ProvisionedProductId</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retainPhysicalResources:TerminateProvisionedProduct'</a>,
--   <a>terminateProvisionedProduct_retainPhysicalResources</a> - When this
--   boolean parameter is set to true, the
--   <tt>TerminateProvisionedProduct</tt> API deletes the Service Catalog
--   provisioned product. However, it does not remove the CloudFormation
--   stack, stack set, or the underlying resources of the deleted
--   provisioned product. The default value is false.

--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:ignoreErrors:TerminateProvisionedProduct'</a>,
--   <a>terminateProvisionedProduct_ignoreErrors</a> - If set to true, AWS
--   Service Catalog stops managing the specified provisioned product even
--   if it cannot delete the underlying resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedProductId:TerminateProvisionedProduct'</a>,
--   <a>terminateProvisionedProduct_provisionedProductId</a> - The
--   identifier of the provisioned product. You cannot specify both
--   <tt>ProvisionedProductName</tt> and <tt>ProvisionedProductId</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:terminateToken:TerminateProvisionedProduct'</a>,
--   <a>terminateProvisionedProduct_terminateToken</a> - An idempotency
--   token that uniquely identifies the termination request. This token is
--   only valid during the termination process. After the provisioned
--   product is terminated, subsequent requests to terminate the same
--   provisioned product always return <b>ResourceNotFound</b>.
newTerminateProvisionedProduct :: Text -> TerminateProvisionedProduct

--

--   You must provide the name or ID, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedProductName:UpdateProvisionedProduct'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisionedProduct_provisionedProductName</a> - The name of
--   the provisioned product. You cannot specify both
--   <tt>ProvisionedProductName</tt> and <tt>ProvisionedProductId</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisioningArtifactId:UpdateProvisionedProduct'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisionedProduct_provisioningArtifactId</a> - The
--   identifier of the provisioning artifact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisioningArtifactName:UpdateProvisionedProduct'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisionedProduct_provisioningArtifactName</a> - The name of
--   the provisioning artifact. You must provide the name or ID, but not
--   both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pathName:UpdateProvisionedProduct'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisionedProduct_pathName</a> - The name of the path. You
--   must provide the name or ID, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptLanguage:UpdateProvisionedProduct'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisionedProduct_acceptLanguage</a> - The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:pathId:UpdateProvisionedProduct'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisionedProduct_pathId</a> - The path identifier. This
--   value is optional if the product has a default path, and required if
--   the product has more than one path. You must provide the name or ID,
--   but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisioningParameters:UpdateProvisionedProduct'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisionedProduct_provisioningParameters</a> - The new
--   parameters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedProductId:UpdateProvisionedProduct'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisionedProduct_provisionedProductId</a> - The identifier
--   of the provisioned product. You must provide the name or ID, but not
--   both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productId:UpdateProvisionedProduct'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisionedProduct_productId</a> - The identifier of the
--   product. You must provide the name or ID, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:UpdateProvisionedProduct'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisionedProduct_tags</a> - One or more tags. Requires the
--   product to have <tt>RESOURCE_UPDATE</tt> constraint with
--   <tt>TagUpdatesOnProvisionedProduct</tt> set to <tt>ALLOWED</tt> to
--   allow tag updates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisioningPreferences:UpdateProvisionedProduct'</a>,

--   that contains information about the provisioning preferences for a
--   stack set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updateToken:UpdateProvisionedProduct'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisionedProduct_updateToken</a> - The idempotency token
--   that uniquely identifies the provisioning update request.
newUpdateProvisionedProduct :: Text -> UpdateProvisionedProduct

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateConstraint</a> smart constructor.
data CreateConstraint
CreateConstraint' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateConstraint

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateConstraint</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptLanguage:CreateConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>createConstraint_acceptLanguage</a> - The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CreateConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>createConstraint_description</a> - The description of the
--   constraint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:portfolioId:CreateConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>createConstraint_portfolioId</a> - The portfolio identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productId:CreateConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>createConstraint_productId</a> - The product identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameters:CreateConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>createConstraint_parameters</a> - The constraint parameters, in
--   JSON format. The syntax depends on the constraint type as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>LAUNCH</i> You are required to specify either the
--   <tt>RoleArn</tt> or the <tt>LocalRoleName</tt> but can't use
--   both.Specify the <tt>RoleArn</tt> property as follows:<pre>{"RoleArn"
--   : "arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/LaunchRole"}</pre>Specify the
--   <tt>LocalRoleName</tt> property as follows:<pre>{"LocalRoleName":
--   "SCBasicLaunchRole"}</pre>If you specify the <tt>LocalRoleName</tt>
--   property, when an account uses the launch constraint, the IAM role
--   with that name in the account will be used. This allows launch-role
--   constraints to be account-agnostic so the administrator can create
--   fewer resources per shared account.The given role name must exist in
--   the account used to create the launch constraint and the account of
--   the user who launches a product with this launch constraint.You cannot
--   have both a <tt>LAUNCH</tt> and a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.You
--   also cannot have more than one <tt>LAUNCH</tt> constraint on a product
--   and portfolio.</li>
--   <li><i>NOTIFICATION</i> Specify the <tt>NotificationArns</tt> property
--   as follows:<pre>{"NotificationArns" :
--   ["arn:aws:sns:us-east-1:123456789012:Topic"]}</pre></li>
--   <li><i>RESOURCE_UPDATE</i> Specify the
--   <tt>TagUpdatesOnProvisionedProduct</tt> property as
--   follows:<pre>{"Version":"2.0","Properties":{"TagUpdateOnProvisionedProduct":"String"}}</pre>The
--   <tt>TagUpdatesOnProvisionedProduct</tt> property accepts a string
--   value of <tt>ALLOWED</tt> or <tt>NOT_ALLOWED</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>STACKSET</i> Specify the <tt>Parameters</tt> property as
--   follows:<pre>{"Version": "String", "Properties": {"AccountList": [
--   "String" ], "RegionList": [ "String" ], "AdminRole": "String",
--   "ExecutionRole": "String"}}</pre>You cannot have both a
--   <tt>LAUNCH</tt> and a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint.You also cannot
--   have more than one <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint on a product and
--   portfolio.Products with a <tt>STACKSET</tt> constraint will launch an
--   AWS CloudFormation stack set.</li>
--   <li><i>TEMPLATE</i> Specify the <tt>Rules</tt> property. For more
--   information, see <a>Template Constraint Rules</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':CreateConstraint'</a>, <a>createConstraint_type</a> -
--   The type of constraint.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LAUNCH</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NOTIFICATION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>RESOURCE_UPDATE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>STACKSET</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TEMPLATE</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:idempotencyToken:CreateConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>createConstraint_idempotencyToken</a> - A unique identifier that
--   you provide to ensure idempotency. If multiple requests differ only by
--   the idempotency token, the same response is returned for each repeated
--   request.
newCreateConstraint :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateConstraint

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateConstraintResponse</a> smart constructor.

-- | Create a value of <a>AcceptPortfolioShare</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:portfolioShareType:AcceptPortfolioShare'</a>,
--   <a>acceptPortfolioShare_portfolioShareType</a> - The type of shared
--   portfolios to accept. The default is to accept imported portfolios.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_ORGANIZATIONS</tt> - Accept portfolios shared by the
--   management account of your organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>IMPORTED</tt> - Accept imported portfolios.</li>
--   <li><tt>AWS_SERVICECATALOG</tt> - Not supported. (Throws
--   ResourceNotFoundException.)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For example, <tt>aws servicecatalog accept-portfolio-share
--   --portfolio-id "port-2qwzkwxt3y5fk" --portfolio-share-type
--   AWS_ORGANIZATIONS</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptLanguage:AcceptPortfolioShare'</a>,
--   <a>acceptPortfolioShare_acceptLanguage</a> - The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:portfolioId:AcceptPortfolioShare'</a>,
--   <a>acceptPortfolioShare_portfolioId</a> - The portfolio identifier.
newAcceptPortfolioShare :: Text -> AcceptPortfolioShare

data ProvisionProduct
ProvisionProduct' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [ProvisioningParameter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe ProvisioningPreferences -> Text -> Text -> ProvisionProduct

-- | Create a value of <a>ProvisionProduct</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:productName:ProvisionProduct'</a>,
--   <a>provisionProduct_productName</a> - The name of the product. You
--   must provide the name or ID, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisioningArtifactId:ProvisionProduct'</a>,
--   <a>provisionProduct_provisioningArtifactId</a> - The identifier of the
--   provisioning artifact. You must provide the name or ID, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisioningArtifactName:ProvisionProduct'</a>,
--   <a>provisionProduct_provisioningArtifactName</a> - The name of the
--   provisioning artifact. You must provide the name or ID, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationArns:ProvisionProduct'</a>,
--   <a>provisionProduct_notificationArns</a> - Passed to CloudFormation.
--   The SNS topic ARNs to which to publish stack-related events.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pathName:ProvisionProduct'</a>,
--   <a>provisionProduct_pathName</a> - The name of the path. You must
--   provide the name or ID, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptLanguage:ProvisionProduct'</a>,
--   <a>provisionProduct_acceptLanguage</a> - The language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:pathId:ProvisionProduct'</a>, <a>provisionProduct_pathId</a> -
--   The path identifier of the product. This value is optional if the
--   product has a default path, and required if the product has more than
--   one path. To list the paths for a product, use ListLaunchPaths. You
--   must provide the name or ID, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisioningParameters:ProvisionProduct'</a>,
--   <a>provisionProduct_provisioningParameters</a> - Parameters specified
--   by the administrator that are required for provisioning the product.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productId:ProvisionProduct'</a>,
--   <a>provisionProduct_productId</a> - The product identifier. You must
--   provide the name or ID, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ProvisionProduct'</a>, <a>provisionProduct_tags</a> - One
--   or more tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisioningPreferences:ProvisionProduct'</a>,
--   <a>provisionProduct_provisioningPreferences</a> - An object that
--   contains information about the provisioning preferences for a stack
--   set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedProductName:ProvisionProduct'</a>,
--   <a>provisionProduct_provisionedProductName</a> - A user-friendly name
--   for the provisioned product. This value must be unique for the AWS
--   account and cannot be updated after the product is provisioned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionToken:ProvisionProduct'</a>,
--   <a>provisionProduct_provisionToken</a> - An idempotency token that
--   uniquely identifies the provisioning request.
newProvisionProduct :: Text -> Text -> ProvisionProduct

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateProvisionedProductProperties</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateProvisionedProductProperties
UpdateProvisionedProductProperties' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> HashMap PropertyKey Text -> Text -> UpdateProvisionedProductProperties

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateProvisionedProductProperties</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptLanguage:UpdateProvisionedProductProperties'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisionedProductProperties_acceptLanguage</a> - The
--   language code.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>
--   <li><tt>jp</tt> - Japanese</li>
--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedProductId:UpdateProvisionedProductProperties'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisionedProductProperties_provisionedProductId</a> - The
--   identifier of the provisioned product.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:provisionedProductProperties:UpdateProvisionedProductProperties'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisionedProductProperties_provisionedProductProperties</a>
--   - A map that contains the provisioned product properties to be
--   updated.
--   
--   The <tt>LAUNCH_ROLE</tt> key accepts role ARNs. This key allows an
--   administrator to call <tt>UpdateProvisionedProductProperties</tt> to
--   update the launch role that is associated with a provisioned product.
--   This role is used when an end user calls a provisioning operation such
--   as <tt>UpdateProvisionedProduct</tt>,
--   <tt>TerminateProvisionedProduct</tt>, or
--   <tt>ExecuteProvisionedProductServiceAction</tt>. Only a role ARN is
--   valid. A user ARN is invalid.
--   
--   The <tt>OWNER</tt> key accepts user ARNs and role ARNs. The owner is
--   the user that has permission to see, update, terminate, and execute
--   service actions in the provisioned product.
--   
--   The administrator can change the owner of a provisioned product to
--   another IAM user within the same account. Both end user owners and
--   administrators can see ownership history of the provisioned product
--   using the <tt>ListRecordHistory</tt> API. The new owner can describe
--   all past records for the provisioned product using the
--   <tt>DescribeRecord</tt> API. The previous owner can no longer use
--   <tt>DescribeRecord</tt>, but can still see the product's history from
--   when he was an owner using <tt>ListRecordHistory</tt>.
--   
--   If a provisioned product ownership is assigned to an end user, they
--   can see and perform any action through the API or Service Catalog
--   console such as update, terminate, and execute service actions. If an
--   end user provisions a product and the owner is updated to someone
--   else, they will no longer be able to see or perform any actions
--   through API or the Service Catalog console on that provisioned
--   product.
--   
--   <a>$sel:idempotencyToken:UpdateProvisionedProductProperties'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisionedProductProperties_idempotencyToken</a> - The
--   idempotency token that uniquely identifies the provisioning product
--   update request.
newUpdateProvisionedProductProperties :: Text -> Text -> UpdateProvisionedProductProperties

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateProvisionedProductPropertiesResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateProvisionedProductPropertiesResponse

--   product. By default, a new product is created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceProvisioningArtifactIdentifiers:CopyProduct'</a>,
--   <a>copyProduct_sourceProvisioningArtifactIdentifiers</a> - The
--   identifiers of the provisioning artifacts (also known as versions) of
--   the product to copy. By default, all provisioning artifacts are
--   copied.
--

--   <a>copyProduct_targetProductName</a> - A name for the target product.
--   The default is the name of the source product.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copyOptions:CopyProduct'</a>, <a>copyProduct_copyOptions</a> -
--   The copy options. If the value is <tt>CopyTags</tt>, the tags from the
--   source product are copied to the target product.

--   <li><tt>en</tt> - English (default)</li>

--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceProductArn:CopyProduct'</a>,
--   <a>copyProduct_sourceProductArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the source product.
--   
--   <a>$sel:idempotencyToken:CopyProduct'</a>,
--   <a>copyProduct_idempotencyToken</a> - A unique identifier that you
--   provide to ensure idempotency. If multiple requests differ only by the
--   idempotency token, the same response is returned for each repeated
--   request.
newCopyProduct :: Text -> Text -> CopyProduct

--   cannot launch or update a provisioned product from an inactive
--   provisioning artifact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateProvisioningArtifact'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningArtifact_name</a> - The updated name of the

--   <li><tt>zh</tt> - Chinese</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:guidance:UpdateProvisioningArtifact'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningArtifact_guidance</a> - Information set by the
--   administrator to provide guidance to end users about which
--   provisioning artifacts to use.
--   
--   The <tt>DEFAULT</tt> value indicates that the product version is
--   active.
--   
--   The administrator can set the guidance to <tt>DEPRECATED</tt> to
--   inform users that the product version is deprecated. Users are able to
--   make updates to a provisioned product of a deprecated version but
--   cannot launch new provisioned products using a deprecated version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:UpdateProvisioningArtifact'</a>,
--   <a>updateProvisioningArtifact_description</a> - The updated
--   description of the provisioning artifact.

DescribePortfolioShares' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> DescribePortfolioShareType -> DescribePortfolioShares

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribePortfolioShares</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageToken:DescribePortfolioShares'</a>,
--   <a>describePortfolioShares_pageToken</a> - The page token for the next
--   set of results. To retrieve the first set of results, use null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageSize:DescribePortfolioShares'</a>,
--   <a>describePortfolioShares_pageSize</a> - The maximum number of items
--   to return with this call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:portfolioId:DescribePortfolioShares'</a>,
--   <a>describePortfolioShares_portfolioId</a> - The unique identifier of
--   the portfolio for which shares will be retrieved.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':DescribePortfolioShares'</a>,
--   <a>describePortfolioShares_type</a> - The type of portfolio share to
--   summarize. This field acts as a filter on the type of portfolio share,
--   which can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li><tt>ACCOUNT</tt> - Represents an external account to account
--   share.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATION</tt> - Represents a share to an organization.
--   This share is available to every account in the organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATIONAL_UNIT</tt> - Represents a share to an
--   organizational unit.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATION_MEMBER_ACCOUNT</tt> - Represents a share to an
--   account in the organization.</li>
--   </ol>
newDescribePortfolioShares :: Text -> DescribePortfolioShareType -> DescribePortfolioShares
